text: Taste: woody, spiced resin notes with tropical hops. Dry hopped and slightly boozy nose. Orange/Amber color, mostly clear, with foamy white head and ringed lattice. Medium/full body. Dry it is.
Pours dark gold with one finger off white head. The nose is mango and orange peel. The taste is citrus, toffee grapefruit. A bit sweet and astringent. I think not very fresh.
Bitter resin with slight hints of lemon. Full-bodied and creamy. Always solid.
Trübes Bernstein mit sehr guter Schaumkrone. Herrlicher Duft. Super fruchtiger Körper mit harmonischer Hopfenbittere. Der Alkohol wird gekonnt versteckt!

9.5%ABV. Double IPA.

Poured out light amber. 12SRM.

Nose is pine and spicy with cilantro and scallion.
Sweet nose suggesting nice clean malty body that is full bodied and syrupy. It gets me in the mood to taste some big hop flavor.

Mouthfeel is syrupy and soapy. Palate is malted candy, corn syrup. hops are pine, pine sap, citrus peel, citrus oil.

Finish is medium with a lingering citrus oil flavor.

Overall, one of those sweet malt, dry hopped affairs for me. I dont hate it, but my palate at the time of this review wants to have more bready heft which means more body, this sweet has not much body which means you get a 2 track tasting, big hops and big sweet malt and nothing to fill the void in between.
Clean and refined bright copper color with an eggshell colored head of soapy white foam. Caramelized grapfruit character throughout with a tangy orange and reserved pine dryness in the finish.

Bottle from Blackfriars. Outstanding. Chewy, pineapple and pine and lovely lingering hops and resin. Big orange smell, enticing deep orange colour. Absolutely one of the best Imperial IPAs Ive tried.

Bottle pour from One Stop Market. Appearance is clear amber with tons of sparkle, finger-width foamy white head with good retention and lots of sudsy lacing. Aroma is tropical fruit, grapefruit, citrus and dank, resinous hops. Taste is strong bitter dank resin with tropical fruits, citrus and late bready, biscuity malt base. Palate is light-bodied with thin texture, average carbonation and bitter over sweet finish. Overall, as advertised, this excels all around. That said, many have emulated this so it is not as unique as it may have once been. Maybe thats enough reason to retire it? A little too bitter dominant for me.

650 ml bottle from Canada Craft Club. Pours a clear golden orange with moderate-sized white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, sweet caramel, candy sugar and biscuit. Flavour is big on sweet caramel maltiness, some biscuit, grapefruit, tangerine, light pine and some candy sugar. Fine carbonation. Nice.

Thanks to Canada Craft Club.
Les premières notes de son olfactif sont assez maltées, avec du biscuit type Social Tea. Perception légère de fruits tropicaux et dorange. Gazon en toile de fond. Mais son profil malté est très en évidence. Limpidité du liquide. Couleur ambrée / cuivrée. Énorme mousse persistante et rocailleuse qui colle très bien au verre. Entrée de bouche avec des fruits tropicaux et une chaleur dalcool. Les notes sont dorange, de mangue, de pamplemousse, de gazon, de biscuit, de résine en finale. En général cette bière est délicieuse, sauf que son profil malté et sucré la désavantage du coté technique. Jaurais préféré une amertume plus prononcée. Elle aurait pu être une grande bière.

Thank you Misawa AB AAFES Shopette! Orange hued clear with creamy short lived head. Nice pine resin hops with rich malty backbone. Chewy malt, lip-smackingly sweet with intense hops, citrus, floral.....wow, this packs tons of flavor into a 12 oz bottle! Very well balanced, thick body, what more could you ask for? This is a damned good beer!

Pours golden color, haze with foamy white head. Aroma: intense hop notes, which takes on citruses, especially grapefruit, hint of ranferine, pine...flavor is similar, with intense hop profile, which takes on fruits mentioned above, supported with biscuit & toffee like malt backbone. Hop bitterness is very high but still perfectly balanced with malt backbone. Finish is dry, bitter, bitterness lingers in aftertaste. Body is medium, texture is smooth, carbonation is medium.

Golden Klar im glas, angenehme kohlensäure, cremiger leicht eingetrübter schaum, angenehm fruchtig süss in der nase, schönes mündgefühl, voller körper, solide fruchtige bittere im abgang, alkohol leicht merkbar, trotz imperial relativ ausgewogen
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Smak chmielowy i solidna, przyjemna goryczka - wszystko pierwsza klasa.
Hoppy nose. Amber color. Cedar citrus and booze. Maybe cloves at finish. Thicker mouth feel.

650ml bottle from Elizabeth Station at Ilyas. Bottled on 21-Jul-2016. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is candied citruses, some cold tea notes. Taste is very fruity, similar to the aroma. Still veeeery good.
Bottle into snifter. Pours a hazy golden colour with white head. Aroma is big citrus and some candy sweetness. Taste is grapefruit and tangerine and candy sweetness.

poured from a bottle. slight head but more lacing than expected. clear to slightly hazy amber appearance, a good amount of effervescence. Citrusy notes, creamy yet tangy on the taste, tangerine and orange flavors, strong, good beer.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2016 Mooi goudblond/licht oranje bier met parelende witte schuimkraag die snel wegebt. Fruitig aroma (perzik, geel fruit, meloen). Beetje harsig van smaak. Goed hoppig met smaken van tropisch fruit, ananas, appelsien, lychee, cirrus, lime. Lange warme afdronk. Zeer goede ipa.

Bottle @ "Frikicata Cervezorama", Sr. Lúpulo, Gijón. 24-01-2015.
12fl oz bottle. Bottled: 25-09-2014.
Pours hazy dark gold with nice white head. Fruity, herbal, subtle malty nose. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is quite bitter, herbal, fruity, some malty character, little sweetness. Robust beer, but still quite well balanced. Very enjoyable.
A pre-Burlinton Winter Beer Fest brew from 2014. Heavy on the malt and boozy goodness, with some citrus and pine bitterness lingering in the background. Great beer.

Bottle. Strong grapefruit, orange and floral aroma. Golden/copper in colour with a large frothy white head. Sharp citrus hop flavour well balanced by earthy malt notes. Medium to full body. Very bitter finish. Excellent.
1.12.216 0,65 L Flasche. Goldgelb mit rötlichem Farbstich, klar, weisser stabiler Schaum. Aroma: Karamell, Ananas, Pinie. Antrunk : Malzig , fruchtig , bitter - toll ausgewogen!

Fairly aged bottle for an IPA (10/6/16), yet still I find myself enjoying this. Deep golden-bronze pour. This one has malted up a little bit with age, but you still get some great herbal and piney notes, apricot, grapefruit juice and lemon zest, bright and sweet violet notes as well. Very unique. Syrupy malty apricot notes with piney eucalyptus, biting resin, dense peach. Malt with resin provides a synergistic flavor resulting in earthy cedar. Even old as hell, still a great IPA for the winter months. Full body with a bite!

12oz bottle at home bought a week ago from Beergonzo online shop. Bottled (I assume) 09/04/2015 (ok :P). orange clear color, small white head. smells old hoppy, spices, candy, lightly fruity, some mango, bit peppery. still nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of exotic fruits, mango, candy, dried fruits, candy, bit earthy, light cocoa notes. finishes lightly dry and lightly bitter with notes of dried fruits, candy and some mango. wow, this beer is old and its still nicely drinkable (and i am not a sucker for those old sherry bombs). surprisingly drinkable.

Aroma: pine and resin, citrus, sweet notes.
Appearance: hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: medium pine bitterness, citurs notes, balanced, nice malty backbone, semi-dry, alcohol is well-covered.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: It is a really good DIPA, nicely balanced and drinkable.
pours golden, fantastic grapefruit and tangerine hops.Great on the tongue, pine. Beautiful balanced DIPA

Bottle 0,65l. Pours a golden colour, lightly hazy. Aroma has a little sweetness with a mix of citrus peels. Taste of fruit, some malt sweetness, alcohol, mandarin, grapefruit, tropical notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap in Kittery, Maine. A beautiful, clean DIPA in the classic "West Coast" style that reminds me a lot of Pliny the Elder. Theres a nice bit of sweet malt backbone, but it never gets too prominent or overpowering, and the hop profile is pine and grapefruit. One hell of a nice, classic DIPA.

Bottle from Cornelius. OK, this is about as good as IPA gets. Big citrus, fruit and pine aromas with lots of floral stuff going on too. Smells like expensive aftershave. Pours clear deep gold/amber with a lovely texture too it, frothy floral tasting head. Full mouthfeel but not over thick or sticky. Big flavours of hops, citrus, pine, big herbal hit (rosemary, basil). Fantastic.

2016-10-07 Sample from bottle @ Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival. Loads of hops balanced with a caramel sweet, round body. Grapefruit, grass and flowers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.65 l bottle from EDEKA Preller (Breckerfeld), bottled in April 2016. Clear, orangeish amber with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, dank, very fruity and moderately resiny aroma of orange, mango, passion fruit, honeyish malts and some pine. Sweetish, already slightly bitter, juicy, fruity and slightly resiny taste of orange jam, apricot, some mango, honey and pine, followed by a medium long, rather dry-bitter, resiny finish. Full body, creamy, almost oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Great stuff!

650ml brown bottle. Golden colour, lightly hazy. Holds a strong white head, lots of sticky lace in the glass. Nose - a little sweetness with a mix of citrus peels. Taste - a little fruitiness, some malt sweetness, mandarin, grapefruit, tropical notes. Finish has some sweetness and tropical fruit and citrus. Smooth mouth feel and medium bodied. big, still balanced and an exceptional example of the style. This is a beer I will be revisiting many times.

- bernstein-farben mit guter, schnell zerfallender Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Citrusfrüchten aller Art, Honig, Karamell, etwas Minze und Kokos,
 Vanille, Rosinen und eine Idee Kiefernadeln
- absolut harmonische und zurückhaltende Carbonisierung
- durch die vorbildliche Carbonisierung erzeugt der Antrunk sofort ein wunderbar,
 ölig-samtenes Mundgefühl
- der Alkohol ist bemerkenswert versteckt und macht sich zu keiner Zeit bemerkbar
- das Malzbett umschließt zu jeder Zeit umschmeichelnd die Hopfenbitternis
- natürlich ist es ein Double IPA und die Hopfenbitternis bildet den Stamm des
 Geschmacks, aber alle beschriebenen Noten bilden das perfekte Gerüst 
- vom Mittelteil bis zum Abgang zeigt das Bier eine unnachahmliche Verbindung
 aller Aromen welche ein Bier dieses Typs hervorbringen kann
Fazit: Perfektes Double IPA

Bottle @home (Euro-vision 2016 tasting.) Pours amber with a white head. Nose is pine/resin massive pine air freshener, grapefruit. Taste is along the same lines massive citrus fruits, bitter at first then you get some caramel/pineapple sweetness.
From a bottle. Aroma is citrus, mostly grapefruit with some pine and earthiness. Bitter and crisp tasting.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, honey, orange, pine, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Hazy golden/amber beer with a slight/medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, honey, orange and pine; ends slightly/medium bitter and dry with with hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. The aroma could have been intenser. Shame that this beer is filtered, that hurts the appearance a lot. Taste and palate are great however, so that makes this beer great nonetheless.

ok, so yea this beer is just bonkers. so good that im down to my last 2 sips forgoing the words till now so ill pull a fest review on an amount of beer that will evaporate quicker than one can properly review. stupid good everywhere - tropics papaya, melon, pine, grapefreuit, orangly things, marmalade, caramel and bisctui. Very cool spice from the get go. will actually rereview even at the totally retarded 13$ price tag. That revisitation will go against fat tug for the reason to see how good FT is vs this on a price point.

330ml bottle. Pours a very clear golden with an tightly packed, off white head that retains about 1/2 cm. Aromas of pine resin, citrus, some spice, bready malt. Palate is medium-high carbonation, medium-light body. Flavour of sweet malt, fruity hops and a balanced bitter finish that lingers. So balanced and drinkable for 9.5% its scary.

Deep golden color with a taller, lasting, light beige head. Huge pine and citrus aromas. Hints of sweet malt and caramel in the background. A pure hopshead scent that I can not find much fault in. Flavors are of a strong IIPA, with sweet pale malt in the front, some pine and citrus (especially zest) in the middle and a slow return of caramel in the finish and a fairly sharp stingy linger. I find myself going back and forth with this one. Balanced, yet not quite stable. Traditional, yet over the top hops at times. Very good, but not quite great. 12/10

I tend to find many of these American Double IPAs quite imbalanced, with the alcohol taking too strong a hold of the beer. This one however just about gets it right. Golden orange colour and a fantastic fresh fruity smell. The taste doesnt disappoint, as a well made brew lets the high alcohol through without being overawed. Well done.

Pours beautiful clear light golden orange. Medium light head. Aroma is intense tangerine grapefruit orange. Some pine.  Tastes starts with fruit and malt, then bitterness comes out. The malt restrains the bitterness, until the finish when the bitterness comes through more. Mouthfeel is good. Taste may be a bit too bitter for me, and the alcohol is not completely hidden. But the appearance and aroma set thus beer apart.

First tasting in Italy and went straight to the top. Big resinous beer with loads of pine and tropical aromas and taste. Bitter from start to finish, great length and residual resin on the pallet reminds you of how good it was, and to go back for more!

Surprised to see this on-tap in Italy. Travelled well with the unmistakable big DIPA nose of stone fruits, mangos pine. Deep yellow pour and small white head. Big body of resin / stone fruits and nice malt build. Solid length and lingering resin on the pallet.

75cl bottle split with SimonBlok. Pours a hazy orange with a slight shade of brown, mediocre off white head which deminishes to a thin soapy layer on top which leaves a bit of lacing on the glass. Aroma of peach, grapefruit, orange, mango, pineapple, pine. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter with a medium dry finish which becomes sweeter. Notes of grass, hops, pine, honey, spices in the finish, floral, malt. Texture is oily, medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

75cl bottle, thanks to Gyhallmanti. Appearance: hazy orangy golden with medium off-white head. Aroma: tangerine, grapefruit, orange juice, mango, pine, caramel. Taste: fairly high sweetness with high bitterness. Notes of tangerine, orange zest, tropical fruits, honey, caramel. Finish is bitter yet soft due to the sweet lacing it leaves on the tongue. The warmer it gets, the warmer the taste becomes. Palate: medium bodied, oily, but sticky texture and medium carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2016 Aroma- guava, papaya, pineapple, grapefruit, tangerine Appearance- copper with very thick lacing. Thin sheet of persistent head. Taste- grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, pine, CarraMalt, booze. Palate- medium bodied, with above average carbonation finishes dry and bitter. Overall- fantastic DIPA. One of the best Ive had. Balanced malt and hop profiles and manages to not be overly sweet or boozy. Recommended.

Bottle from Beergium, bottled in june. Pours clear amber with creamy, white head. Aroma of piney hops, caramel, cake batter, some cereal grass and herbs. Aroma is sweetish cake/dough with floral notes, some herbs and spices and light piney hops. Would like to try this again a bit fresher. Quite decent though.

Served in 12oz tulip glass at Beer Revolution in Edmonton, a copper color with a finger of white head leaving spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is grapefruit and pine with some hints of caramel and mild cereal grains. Taste is a grapefruit and pine hop bitterness with a light fruity and caramel malty sweetness. Full bodied brew with good carbonation that pleases the palate. Overall, a nice bold DIPA that is sure to satisfy most hop lovers out there.

From a 22 oz bottle into my North Coast Straght No Chaser chalice.. Pours gold-amber with head and lace. Aroma of grapefruit rind and zest, grains, amber malts. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of rich malts, straw hops, grapefruit rind, slight pine sap, bubbly fizzy wizzy hop juice. Overall big, bold, flavorful and somewhat tantalizingly fruity. Difficult for many, but "tastefully whip me more" for some hop heads.

Biondo scuro limpidissima, schiuma di buona persistenza e funky. Ottimo aroma secco e amaro. Splendida al palato con perfetto equilibrio tra dolcezza del malto e luppolo. Fruttata e molto piacevole. Da ricordare.

12 OZ bottle
Appearance: Clear golden with short lasting white head.
Aroma; Grapefruit, tangerine, marmalade, lots of sugary notes, caramel and vanilla biscuit tones and a hint of floralness. Taste: Sweetish with a good hoppy bitterrness. Taste follows the aroma. Above average body, average carbonation.
Bottle. Golden amber color. Aroma: honey nectar from tropical fruit, a little citrus. Taste: sweet nectar, good hop bitterness, fruit, citrus, warming, very good.

Rating #1974 2015.09.26 #CraftTakesSeattle Day 3, Beer 75
Pours a golden amber, with a bubbly tan head. Aroma is citrusy, tangeriney hops predominant. Taste is extremely hoppy, lots of cool citrus notes - mild tropical, mild pine, mild orange zest. Extraordinarily balanced - the sweet, earthy, herbal notes and sweet caramel malt met with doses of bitterness, and they all linger into the finish. Really awesome double IPA worthy of most of the hype.

Bottle from Brussels at home. Pours a clear orange with an off-white head and lacings. Sweet and bitter with lots of hops aromas. Spruce and some floral notes. Also malty notes of pale malts with hints of caramel and alcohol. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Long and quite bitter finish. Id like to taste a fresh bottle too.

Draught at The White Horse, Parsons Green, London. Clear amber, medium white head. Bready and honeyish malt aroma, slightly alcoholic, pretty weak piney and perfumy hops. Full bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness. A bit tired and cloying.
This is a jem of a beer if you like the beers that are heavy and intricate. It is like wine, and has many taste phases. Certainly not for the casual beer drinker.

Light copper pour, decent head that shifts to a sheen. Nose is orange, caramel, and alcohol. Bitter. Middle is caramel, orange (pith and zest), and cantaloupe. Finish is long and powerfully bitter. One at a time.

Bottle from World Beer Market (Sake no Taniguchi). Rich piney hop aroma, some stinging citrus, alcohol fumes, and tropical fruit. Clear amber/orange color, with a small fluffy white head. Tropical fruit sweetness, thick caramel and bread, with the fruitiness developing from mid palate onwards. The alcohol is a bit pronounced. Heavy and a bit creamy at first, and then slightly rouch on the tongue. Strong and intriquing character, Goes up to the edge of cloying, but does not cross over. Love this one!
Strong pine and light resin hop aroma. Clear orange color with a medium white head. Sweet beginning with a light alcohol bitterness throughout the middle and finish.

from bottle, poured a deep orange colour with a nice white head on top. nose of crisp sweet malts, oranges, mandarines, resinous pine notes, bitter hops, light sweet tropical notes, sweet malty backbone in the taste upfront, bitter, pine needles, still a lot of sweet tropical and orange sweetness in the back.
Im partial to a good ipa, and this is very good! Clean, refreshing, citrus, west coast, great brew..

Strong aromas of citrusy / woody hops and heavy caramel malts. Dark orange pour with lots of thick, white, persistent foam. Medium body and medium to light fizz. Slightly oily on the tongue. The flavor is equally strong with the hops perhaps slightly stronger than the malt. The citrus is much stronger on the tongue. The combination creates a very long duration at the end.
Wurst Party Ever 7 November 2015.

In bottiglia. Colore oro limpido vetrato. Schiuma a shampoo, fragile e di bassa persistenza. Buonissimo olfatto potente ed etilico, di luppolo terroso e floreale, particolarmente agrumato (mandarino) e resinoso con nette note di pino ed esteri. Carbonazione flat, appena solleticante le gonadi. Aroma etilico molto gradevole, ben allineato allo stile DIPA, potente di luppolo acre, spessa componente di malto caramellato con note di basilico, densamente resinoso, agrumi (mandarino) e marmellata di frutta gialla (netta la pesca). Presenza dolce di esteri, poi finale dove domina luppolo e resina. Gusto molto amaro con brevi recuperi dolci a metà beva. Scorrevolezza succosa che termina in un finale secco. Trama da grassa ad appena croccante, densa di luppolo, con corpo da più che medio a pieno. Una seria, intensa ed emozionante DIPA, di chiara matrice nordamericana.
Bottle. Pours light amber. Aroma of grapefruit, biscuit, boiled sweets and resin. Sweet malty background with some light bitterness. Steady but unspectacular.

Lukt: Citrus og honning.
Utseende: Gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende kremet skum.
Smak: Citrus og honning.
Hvor: Mondo Brewing Tap House, Battersea.

Aus der Flasche getrunken (von Braufaktum). Amber mit weißer Schaumkrone im Glas. In der Nase volle Orangen- und Grapefruchtaromen. Die 6 Hopfensorten harmonieren einmalig. Spitzenbier.

Bottle, 4 months after bottle date. Dark golden with a white head. Tangerine, pine, pineapple, grapefruit, lime, grass, loads of hops on a firm, but not overly malty backbone. Full body, juicy, leaning towards syruppy, great sweet/bitter balance. Not extreme for an imperial ipa, just very tasty and very good.

F: big, creamy, off-white, very good retention.
C: deep gold to light orange, totally clear.
A: fresh tangerine, passion fruits, mango, earthy, floral.
T: malty, orange, light grapefruit, earthy/floral bitterness, creamy mouthfeel, tangerine juice, pine resin, medium full body, lower carbonation, very good refreshing beer, enjoyed, 0,355ml bottle from Malting Pot in Brussels.

From 12oz bottle to snifter. Pour is a nice orange-yellow, thick white head. Nose is huge hops, resin, floral, alcohol. Taste is medium bodied, bitter with sweet undertones, almost a two tiered taste. Finishes super clean. Love the complexity, unreal beer.

Keg at the Firestone Walker Taproom in Marina del Rey, CA. Pours clear gold with a creamy, white head. Big and juicy, with lots of tropical fruits - mango, papaya - along with citrus, and orange in particular. Moderately sweet, with more juicy fruits, and light piney bitterness. Full bodied, lightly chewy, with fine to average carbonation. Resinous and juicy on the finish, with lots of gooey tropical fruit character. Lightly warming. Really fresh and juicy overall. Outstanding.

Butelka 0.65l (05.04.2017). Piwo klarowne o ciemno złotej barwie. Piana biała, drobna, obfita i trwała, subtelnie acz wyraźnie osadza się na ściankach szkła. Aromat słodki, owoców tropikalnych, bardzo intensywnej żywicy aż takiej ostrej ale bardzo przyjemnej, świeży, czuć od razu po podważeniu kapsla i szybko wypełnia najbliższe otoczenia butelki i szkła. Goryczka mega żywiczna na wysokim poziomie, przyjemnie drapie w gardle wyraźnie się na nim osadzając z wyraźnym efektem ściągania ale ogólnie bardzo przyjemna taka z pazurem. Zdrugiej strony w kontrze mamy podbudowę słodową z wyraźną słodyczą owoców tropikalnych na finiszu. I choć ciało w piwie bez wątpienia jest to jest ono dość lekkie w odbiorze jak na swój woltaż ze świetnie ukrytym alkoholem, bez efektu rozgrzewania i tylko delikatnie drapie w gardle, z resztą na spółkę z goryczką. Piwo jest wytrawne na początku i słodkawe na finiszu, dość pijalne choć raczej do długiej degustacji z dwóch powodów: mocy i ceny. Niemniej gorąco polecam, jest agresja w tym piwie i to mi się bardzo podoba.

Sampled from bottle at THT May. Clear deep golden with thin white head. Sweet caramel malts, nice hoppiness. Marijuana, exotic fruit, mango, pineapple, breadiness. Sweet, mild bitter. Over medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle at THT thats to RandomStrangerNL. Clear golden with short lasting white head. Grapefruit, marmalade, lots of sugary notes, caramel and vanilla biscuits. Soft green leaves and herbs. Quite sweet and over medium bitter. Almost full bodied.
Tap at Olive Another Pint. Resin pine caramel. Taste is similar, dangerously easy drinking. Smooth, full bodied. Very nice bitter and boozy finish. Great stuff.

Pours a clean golden yellow color. Aromas of sweet pineapple, mandarin, and pine dominate. Taste initially starts off with bittersweet pineapple, followed by some grapefruit and pine. This beer is really quaffable for the high abv. One of the best!!!

Floral piney lavendel. Good body great complex flavour. Some astringents bitter hop finish. Very nice.

Bottle from Deguchiya. Pours a clear copper with a full finger of head that leaves a nice rim around the edges. Very big orange and tangerine notes that last throughout. A bit of honey as well. Medium body with average carbonation. Clean and well-balanced. Lots of marmalade, honey malt and slight bread-like notes. Finish has more orange and marmalade with some bitterness and a warming finish. A classic west-coast double IPA.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Strange aroma, slightly piney, but a weird cardboard like aroma seems to be present. Taste is much better, juicy fruits, peachy, grapefruit, tangerine, pine. Medium bitter, smooth finish. Alcohol is present. Still a nice beer, but not the best DIPA

355ml bottle at home. Somewhat hazy orange with a medium white soapy head. Medium to full body with low to moderate carbonation. Great bitter and sweet tones. Tropical fruits, grapefruit, tangerine, citrus, caramel and malts. Great IPA!

Smell a of sweet malts tangerine and rotted fruit. Nice golden color. Taste of sweet citrus hops sweet malts tangerine juice finishing off with a Nice bitter bite. Medium body with light crisp carbonation. Love the sweetness of this beer and the complexity of the ipa. Wish more IPA brews tasted like this. Love this brew.

Tasted during DIPA shootout. Came last among all our beers. Very bitter, pine/dank, some noble hop aroma, too bitter, unfavorable bitter character, something mildly unpleasant. Very fatiguing beer on that palate.

Besonders ausgewogenes IPA mit bestechender fruityness! Stolzer Preis.

Double Jack 9.5%

On tap at Craft Beer Base, I won a bottle opener and got a pint glass! This orange-copper colored brew with a filmy off-white head has a sweet citrusy hop aroma that evokes orange blossoms for me.

Full bodied with a round carbonation the taste is bitter pine, caramel and citrus (lemon) rind. Very nice stuff but it packs a punch so drink it carefully!

Bottle at home (bottled 02/19/16). Pours clear amber with a fast disappearing white head. Aroma of piney, resiny hops, sweet malts, light citrus, grass. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter, resiny hops, grass, sweet malts, caramel, dry finish, long bitter resiny grassy hops aftertaste. Nice!

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 From the bottle poured into Spiegelau IPA glass. Pours clear orange with quickly vanishing off white head. Nose is intense citrusy piny hops, floral notes there too. Taste is a hop bomb too, pine, resin citrus very good balenced bitterness to the finish. Long lasting grassy hops on the palate. Gerät DIPA...

Clear, amber-copper colored, medium off white frothy head. Aroma is of caramel malt, bit orange hard candy, medium+ floral, pine and fruity hops. Taste is medium+ sweet caramel, malt, some fruity and citrus notes, mostly pine and floral, medium+ bitterness, dry finish, lasting bitter aftertaste. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, oily. 
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)
Solid hop citrus body with a large malt backbone. Very easy drinking for a double IPA.

If there is a formula for a top end imperial IPA, this follows it. Clear orange/amber, with a small white head and lacing - check. Medium to full body, not too much carb, bit oily - check. Aroma of orange marmalade, peach and grapefruit - check. Flavour moves you from the fruit, through robust malt to a big bitter hit - check. If this sounds a bit too formulaic, well its a good formula, and there is a prominent taste of herbs which sets it somewhat apart. Good stuff.
4pk 12oz bottles. Aromas of grapefruit, orange, dank herbal finish. Similar flavor profile but with a malty sweet backbone. Bitter hoppy mouthfeel, Warm booze finish.

Poured into a shaker showing well filtered honey brown. 

The nose shows light limes and not much else. 

The palate is moderately carbonated and medium bodied. Moderately intense flavors of lime and light malt with a strong alcohol spiciness throughout. Very strong bitterness on the finish.

Mal wieder ein IIPA das kurz vor der Perfektion steht. A VERY BIG ONE !!!! Wahrlich aggressive Frucht/Harz/Malz/Hopfenaromenattacken beschäftigen alle beteiligten Sinne. Trotzdem unfassbar rund. ALLMÄCHTIG !!!!! 0,6l/12 Euro vom Braufactumstand, beim Kieler Craft Beer Day 2016. Verköstigt dann mit Baby, Ratty & Chrille im Taxi und vor dem Medusa in Gaarden.

0.65l bottle. Courtesy of Lore. Slightly hazy orange body, white head. Aroma of bready malts, biscuit, honey, apricot, pine and floral hops. Taste of bread, floral and piny hops, toast, reisins and booze. Heavy IPA, but awesome for sure.

opalescent golden to orange colour, moderate sized off-white head; aroma of resins, biscuits, tangerine, some herbal, lemongrass and floral notes; taste of honey, resins, biscuits, tangerine, mango and white wine notes; some peppery spiciness in the aftertaste together with long lasting bitterness;extraordinary IIPA!
Thanks Lore!!! Apples boozy resiny sweet brew. Rich and big. Nice bitter finish with honey style finish. Really cool big dipa.
Tap at churchkey in DC. Becher glass. Clear light copper with medium white head. Nice hop nose, clean. Direct taste, Sharp thin hop. Very professional. Good.
Sample @ Malmö Öl & Whisky Festival 20160402. Fruity, caramely and hoppy with pine needles and grapefruits, finish is bitter with alcoholic notes.

660ml bottle. Clear copper colour with a nice off-white head. Moderate retention. Caramel, dates, fruity, floral and light piny aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is well balanced with more bitter piny notes up front followed by sweet caramel notes. Overall, a very good beer.

Mega! Extrem stark und stark alkoholisch. Aber der Geschmack ist Irrsinn!
Wahnsinnig fruchtig und würzig in der Nase. Im Glas ein tolles goldgelb. Leichter Schaum.
Geschmacklich einfach eine Keule! Man weiß gar nicht wo es herkommt. Unglaublich tropisch, mediterrane Kräuter. Einfach ein Bier der Spitzenklasse. 
Perfekt! Danke Edeka!

Bottled. Pours golden with a big white head. Smells hay, fruity hoppy. Tastes sweet grassy hoppy, very fresh with a similar finish.

Got a bottle thats about 10 months old and am assuming that a 9.5% ABV brew could only be effected positively by a bit of aging. Poured into an oversize wine glass. The aroma is malty and citrusy. Lingering small head, very well balanced on the palate, with a solid body. Pine, sugar, resin, tart citrus, well hidden kick, probably too well hidden. I dont change my ratings based on price, but I do change my buying habits, and while this is a fine example of a DIPA it is not competitive with several other easily available brews in this category (although I do think it kills Torpedo). Well done!

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a glass.This is an excellent double IPA. The malt to hop balance is superb without the alcohol forwardness you might experience with some imperial IPAs. I think I will have another one.

Bottled 09/04/15, bought at Blackhearts & Sparrows in Melbourne. Pours a deep clear good with small white head. Big pine resin aroma, like walking through dense pine trees and breathing in. Unfortunately Im not getting much fruit, it seems one-dimensional. The taste is piney also, although it has a big malt presence, earthy and lovely. It keeps the bitterness in check, no trace of the high ABV. The feel is excellent, full and gently carbonated, slight warming, lingering bitterness. I feel I got this a bit late (six months old), it probably goes a lot better when fresher.

Bottled 11/09/2015. Orange and clear in colour. The aroma is very intensive and has some strong flower notes. Of course it's full of tropical fruits and very serious on zest. But above all the resin. Taste is well balanced but still quite bitter and resinous. Almost hot like ginger. Good stuff.

BOD 11/17/15. Clear amber pour (copper) with a hint of garnet. Outstanding head volume, world class lacing and retention.

Outstanding, but a bit light, nose of sweet pink grapefruit.

Heavy medium body with a creamy texture. Superb carbonation with a burst of effervescence in the middle and a nice prickly finish.

The flavor profile is quite outstanding. Alcohol is covered, balance is world class and complexity is fair. It begins with a rush of sweet pink grapefruit that lingers through the finish. The middle has a moderate bitterness that is rind based and the hop flavor shifts more towards classic grapefruit. Slightly past the bitterness apex, the rich biscuit malt base delivers a bready wave of sweetness that has caramel aspects over a rising tangerine influence. The finish is a slow sweet fade of rind.

The flavors and aspects play separate on the tongue, but still not in a way that isnt complimentary. Typical of a new school double IPA.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2016 From a 355ml bottle on 28/1/2016. Pours a clear medium golden with a medium bright white head. Has a huge aroma with big fruity, resiny hops coming over the top of dollops of caramel malt. Exquisite from the first sip. As suggested by the nose, this has a big caramel malt background, followed by oodles of honey, and sweet mandarin, apricot strawberry and peach. The bitterness is big - grapefruity and resiny - lingering long with a hint of spice at the back. Has a full rich, body, average carbonation and has lovely mouthfeel. Displays supreme balance and depth. Damn. This is seriously right up there with the very best beers Ive ever tried. Truly magnificent. Rating 4.6. Re-rate on 18/5/2016. I have to bump my score up a touch. Its hard to conceive the existence of a better beer. Just blows me away every time I have one.

12oz bottle. Clear gold Amber color with a white head. Strong head retention and lacing. Strong hops aroma with some tropical fruit. Surprisingly smooth medium body with front end carbonation. Hops floral and tropical fruit flavor. Really well balanced.

Bottle at home. Pours a deep golden with a small white head. Aroma is mango, caramel, citrus, slight grass. Taste is big ripened pineapple, slight caramel, big bitter hop punch, citrus, long dry finish. Perfectly balanced with a big hop presence. One of my favourites.
Bottled. Nice clear copper color. Has a bold hop taste. To me it has a citrus hint. Has a floral hop upfront taste. Excellent imperial IPA

Clear light golden pour, white head. Nose is citrus fruit, light burnt sugar. Full bodied with light toast, fairly sweet, tropical fruits, pine, strong bitter finish. Solid.

Dark golden pour with lingering small amount of white head. This is an interesting beer. Tons of citrus and malt in aroma and flavor. But the malt is manageable and adds some nice depth and alcohol to an otherwise typical IPA. The earthiness and citrus is excellent and makes it super drinkable.

660ml bottle (thanks Mart). Clear dark golden color. Medium size, white head, stays. Sweet, malty, melon, fruity, orange peel in aroma. Sweet, fruity, orange, citrus in taste. Harsh fruitiness in aftertaste. Alcohol is there I can feel it, but cant taste it. Fruity bitterness. Overstretched brew.
Duidelijk Amerikaanse hop in de neus, pompelmoes, agrum. Beendroog, zeer bitter met wat zoetigheid maar redelijk goed in balans. Bittere afdronk met wat citrus.

Bottle (from firma bier). Pours dark golden-amber with whiteish head. Aroma is sweet, fruits, peaches, caramel. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fuits, peaches, malt, caramel. Finish is grapefruit bitter. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: great beer.

Very slightly hazy orange por, small white head. Nose is a heap of fruit, mango, tangerines, oranges, pineapple, toasty sweetness, malt. Flavor is fruity smooth, slightly sweet, almost creamy, middle to finish is hoppy, grapefruity, medium bitterness in the herbally dry finish. Lingering toasty-fruity-hoppy and oily notes. Bottle poured perfectly clear with white with a yellow hue head. Aroma floral and earthy piney notes with a slight citrus and nice Carmel undertones. Nice piney forward notes meld well with sweet Carmel! Nice warming in the stomach! Great beer!

Color of honey crowned by an exquisite, frothy white head. Big aroma, everything is big about this beer....tropical fruits, orange, piney, florals, honey, notes of alcohol on the nose. Big flavor follows, similar qualities to the aroma, medium-full bodied, beautifully balanced with a mouthful of mangoes, grapefruit, molasses, and pine.....a nice lasting twang in the finish

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2016 Holy balls. Ridiculous aroma out of the bottle before i even look at the pour. Oranges, caramel, tropical punch in the face. Pours orange with a decent white head. Another sniff and its huge citrus and caramel. Taste is slightly boozy, jammy orangey goodness, nice long, warm bitter finish. Its damn good.

The IIPA version of Firestone Walkers Union Jack, from a 65 cl bomber with the typical classy label depicting a fight between a bear and a lion. Frothy and dense, egg-white, very moussy head leaving thick cobweb lacing, residing over a clear orange blonde beer with quite vivid sparkling. Dank, powerful, tropical fruit aroma hitting the nostrils with impressions of tangerine, fresh mandarin, pink grapefruit flesh, toasted sweet onion, overripe papaja, cedar needles, Grand Marnier, strawberry wine, cake, sweet cherry tomatoes on toasted bread, roasted pine nuts, lavender, sweet curry, cantaloupe, lychee, freshly ground black pepper, sweet white grapes and Pineau de Charentes - the kind of DIPA bouquet I could sniff for hours, as each time I put my nose to the glass, something else shows up only to disappear again and make room for yet another impression. Clean onset with perfect balance of sourish and sweetish (mango, lychee, melon, blood orange) adorned with certain umami aspects (green olive) and in perfect balance with a soft, yet finely tingling carbonation, softly minerally; bitter and lightly salty hops are palpable right from the start. Middle phase continues these impressions on a very supple yet robust, caramelly and honeyish malt sweetness while the hoppiness increases, working its way to a big finale in the finish, deeply bittering without becoming abrasive and exploding into a wealth of retronasal citrus peel, pine resin, roasted onion, tropical fruits and spices. It still allows for juicy, sweetish malts to pass through, while a warming glow of bourbon-like alcohol reminds you of the fact that this is still imperial (double) IPA rather than ordinary IPA; the bittering and utterly aromatic hop effect lingers after that, fierce and very elegant at the same time. A hop-soaked masterpiece in many ways, I can easily see how this scores so high on the DIPA scale. Firestone Walker has done many a great thing in its history regardless of the takeover by Belgian Moortgat, and this is surely among those great achievements. This is to double IPA what Sucaba is to barley wine or Parabola to imperial stout: extremely well crafted, with a flair for taste, power and sheer beauty. Exemplary double IPA in all respects, I absolutely love this, this must be among the best in its style I had so far. Fantastic.

Wow this is a night for classics unrated!
22 oz bottle purchased from Fred Meyer in Wilsonville OR.

Clear orange/copper coloured ale with a frothy white head.
Sweet fruity hop type aromas..peaches, tangerines, papaya., touch f spruce tip.really impressive..it just brightens my night.
Interestingly it is the spruce/ fir thing that is more dominant in the taste..but it is fruity in the end...just before the after taste takes over.
Mouthf eel is really rather mellow for style with the barest hint of the high alc..you can feel a pleasant heat.
Very nice beer..but not my top IIPA

Excellent beer but I prefer The Calling by Boulevard slightly more. Both are really good but side by side I chose The Calling.

Totally sick of writing comments right now. This one is good not great. Ladada I am done.

From the 650 ml. bottle. Bottled 07/16/15 so it is a few months old. Copper pour with a tremendous white foamy head that fades back. Busy carbonation. The aroma is full of fruity and floral esters but low in the booze. But yes it is several months old. The body is smooth and medium. The taste has a fruity and floral bitterness just like the aroma suggests. Moderate finish.

Poured from a bottle at Salt. Quite bitter with a hint of tangerine

Bomber Bottle. Pour is orange in color with slight haziness. Thin head and light too medium carbonation. Tropical fruits aromas dominate. You name it, you can find it, Mango-grapefruit-pineapple and especially tangerine. Velvety mouth feel with a little heat brought on by the 9.5abv. Overall an awesome beer.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2015 Big bottle at home. Nicely cloudy, orange colour topped by an offwhite, creamy head with good retention. Nose is big on oranges and alcohol, cointreau-like, caramel malty. Taste is velvety smooth considering the big bitterness and alcohol grade: orange zest, pineapple, mango, grainy sweet malty backbone. Lingering fruity, sweet bitterness. Big body, low carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Beautifully balanced IIPA.

Clear warm golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, pineapple, pine, citrus, passionfruit, light apricot. Bitter hoppy flavour, tropical fruits, light sweet malts. Bitter fruity hoppy finish, pineapple. Nice!!(from 66cL bottle @ Milos place. Thanks for sharing!)
355ml bottle from Brewdog. Pours hazy orange, off-white head. Big hoppy nose. Taste is syrupy orange, cointreau, pine resin and citrus fruits. Extremely rich, far too much to be enjoyable.

Cervesa impressionant i molt recomanable, es barreja perfectament lamarg del llúpol amb la dolçor de les maltes, cervesa per degustar.

Bottle tall boys beer market leeds. Orange colour slight head. Aroma is pine resin orange mango. Taste good sweet caramel malt backbone lots of pine resin orange good ibus long hoppy sweet bitter finish. Nice oily body slight carbonation. Very good all round.
Clear golden with white head. Caramel, herbal, spicy and dank green hops. Sweet, green and dry finish. Overall: Session beer. Incredible balance. Reminiscent of hardcore ipa.

Excelente aroma. Notas cítricas bastante elegantes. Destacan el mango, naranja y algo de Guayaba. 

Color dorado con ligeros destellos rojizos. Corona de espuma abundante de excelente retención. Carbonatacion y cuerpo medio. 

En boca es suave, sedosa, bien balanceada y de excelente final.

Al paladar es sumamente interesante pero a la vez, fácil de beber. En primera instancia es ligeramente dulce y maltosa sin ser apabullante. Pours hazy orange color. Aroma of citrus and caramel. Light sweetness with medium bitterness

AROMA: pineapple, mango, pine/Spruce, crisp malt, herbal/floral hops, coriander, spices, grassy bitterness, melon, citrus, grapefruit, herbs, alcohol, light peppercorn, lime zest, tropical fruit and light caramel. TASTE: malty, pineapple, coriander, mango, melon, pine bitterness, citrus, grapefruit, herbs, hop spice, peppercorn, alcohol, lime zest, tropical fruit and caramel. Finish is rather bitter (could have been a bit more bitter, but maybe it was when it was really fresh).

Rated by BrewTom

Keg at Brewdog Bristol. Clear rich reddy amber coloured pour wirh a thin off white head. Aroma is lovely rounded caramel and toffee with sticky hop resin and pine needles. Verging on barley wine. Flavour is composed if rounded caramel, toffee, biscuit malts., sticky hop resin, pine. Assertive clean hop bitterness. Double IPA, crossed with an american barley wine. Pours clear golden with a medium frothy head. Aroma has a good hit of tropical hops. Citrus starting, Malty middle with a sharp bitter finish.
A harsh and unforgiving ipa. Probably a billion ibus, but who can really tell. Dentist-trip inducing acidity balanced by a really sweet maltiness. Not beer for the faint of heart.
Very good and pretty much a exact impression of a double ipa. It kinda tastes like a watered down mix of devil dancer and the oracle from bells.

A big thanks to mcberko for sending me this bottle! Cheers mate! Pour un 500e rating, il faut se payer la traite avec une bière que je convoite depuis longtemps dune brasserie que je convoite tout autant! Dès louverture de la bouteille sur la terrasse, je suis frappé par la quantité de fruits tropicaux que éclatent de cette bouteille! Jamais je nai senti autant de mangues, de fruits de la passion, de clémentine et dananas à la fois. Un véritable punch tropical! Les houblons napportent pas quune dimension fruitée à la bière mais aussi une quantité de résine importante. Les saveurs sont pour moi moins tropicales que les arômes. Je suis plutôt du côté sapineux et conifère, le tout dans un enrobage collant au fond du palais. Une effervescence un peu plus grande en bouche aurait aidé à adoucir la texture un peu dure et lourde de cette bière. Pas trop longue en bouche, cette bière a une buvabilité dangereuse...

Probada en Top Hops, Lower East Side, New York. La primera imperial IPA de Firestone Walker es sencillamente exquisita. Color dorado casi anaranjado. Sabor floral y cítrico, suave. Una gran IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour into Goblet, almost exactly three months since the bottling date. Pours with a nice small tan colored head that is not too foamy but appealing. Leaves a little lacing behind but it disappears rather quickly. Appearance is amber and clear. Aroma of orange/tangerine and grapefruit do stand out. Taste is sweet and definitely malt forward going in, but it quickly gives way to a nice bitter and salty flavor. This beer has a medium body, creamy sticky texture, average to soft carbonation with a long bitter finish. Overall this is a very nice double IPA and I will surely drink it again on a special occasion.

12fl.oz. bottle. Pours a clear, golden orange with a large, frothy, long lasting, off-white head that laces. Fruity, hoppy aroma of grapefruit, tangerine, peach and caramel malt. Sweet fruity flavour of grapefruit, peach, pine and caramel malt with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent IIPA.

A really good IIPA, though a bit maltier than I prefer. Pour is orange, nice white head, nose is overwhelmed by pine and bitter citrus. Taste is sweet for the style, merging with piney hops for a tropical fruit effect: mango, pineapple, caramel and orange. Some booze, but balanced, and bitter finish. Very nice but I actually prefer the regular Union Jack.
one of the best IPAs. they dont overdue it with the bitterness. the hops taste is very balanced. really a treat..
Love it, This is definitely in my top 10 Imperial beer. Great appearance, aroma, flavor, body, and finishes great. Will buy again. You will have a love experience with this beer.
Bottle. Golden copper color. Aroma of citrus, mango, pine, caramel and peach. Flavor of mango, citrus, caramel, passion fruit, peach and mild booze. Very nice.

Bottle. Appearance- amber and reasonably clear, some carbonation, a two-finger beige/off-white head which leaves some lacing. Aroma- pine, pineapple, mango, blood orange, citrus fruit, fruit juice, yeast, hops. Taste- bitter hops dominate, orange peel and pineapple juice, pine, juicy hop resins, malty undertones with hints of caramel and bread. Oily and clingy in the mouth, and a nice understated bitter finish. Excellent.

355ml bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow:
This one from Firestone Walker was quite a hoppy & very strong tasting beer with huge amounts of pine, grapfriut & tropical fruits before some nice caramel sweetness appeared towards the end. Despite the strength & some alcohol showing, it was easier to drink that expected & the balance was good as well with a dry, lingering bitter finish. Another excellent beer from the brewery & some well worth looking out for.

Great aroma. There's a slight citrus scent to it. Maybe an orange or grapefruit. Upon tasting, it's certainly grapefruit. It's not obnoxious, but the finish has on obvious grapefruit bitterness. I like this one. It has a nice hoppiness to it and it sits well on the palate. I would get this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Good hop flavor for such a high ABV at 9.5, the alcohol is very well masked and not overpowering. Darker notes but still nice and piney. Good lacing if you care about that. The flavor sticks around on the tongue which makes for a long drinker. Very nice day drinker.

Draft at Claude Hopper's. Dark gold, clear with thin white head. Served a little too cold. Aroma is a little citrus and fruity. More malty than most, maybe because it's cold. Not bad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Massive wife off pine as you open the bottle. The resin smell lingers in the glass, which leads to a very piney hop flavor. A very drinkable double ipa
What more is there to say? One of if not the best year round double IPA out there - beautiful blend of caramel malt profile with a huge bomb of citrus hops. These go down easy.
Colore chiaro. Sentori di pompelmo, mandarino, lime e miele.Note resinate. Piacevolmente secca. Buona
Light refreshing scent. Clear, light amber. Grapefruit hops but covered up by bready malt. A little heavy. Can definitely feel the alcohol pretty quick.
Clear golden of color with a white head. An aroma of grapefruit, citrus, pineapple, sweets and butter. A flavor grapefruit, hops, citrus, bitter and some sweets.
Nice looking clear dark-golden beer. Notes of orange, tangerine, pine, grape fruit and a malty backbone

650ml bottle. Clear golden orange color with white head. Hoppy and malty aroma, pine, grass, citrusy fruity, grapefruit, caramel. Light sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation

Bottle from brewdog online. Clear golden and thick white head. Aroma is beautiful, floral and biscuity malt on the nose with resin and citrus in the mouth. Taste is very nicely blanched, sweet and bitter, malty and crisp. Just short of prickly with an oily body. Excellent.

Aroma: pine, resin, caramel and bread malts, some citrus. Appearance: clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: fruitiness continues though does not intensify, malts again, some grass, floral notes. Overall: very interesting IIPA, almost like an imperial version of an English-style IPA. Bottle from Independent Spirit, Bath.

Poured from a bottle, its color is a stunning amber. A really beautiful beer with a moderate white head. The aroma is citrus, pine, and a little more floral than other IPAs. I was expecting more pine, and that disappointed when it wasnt met. But in fairness, its not really a detriment to this beer at all. Lightly bitter, and moderately sticky, it leaves light lacing on the glass. Definitely a first-rate beer, but it left me wanting just a little bit more on most measures. Again, I dont mean this as a negative. Rather, it was quite good, but I felt it was just missing being great.

Gli Americani direbbero "top Notch", probabilmente. Birra oro antico, con qualche velatura di arancio, nel bicchiere è bella e pulita, con una testa bianca compatta e persistente. Laroma si apre una ventata di note agrumate : Arancia, scorza di Limone, soprattutto mandarino direi. Un po di frutta acerba, e leggermente in sottofondo note di basilico, verdi, quasi "resinose", ma appena percettibile. Pulita al naso, in bocca porta una leggerissima base maltata, subito seguita da una componente acerba, come nocciolo di pesca e melone cantalupo. Pioggia di agrumi anche in bocca, che si mescolano appena alla componente di basilico avvertita al naso. Bilanciata, è una birra soprendentemente bilanciata. Cremosa, quasi liscia, ha poche bollicine ed una bella secchezza finale. Il retrogusto porta più note resinose che agrumate, ma entrambe sembranos entirsi. Estremamente ben fatta, non mostra mai lalcool dichiarato.

Bottle, 8 months old. Clear copper in colour with fluffy white head. Aroma mainly malty sweet, low aroma notes (mind the age): pine, resin and some citrus. In taste medium sweet, resiny and sweetness is countered rapidly by big bitterness, which is short, heavy and very smooth. Medium body, soft carbonarion. Great beer, Id love to try it fresh.

Bright golden, clear with drops of visible carbonation and a decent contrasting white cap. Nose is brisk minty over piney, grapefruit, narrow bright malt and candied clementine. Initial taste is flickers of pine and syruppy pineapple with a jump start of bitterness. Juiciness has a bit of stage fright and this dry, minerally richness takes the opportunity. Carbonation is firm, mouthfeel stern but crisp enough. Finishes oddly dewy, gooseberry then a bit more greasy mint grapefruit it on the linger. Bottle, Beets, Leith

Big, aggressive IPA. Pours clear amber with a white lacing head. Strong pineapple, grapefruit on the nose, flavour follows suit. Aggressive bitterness, but balanced really well with a good malty backbone. Easy drinking, with a nice dry herbal bitter finish. Top quality stuff.
Bottle at home alone. Solid. Strong. Tasty. Top notch beer. Hopidy hop hop.
Bottle pours copper with off white head. Orange, pine, resin, earth, herbs. High bitterness, light sweetness. Full, crisp body. Trailing bitterness.

Pours medium amber from a bomber. Slightly malty aroma. Starts and middle is malty as advertised and drinks less boozy than the 9.5 would suggest. Citrus hoppy finish, solid beer. Usually dont care for doubles as much.

12oz bottle from Valhallas Goat. Orange amber, good head. Sweet grain resin malt aroma. Sweet cloying orange malt flavour. Bitter sweet hoppy malt aftertaste. I know this is a good exapmle of this sort of beer but it isnt really my sort of beer.

Ein nahezu perfektes Double IPA meiner Meinung nach.
Tolles Aussehen, orange im Glas mit toller Schaumkrone.
In der Nase blumig und fruchtig. Zitrusfrüchte, Grapefruit, Mango, Orange, Zitrone, Pinie, Erde.
Der Geschmack eine Wucht. Volle Dröhnung an Hopfen, dazu malzige Süße. Malz und Hopfen harmonieren wundervoll, der Alkohol hält sich trotz seiner 9.5% angenehm zurück. Im Nachtrunk kommt eine langgezogene, deutliche aber angenehme Bittere durch.
Fabelhaftes Bier und herausragendes DIPA.

Originally rated on 8/13/14. "A clear-ish, deep copper body, with a fluffy white head that leaves some pretty good lace. Aromas of piney,and lemon citrus hops with biscuit and caramel malt notes. Subdued malt sweetness with cereal and honey, a bold hop bitterness throughout the taste. Mouthfeel is light for the style, but i like how easy it goes down.A very nice, well-rounded IIPA. High ABV is well hidden, but you can feel it pretty quick. Overall a really nice brew.
Bottle. Beautiful piney aroma. Full, bubbly body. Nice sweet honeyish taste balanced with lightly bitter pineyness.
Bottle from brewdog onlineclear amber with offwhite head collapsing to lacing piney, pithy full bodied, sticky, prickly carbonation, dank and herbal, boozy, warming sherbet. Too sweet and heavy

Newport News, Va - Farm Fresh Supermarket - 650 ml bomber. Sparkling medium golden, light orange pour, long-lasting sticky off-white head, with a trace of lacing. Resiny, gummy hoppiness in the aroma with a strong spruce presence and some fruity undertones, Flavor has a solid hop/malt balance with some light citrus bitterness, a large does of caramel sweetness, a touch of nectarine fruitiness, Nice, thick rich mouthfeel. Very solid,

Bottle from Cornelius. Pours a coppery gold. Pale for a DIPA. Nice to see. Rich aroma! Floral. Fruity. Resinous. Its got it all! Not too heavy, just layers of lovely hop character with a bit of syrupy malt and a wee boost of alcohol warmth. Bit hot in taste. Alcohol squares up to you straight away. Then a measure of medium-sweetness coats the mouth. Punchy bitterness leaves an impression. Some orange and pineapple notes in the flavour. Wee bit too much carbonation for me..... just to be picky. Sticky mouthfeel on the finish. Awesome stuff. A big beer!

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Pale golden coloured with a thin white head. It has a pineapple and orange flavour, malty and citrus notes followed by slight tropical fruit, pine and orange on the finish. Awesome!

Large Format - Orange color with a nice white head of foam. Has an almost weird smell to it, sweet, orange peel, caramel, almost like hard candy. Lots of hop flavor that hits you and lingers for a while. Flavor lingers on the palate and slowly dissipate. Flavor is very similar to the smell.
Kupferfarben, klar, tropische Früchte, Grapefruit, blumig, harzig, Pinie, spritzig, bitterer Abgang (100 ibu). Hopfen: Warrior, Columbus, Cascade, Centennial, Amarillo, Simcoe.

Couleur ambrée, bonne mousse creme. Fort nez houblonné fruité avec note raisin et miel. Gout amer houblonné pin très sucré, miel. fruité jaune et exotique. Fin amère mais un peu trop sucrée. Pas mal qd meme

Bottle 65cl kindly shared by Calisky. A clear copper beer with good head. Nose is on exotic fruits, coconut oil and pine. Aroma is on blond caramel, very sweet, vanilla, coconut, almond, peach, mango, hops resin, alcohol is well hidden. Finish is very sweet, fruity and bitter, too much intense on my point of view.

Orange color with small white head. Aroma is grapefruit, orange, tangerine,/resinous, pine, caramel. Taste is more of these fruits, with a toasty malt body, a good amount of sweetness and a great bitter booze kick which fits perfectly! Oily mouthfeel. Top-notch material.

22 oz. bottle poured into a pint glass. Looks pretty. Just darker than a bright gold body with chunky lacing. Big distinct bubbles in the head, which doesnt last all that long. Grapefruit upon grapefruit. The sweetness from the malt combines to make a slight peach smell. Bright citrus flavor of hops overwhelms a sweet malt backbone at first, but succumbs rather quickly. Ít doesnt taste all that bitter to me. I think the caramel malts come through over the hops in the end and it actually finishes with a bit of a sweetness. Just a bit syrupy. Maybe a bit too thick for the style, but just barely. Medium to medium-low carbonation. Not quite world class, but a very delicious substitute when world class isnt available.

Bottle at home. Clear orange with a big white head. Very nice blend of dank and fruity, piney aroma. Medium body, excellent hop flavour and fantastic bitterness. Great beer!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sparkling amber,lasting beige head. Musty hop nose.Full bodied with soft carbonation.Malty,musty hop profile,light alcohol heat. Big long hop finish.
Very nice !!

Aroma is deep and rich from tangerines, citrus and pine. Taste is carried by a rather heavy backbone of malt and brings deep rich hops and grapefruits and orange sweetness. Theres a hidden sting from the alcohol underneath, just lingering below without really surfacing. A top notch Imperial IPA.
33cl in beer market. Pours amber with white foam head. Pineapple, mango, citrus nose. Chewy toffee, butterscotch, with fruit. Mild bitter finish. Nice balance. Excellent
Clean juicy resiny wonderful hop tones with moderate pale and aromatic malts. Nice aggressive mouthfeel as well. A good way to end a crappy day.

Bottle, 75cl. Clear golden with a frothy offwhite head. Immense aroma of fruity hops, with hints of pine resin, tropical fruits. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Dry and astringent, with some fruity sweetness and heavy bitterness. Dry and bitter finish. Very nice.
Bomber shared at tasting. Clear golden pour. Strong citrus hops as expected. Taste follows, the citrus cleans up the hops. Nice finish.

Huge citrus and lemon grass aroma, taste is perfect malt and hop, some fruits and mild spice, very good

Riecht nach Maracuja, Zitrus. Startet süß, Maracuja. Mitte süß, Zitrus, Maracuja, alkoholisch. Abgang süß, scharf alkoholisch, Zitrusnote. Gut.

Fantastic dominant spiky pine nose. Clear pure chrystalline golden body with a thickish fluffy rocky head. Controlled but wickedly warped raw grapefruit like dry bitterness which cuts and aggressively cleans the palate. Great strength and suppleness.

Very good, but Booziness&IPA dont mix well

Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Clear gold. Thin, bubbly, white head. Nose is dank, and resinous. Lots of ripe orange. Peach juice. Some savoury in there. Taste has an initial hit of sweet, turning dank, oily bitter. Full bodied. Oily. Decent prickle of carbonation helps the drinkability. Sticky on the lips. Finishes long, resinous, chewy bitter, with that sweetness lingering until the end. Big and drinkable.

12oz bottle pours out a golden topped with a nice head. Nose is great hoppy pine citrus and some sweetness. Taste is more of the sweetness hoppy combo. Wow this is a tasty treat and helped my hop need.

Keg at PSBH, Manchester. Golden/amber shade. White head. Slightly buttery caramel malt. Waves of interesting hops: grassy, spicy and floral. Not really fruity, however. Very bitter. Its big and the strength is easily felt, but it is well balanced. Not much wrong with it per se, I just prefer a softer and fruitier (I)IPA.

Bottle from Drinkmonger. Clear golden body with a white, fading head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of honey, orange, menthol, peach and pine resin. Flavour is very sweet - maple syrup and sugary tea - with a tangy, slightly peppery finish. Medium body with a very oily mouthfeel. Soft fizz. This has a nice hoppy aroma and flavour from the dry-hopping but its low on hop bitterness. It goes down easy for 9.5% ABV. For me, its verging on Barley Wine territory.
Great DIPA , reall fresh hops on the nose, sherbet hits on the tongue, and the bitter finish slices through the 9.5abv. Great beer
Very good strong IPA!!!!!!!! via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft - FW has this down. Nice citrus, piney, and slightly floral hop aroma and taste. Super solid sweet malt back bone. So glad these are starting to come in 12oz bottles.

Jedno z lepszych IIPA ever drunk. Mocna goryczka, w zupełności nie zalegająca, szybko znika. Aromat sosnowy, cytrusowy. Te nuty pojawiają się w smaku, z małym dodatkiem karmelu, ale odpowiednio wyważonym. Świetne piwo. Przy takim woltażu zaskakująco lekkie i mega pijalne. Tzw. zdradliwy skurwiel.
A great beer. Terrific IPA aroma and fresh taste. High bitterness and alcohol but still very easy to drink. Expected more sweetness and was happy not to find it. One of the best IPAs easily.

One of the very best dbl IPA you will ever taste- Firestone walker is always amazing but they really know how make to there IPAs ..would recommend this beer to all beer lovers , not only IPA fans but beer geeks around the world whether you enjoy IPA or not, don't shy away this at all

5/8/15 from bomber. Big 2 finger head on amber color. Not a strong aroma. Pine citrus spicy hop flavor. Balanced but leans toward malty. Not as good as Pliny the Elder.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very hoppy upfront aggressive aroma. Pine and spiced hops. Flavor with pleasant malts and huge hoppy taste and bitter.

Bomber - the aroma is a blast of citrus hops with a touch of maltiness. The appearance is perfect - clear golden amber, light & stable head, great lacing on the glass and great carbonation. Intense citrus bitterness with a hint of pine gives way to a malty body. A light herbaceousness couples with a millisecond of sweetness then followed by a long layered bitter hop aftertaste.

I WENT TO LIQUOR STORED LOOKINGS FOR PLINY (YEAH I LOVE IT) AND I ALL COULD FIND WAS THIS CRAPPY BEER FROM TIRE MAKERS. NO RUBBER TIRE FLAYVER LIKE OTHER FIRESTONES BUT, IT NEED MORE HOPS AND DEOS NOT TASTE ANYTHING LIKE PLINY. NOT AN IPA, AND I ONLY LIKE INDIAN STYLE IPAS. IT HAS GOOPY FEEL IN MY STOMACH AND LESS ALCOHOLS THAN A USUAL LAGER STYLE. IT; COULD USED 100PLUS MORE IUBs OR AT LEAST SOME MORE FLAVOR FROM HOPS. VERY BAD, I WARNED YU. YOUR WELCOME.

Hoppy aroma. Lighter yellow orange color with light cloudiness. Hoppy start and smooth finish

Very drinkable for a 9.5%. I guess I can agree with some of these resin and grapefruit comments but if you start thinking about posies and dance numbers while you are sipping a double IPA well I think youre missing the point. Had this sitting on a patio in Mountain View with some lamb skewers from across the street. Refreshing and keeps you wanting another. Used a Leffe to deglaze my palate and had another.

Yellow gold with foamy white head. Resinous aroma. Taste- resinous hops and caramel malt. Full bodied IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft sampler pours amber with a off white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel and pine. Taste is grapefruit, fruit and malts.

Hazy orange colour, white head. Aroma of caramel, mandarins, candy sugar, really there is a basil note, more on the sweet side, but the bottle is 2 years old. Taste is light sweet, light to medium bitter. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Pretty good

Pours a clear golden orange color with a nice head and decent lacing.
A blast of pine and citrus (grapefruit); this is definitely a hop bomb.
More hoppiness. Pine and citrus flavor. 
Nicely carbonated, with a hoppy bitterness that lingers in the aftertaste.

A delicious DIPA, from go to whoa, even given it was bottled last October. Cool and into a snifter. Appears to suffer from chill haze as it settles. A hazed, pastel orange with fine conditioning and short-lived, frothy, off-white foam. Big, bold and pungent, resinous hop nose displaying notes of grapefruit, tangelo, mandarin and stewed rhubarb amongst some pine sap, eucalypt, camphor and pot pourri - complex and deep. Ooooh, there is some artisanal balance here. Big fruit, plummy and jammy with all that aroma at play throughout. Oily with plenty of presence. Lightly bitter peak before more plump fruit in the finish as well as a kick from the alcohol to remind one they are drinking a strong ale. Carbonation is prickly, heightening all that is going on. This is a sumptuous, big IPA. I need to go out and grab a few more and settle in for the night. Delicious!! (12fl.Oz, bottled 30/10/14, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

Big hop aroma pine and citrus, pours a clearance orange with dense pillowing off white head and great lacing. Light carbonation and and a smooth bitterness that increases through out the palette blending the citrus and pine along with a hint of alcohol before disappearing leaving you want another drink. Some nice malt character with a bit of rich bread and caramel sweetness to help roast round it out.

Pours deep orange sunset. Head is frothy white. Aroma of grapefruit, mango, citrus and light bready caramel. Taste is the same with tangerine and mango on the bitter finish. Good bright dipa. Most are malty. This is balanced on the hoppy side. Love it!
Blonde. Fin collet. Nez: résineuse. Houblon frais. Agrume. Citron. Bouche: ronde. Petite chaleur d'alcool. Belle amertume. Fruité. Melon. Agrume. Finale sèche et résineux. Très bien.
Bottle and tap. Had a long time ago for both. Remember they both were great. The tap Gave more citrus flavors, the bottle has a barrel aged taste to it.

THE best double IPA on the market, Firestone really hit a home-run with this one. Best of all, its available year round and is not hounded as a white whale (you know what Im talking about w Pliny and Heady Topper)....while there are IPAs that gleam higher stature, this one stands up to em all without one having to go crazy finding it.

Draft. Sunset-orange with brilliant clarity and a fuzzy off-white head. The aroma boasts wet grass, tangerine, mango, apricot, orange blossom and cotton candy; the flavor has lemon candies, orange cream, lavender and juicyfruit. The balance here is incredible and the fluffy medium body hides a good portion of the nearly double-digit ABV. Incredibly well-made, as is most everything Firestone does.
I had read the ratings, but this beer is better then I could have expected. Amazing!
11.8.2014. Bottle. Aroma is tropical fruits, grapefruit, caramel. Taste is sweet caramel, fruity

Aroma is huge citrus hops, spice and some sweetness showing through. Smells intense. Standard color if not a little more orange. Bright white head that adds greatly to the aesthetics. Taste is a citrus hop bomb which gives way to some honey in the aftertaste. Bitter but oddly drinkable. Palate is good. Overall well done, a little too bitter but I enjoyed it anyway.

Flasche 9 Monate alt. Alter Hopfen, harzige Noten, leichte Süße. Harzig am gaumen, Malz, Süße, ausgeprägte BItterkeit. Frisch sicher ein Knaller, so noch einigermaßen genießbar.

Full thick hoppy ale that I will buy often. Beautiful orange amber color with long lasting white head. Medium carbonation and very easy to drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Near perfect Imperial IPA. Nicely balanced hop bitterness with sweet citrus fruit cover the high ABV nicely. Ill take another.

Aroma floral, spruce, citrus, earthy, 
Appearance golden, amber, clear, frothy, tan foam, 
Taste light sweetness, very bitter, 
Palate full body, sticky, bitter, long finish, 
Overall I would suggest this beer to any lover of a good IPA

12 Oz bottle. Clear yellow-orange with a frothy white head and decent leaving. Dank hop aroma, herby and piney. Medium sweet flavor with lots of hop character, herby, piney and mild citrus. Hop bitterness ballgames of malt well. Medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and average carbonation. Overall, super delicious is a. Great balance.

Bottle to glass. One of my favorite easy to find double IPAs for sure. Huge resiny juicy tropical fruit hops in the aroma. Big fruity hop kick in the flavor as well, but a bit of an astringent bitterness. Big beer with well hidden ABV. Long lingering tropical fruit sweetness and a nice bitter on the back of the tongue. Always tasty.
A very fine beer. Sweet but not too sweet, hoppy but not too bitter and with amazing flavors of chocolate, citrus, and some earthiness.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a great hops and citrus blend.
Appearance- A copper to golden amber color with a small white head.
Taste- A great blend of hops, citrus and lemon zest
Palate- A medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation with an excellent dry crisp finish.
Overall- An outstanding beer.

Poured into a snifter, pours a slightly hazy golden color with an eggshell head that clings. The aroma is of floral hops and you can get a little residual sweetness from the malts and a touch of pine. The taste is much like the aroma, the floral hops with the sweet pale malts on the forefront with a nice piney bite at the end of the sip. Mouthful is appropriate for the style and is overall a great beer. Its what a west coast IPA should be, great hop blend that gives you great aromas and tastes, a bit of a bitter bite at the end but not totally unbalanced or undrinkable. Great DIPA

From a 22 oz bomber, bottle date 12/08/14. Enjoyed late January, 2015. Pours a golden orange, 1-2 finger soapy off white head. Ample carbonation, bubbles streaming up sides. Aroma is just nice, orange, pineapple, grapefruit, all kinds of citrus. I hate to use this word, but its just juicy. Taste follows the aroma, citrus and pine. Hefty amount of malt here keeps the bitterness pretty low. Super easy drinking. Carbonation makes it prickly in the mouth, but I like it. Sticky on the finish. Currently the best big IPA Ive had.

CBC 2014. Golden with a thick and lasting white head. Citrus hoppy aroma, with lots of orange and some lime, along with pine notes. Cryish citrus hoppy flavour with bready malt. Very bitter, but not in an aggressive way.

Fluffy white head, 2 1/2 fingers in depth. Hazy appearance and orange-yellow in color. Aroma is grapefruit and other citrus flavors w/ a malty backbone. Flavor is grapefruit, other tropical fruits, pine needles with a caramel backbone that moderates the bitterness. There is also a sweetness, possibly honey along with herbal notes. Great IPA

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours orange with a thick creamy head, leaning lots of nice lacing. Aroma is resinous and citrusy. In the mouth it has a medium body and moderate carbonation. Taste is aggressively bitter with loads of grape fruit and tangerine. One of the best I've had!
Very good ipa. Lots of citrus and grapefruit flavor and a good malt - hops balance. Just bitter enough and highly carbonated -- does not drink like it has a 9.5 abv!

Quite bitter, not the usual hop heavy double, lighter feeling as a result, but still with that big ABV. Heavy on the tongue but I love the golden hue.

On tap at the Ginger Man, New York. Pours orange with lasting white head. Malt, caramel and fruity hops in aroma. Sweet malty caramel fruit flavor with dry lasting bitter finish.
Golden coloured and hazy. Has a white head, lasting. Hoppy aroma, fruity and faint rubber. Flavor starts sweet, sugars and hoppy. Laqurice?

Bottle dated 10/30/15.
For today, this was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a nice looking hazy orange color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute. Lotsa nice foamy lacing stuck finely to the glass.
The smell had a sweet sticky grapefruit-esque leading to fine subtle juicy citrus and decent underscore of pine to balance.
The taste was pure bittersweet and refined to a sly subtle sticky citrusy conglomeration of pine. The aftertaste was mainly bitter that lead to a slightly dry finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body. 9.5% - really? Maybe closer when its fresh, not necessarily now. Still good and has a decent substantial carbonation to pound my tongue into submission.
Overall, pretty good DIPA that I would have again. Ill definitely seek fresher my next chance.

Picked up a bomber at Total Wine in Glendale Arizona. Bottle dated 11/24/14, so it is a bit aged

Aroma. Older bottle so the aroma is pretty faint. 

Appearance - good looking beer. Great golden color. 

Palate - very good mouthfeel. Doesnt feel like a 9% beer. 

Overall - good beer, I enjoyed the fresher Union Jack better, but I would try this again if it were fresher.
Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. ¨Modetate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. creamy palate. Fantastic.
bread, resin, floral, herbs, amber, golden, hazy, clear, white foam, rocky head, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, light body, oily feel, thin feel, soft carbonation, long finish, bitter,
355mL bottle that pours golden with a big white head. Fairly standard caramel/grapefruit aroma. Lots of grapefruit in the flavour as well as a sticky caramel and slight resinous pine.
resin, floral, citrus, golden, clear, white foam, medium bitterness, creamy, fizzy, average carbonation, wonderful double IPA one of the better ones I have tried

Bottle shared with Douberd. Clear yellow, lacing off white foam head. Hoppy aroma, some citrus tones, grapefruit also. Good bitter taste, again grapefruit, citrus notes. Lasing aftertaste. (Arnhem 201502)

A solid imperial IPA with loads of malt to help balance.

I could say more, but come see me again when I'm not drinking this lovely beer with a hop cascade of varied characters

Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours amber, nose is resinous, pine, caramel, taste is similar, citrus.
