Great aroma. A little cloudy. But, oh, that taste! Desireable on the palate- overall a very drinkable 9.5% delicious beer from Firestone Walker.

12 oz bottle. Bottled on 09/25/14. From saveur-biere.com.
Cloudy orangey golden colour with a mid-size foamy white head. 
Delicious aroma of fruits... orange, tangerine and grapefruit. Juicy hops, moderate bitterness, sweetness, caramel and malt in the aroma. Yummy! 
The flavour is moderately bitter, fruity, resiny and piney hoppy and candy sweet. Heady, tasty and delicious. An excellent DIPA.
22 oz bottle. Aroma: malty, piney, and citrusy, with hints of barnyard, and resin. Taste/Palate: crisp and somewhat sweet; finishes with a long bitterness.

Aroma: Citrus, pine, fresh. 
Appearance: Bright, crystal clear, golden, orange. Gorgeous, thick, creamy, white, three finger head (bad pour) that disappeared slowly. 
Taste: Citrus front-end, earthy, raisins, bitter hops. Slight tinge of alcohol in the finish. 
Palate: Fresh front-end that dissipates quickly into a mouth tightening bitterness. 
Overall: I poured this 12 oz. bottle into a glass in which I like to drink beer. Had big hopes for this beer. It was solid, just not what I was hoping for and drank much less than my 3.7 rating. RateBeer member Niksko summed it best, "Classic american IPA flavours (sic...hes from Melbourne), turned up to 11." #respectbeerbrethren

Bottle @ home.
Light yellow amber, clear, fine white head. Hoppy nose. Taste caramel, heavy hop, but boozy. Balanced, nice.

(Firestone Walker Double Jack IPA) Bottle 650 ml at home, served into a teku, ABV 9.5%
Deep and bright golden orange colour on the body, small but quite thick white head on top, average retention. Heavy lacing left behind. The body is clear, good activity in it.
Aroma of light citrus, orange, grapefruit, cookie dough, caramel malts.
Taste of tangerine, grapefruit, biscuit, nice floral notes that give it an extra something and make it stand out than other dipas, light alcohol burn, orange peel. Moderate bitter finish and aftertaste, but it doesnt need more.
Medium body, good carbonation, quite dry palate.
Great!

Light golden color. deceptive looking. Aroma is dank with some citrus and almost onion qualities. Taste is hops on the front, sweet on the middle of the tongue and more citrus on the back. Dank and tasty a world class DIPA

Very nice IPA that doesn't feel strong but is. A bit of a bitter aftertaste, nice color, no head and a bit malty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle. Crystal clear gold. Very little head. Citrus (grapefruit) aroma. Nice citrus flavor. Bitter aftertaste. Alcohol is well hidden. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Perfect go to double IPA. Usually not too hard to find. Perfect balance of pine and citrus. Flavor is bitter with some earth and very slight alcohol warmth. Great excellent beer.
Bärnstensfärgad klar med stort smutsvit skum. Doftar och smakar som en riktigt bra Amerikansk dipa! Maltig/söt lite för söt men även mycket humle och bra beska! Köpt på Scandinavian park
Well I?ll be damned, this beer is tasty. Sweet, malty, toasted malty flavor, alcohol hidden well...just a really nice DIPA.

Maxs Taphouse, Baltimore, MD. From notes. On draft to shaker glass. Pours amber orange, two finger, fluffy off white head. Very heavy lacing and good retention. Aroma of grapefruit and assertive pine. Taste is heavy bitter yet a nice sweet balance in the background. Full bodied, lively carbonation, creamy resin mouth feel. Finishes long and bitter with notes of spruce tips, pink grapefruit and herbs. Alcohol is noticed in the finish but it really strings the brew together well. This double IPA will be hard to top. Excellent!

66cl bottle. Pours a bit hazy deep gold with frothy white head. Aromas of hops and earthy grains, some tropical fruits as well. Taste is a hoppy and bitter blow, though well-balanced with the malty body. Aftertaste is long and bitter with a hint alcohol pushing through. Frankly, I expected a bit more because of the hype but a really good beer all in all.
A sweet aroma, I very clean citrus taste, really easy to drink, a very nice double ipa!
Bottle from saveur-biere. Clear dark gold. Thin to medium white head. Super balanced taste and super balanced aroma. Hops and fruits all over. Wheres the alcohol? Lovely!

Fantastisk humlebomb i både doft & smak & det märker man av blandningen av 6 amerikanska humle sorter. Man känner sötman av alkoholen men ändå är den ganska gömd i humlen, en bra balans. Man kan även känna av malten den fina malten. Bl.a karamell.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear radiant orange amber with big frothy off-white head. Great hop aroma. Fruity and spicy. Bigger medium body. Firm bitterness but never sharp or unbalanced or unpleasant or outlasting its welcome. Alcohol hidden well. Such drinkability for such a big beer. Nice.

Super citrusy aroma. Grapefruit, orange/tangerine. A good hops/malt mix in the aroma as well. Taste is spot on. The malts subdue the hoppiness a lot, though you can still taste both. More orange/tangerine in the taste than grapefruit to me at least. delicious.

Pours with a nice white head, which settles to a fine layer. Massive burst of hops in the aroma, mostly the Simcoe and Centennial to me. Lots of citrus and resin here with lasting bitterness. A bit of alcohol warming. Very drinkable.

355ml bottle from Brewdog online store. Pours a clear orange amber colour with a frothy white foam head leaving lacing and aroma of caramel, mango, citrus & pine resin, earthy, hoppy. Flavour is sweetish malt caramel nicely balanced with tropical fruits, peach, floral orange, grapefruit & pine, grassy bitterness. Oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation, dry earthy bitter finish. Very drinkable DIPA!

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 26 Sep 2014) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with grapefruit, citrus, honey, hints of basil and lots of fresh hops. Fruity, hoppy taste with notes of grapefruit, pine needles, biscuits, peaches and a solid, fresh, citric bitterness in a finish with a slight alcohol bite. Almost full body, with balanced sweetness. Excellent DIPA with an impressive hop character. Lovely beer!

Bottle thanks to Justin. Another needless extra. This guy is killing me. Nose is super citrus and dank. light copper color. Minimal white head. Taste is immediately bitter with a light malt backbone. Hop flavor is moderately citrus. Overall pretty good.

Pours hazy pale color with lots of head. Aroma is amazing. Smells like fresh hops. Grapefruit grassy with citrus notes. Taste is full body with lots of malt character followed by wonderful grapefruit and hay hop bitterness.
Orangebrun klar med høyt beige skum. Lukter sitrus, ananas og fersken. Bittersøt smak, mye frisk sitrussødme. Kjenner alkoholen. Bitterheten sitter lenge.
Out of the bottle..... Burst of Citrus... Nice Head... Aroma of Clean and Crisp. This was very nice

Bright, clear amber appearance with a large, off white head and lots of lacing. Resinous hop aroma behind the citrus and soft fruit. Pine and citrus hop flavors dominate although modest malts emerge on the back of the palate. Unique, complex aftertaste; theres the bitter, spicy, herbal hops, and the alcohol bite, but also a hint of wood. Full-to-medium bodied, nicely carbonated mouthfeel with a long lasting finish.
On tap lievemente ambrata note maltate lieve caramello tocco resinoso lieve nota alcolica buon amaro finale agrumato 3
Drink from bottle in my. Aroma is hoppy, grassy, dank, citrus, nice. Taste is dry, hoppy, dank, bitter. Nice dipa, not in your face and can drink it.

@ The Ginger Man à Manhattan. Une bière jaune avec un peu de mousse. Un simple avec du jus de citron. Elle est peu lactique et passablement facile pour ce type de bière car lacidité nest pas tranchante. Facile et sèche.

The fruitiness up front works well, malt blends then fades. Chewy, robust mouth feel. The finish has an element I cant define that detracts from the experience. Solid but not on par with Wookey or Union Jack.

Pours a crystal gold with a small light head. There is a strong sour hop aroma as well as lemon. The beer has a nice crisp, light, bitter flavor which hangs on the palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours with a thick white head, that leaves tons of lace on the side. Golden and clear. Pine and spruce notes, with caramel. Strong bitter flavor with a sweeter tone on finish. Full-bodied with some heat from the alcohol and a decent amount of carbonation. Lots of fun in the bottle, but I be the fresher draft version is even better.

Bottle. Pours super clear. I could a newspaper through this beer. Nice white head and some lacing. Nose is lots of pineapple and citrus. Taste is same with some nice malt sweetness. Lasting pine bitterness in the aftertaste. You can not taste the 9.5%. One of the best!

22oz bottle - 

Completely surprised that my local grocery store began carrying this, because quite frankly this is the type of store that caters to swill drinkers. Not to look a gift horse in the mouth (what an odd saying), I bought this and Speakeasys Double Daddy and enjoyed a Saturday evening at home. 

So, the beer pours out a brilliantly clear, golden yellow body, tight bubble stream and airy, light 1-finger white foam cap. Aroma is just a beaitiful display of fresh hop goodness. Juicy grapefruit abounds with a stunning showcase of fresh, floral hops, minimal malts and some showing of alcohol. The hops continue to pound the senses on the palate, with an onslaught of ripping, shredding, grapefruity hops. I havent had a palate wrecker like this in quite awhile, and it was a pleasure to consume. The malts seemed to relish in taking a backseat to the hops, which also seemed quite alright with being the star. So easy to enjoy and so easy to recommend. I think its a stellar example of a classic West Coast DIPA and couldnt suggest this one enough. Kudos to Firestone Walker!! Job well done.
Pours a clear dark orange with no lacing. The aroma is orange, tangerine and other citrus notes followed by pine.

Vizuális síkon nemigen okoz csalódást, a krémes habja és narancstea-színű mézteste közötti kontraszt látványa már önmagában is megér egy misét. A karizmatikus illatok széles spektruma ront ránk hirtelen, így alkalmunk nyílik megcsodálni a vérbeli amerikai vonalat az illatok terén megjelenítő szikrázó komlós, fenyős-gyantás fergeteg pazar játékát. Férfi parfüm, tarka virágok, almás pite, méz és karamell szertelen aromái cifrázzák az élénk képet, gazdagsága szűnni nem akaró. A kortyok kirobbanóak, teltek, szépen strukturáltak, pontosak, de korántsem unalmas hangvételűek. Mértékletes, bodzaszörpös, karamelles, akácmézes édesség szövi körül a feszes szerkezetet, élénk és vibráló jegyeit nem győzzük csodálni. Közepesen száraz, nem kimondottan keserűség-orientált ital, a hangsúly sokkal inkább a mesterien kivitelezett, minden elemében magával ragadó, elmélyült ízvilág lebilincselő jellegére helyeződik. Boróka bogyós, sárgadinnyés lecsengéssel búcsúzik, karaktere emlékezetes marad, mintegy etalonként szolgál a műfaj egyéb képviselőinek vonatkozásában.

650ml bottle. Clear copper, long lasting white head, excellent lacing.
Aroma is very hoppy, lots of fruit, tropical.
Flavour is very hoppy, some alcohol, malty, alcohol.
Warming hoppy mouthfeel, medium body, moderate carb.
Finishes long, hoppy and malty.
A very drinkable DIPA, very nice.
this is about as good as an Imperial can get. try it if you have not. Totally worth the extra $$. Very hoppy, just overall phenomenal
Bottle pour. Clear golden with a large white foamy head. Grass, floral, and light hop aroma. Medium body. Grassy flavor with a hoppy aftertaste.

Pours a nice golden copper colour with a little white lacing and no head. Aroma of pine and lemon. Like a lot of beers it tastes like it smells. Pine and lemons its a real palate wrecker, but its pretty good.

Poured from a bomber to a pint glass, I am a big fan of the Firestone products and this did not disappoint. This one was hop filled, dry but in a mouth watering sort of way, and I had a hard time believing it is 9.5% until I caught a nice buzz from just a bomber.

Poured from tap to glass. Golden hue with creamy white head that settled. Aroma is pine, caramel, tangerine, grapefruit. Mouthfeel is great with a medium body and crisp carbonation. Taste is sweet followed by a nice hop bitterness. Overall this is a great ipa.
High ABV, even for a DIPA. It seems dominated by resin hops and the flavor is a bit muddled, with less citrus than I would like. Good but not great... lacking subtlety.

Bottle sampled @ Firestone Walker Tasting. Thank you! BBF 10/04/2015. Golden, creamy white. Nose is yeast, citrus, thick dough, honey. Taste is honey, medicinal, citrus peel, caramel, faint pine, decent yeast body. Prob. too old, too yeasty & not really my thing. Okayish. Instructions were not clear, got penis stuck in bottle.
Pours golden with not much of a head. Aroma is citrus, pineapple, hops, honey. Taste is honey, sweet, brett?, hops. Great beer.
This beer does not taste like it has that much alcohol in it. Great colour and aroma, really enjoying this beer.
GABF 2014. Gold color with a small head. Light piney aroma. Very potent bitterness. Light pine and grain flavor.

Citrus/rind, bitter hop aroma; sweet malt. Similar citrus hop flavor, plus a lot of pepper. Sweet, light caramel malt; not as sweet as the aroma -- I assume because of the strong bitterness? Nice melon-like fruity aftertaste.

Reviewed On: (6/22/14):


*Glassware: IPA Tulip


*Serving: 22 oz


*Aroma: citrus, grapefruit, pine, tangerine, tropical fruits


*Appearance: Pale Amber with a four finger head. The head has tons of fizzy big bubbles. The head color is off-white. It slowly receded to two fingers of head. Lots of carbonation streaming up to the head is probably why it stayed the way it did. After consuming the beer, a minor amount of lace was left behind.


*Taste: Sweet malt upfront, citrus/grapefruit in the middle, and finishes off w/ a pine taste.


*Palate: Medium body, oily mouthfeel, lively carbonation on the tongue. Finishes off very dry and bitter.


*Overall: A well balanced and crafted Imperial IPA. It has the maltiness, bitterness, and dryness an Imperial IPA should have. An excellent offering from on of my favorite breweries.

"i was told this is an imperial version of Union Jack, which Ive yet to have, but now may have to find. another very solid entry into the IIPA catergory. sweet fruity estery pine aroma, bittersweet grapefruit flavor. decent body - similar a bit, but thinner than Hop Henge. good stuff, easily the best FSW beer Ive had to date. 2/11 gotta up it a tenth after holding up so well to the other great dipas at the festival. overall up to a 9."
Pours a clear amber. Has a strong floral hop and caramel aroma. Has a sweet floral and citrus hop flavor with some pines and caramel. Finishes with a string bitter hop aftertaste.
Grapefruit, floral, pineapple, tangerine, dank/resin, cracker, honey, biscuit. Lingering grapefruit rind. Pretty perfect dipa that is burly but controlled.
Excellent XXIPA. Hoppy aroma and peppery hoppyn bitterness. Some alcohol catches me off guard. Overall great beer and will have again. Oh BTW it was in 12 oz bottle

Wow. Great flavor. Enjoyed the balance. Slight alcohol on palate but not over powering. Loved the pour. Always enjoy Firestone. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a bright gold and clear with a quickly receding white head. Aroma is caramel and lemon-centered. Taste starts off caramel sweet with citrus and stone fruit behind it. Finishes sweet with lingering bitterness. Medium-heavy bodied with a lot of sticky sweetness. A little alcohol heat, but its hidden behind the sweetness. 

Overall: Decent, but a bit too much on the sweet/caramel side to be really drinkable. The finish especially is sweet and a little syrupy rather than crisp and dry. A good DIPA, but not one of the more drinkable ones.

Es una cerveza de color naranja dorado con una grande y cremosa espuma blanca. Su aroma es de mandarina, pomelo y fruta jugosa. Cuerpo Maltosa y sensación alcohólico en el paladar. Tiene una amargura muy intensa. Es una cerveza impresionante.

Bottled. Cloudy pale amber color, creamy head. Caramel infused resiny aroma, sweet floral notes and fresh peach juice, slightly acidic grapes. Heavy maltiness with plenty of caramel flavor, but not sweet. Bitterness could be stronger, but this was an aged individual. Highly resinous finish. Almost full bodied, frothy texture is fresh. Very good!

SWBF 2014. Pours clear orange with a low white head. Aromas of peach, caramel, resin, apricot, pine and hay. Taste is peach, caramel, resin, apricot, pine and slight honey and hay notes. Mouthfeel is slightly oily and viscous with medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with a small but lasting white creamy to frothy head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is of resin, rich tropical fruit, floral and citrus. Lightly sweet and medium bitter taste, with flavors of juicy grapefruit, honey, sweet tropical fruit. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation and a lightly bitter and long finish. Solid malt backbone and not hint of alcohol. Wow.

Bomber poured a clear golden color with white head. Lots of pine and grapefruit on the nose; follows onto the palate. Some herbal and earth tones on the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Pours a clear gold with light head that settles quickly. Aromas of toffee, oranges, and toasted malts. Flavors of bitter oranges, pine, and sweet malts, with a bit of alcohol at the end.

From notes, 4 oz draft pour consumed on 5/18/2013 at ChurchKey. Clear shiny golden with off-white head. Nice lacing. Aromas of citrus, pine, resin, honey. Tastes of big grapefruit, pine, floral hops. Medium body with a semi-dry finish. Juicy mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. Fantastic Imperial IPA.

Light bronze, aroma has grapefruit but also a little chewy pale and crystal malt. A touch of citrus and melon brightness, and lots of chewy with a dash of alcohol. Doesnt really meet firestones standards.

Transfer from BA review on 4-7-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a beautiful crystal clear orange amber color with tons of big carbonation bubbles initially seen streaming up through the body of the brew getting enveloped in the one finger white head. The large carbonation bubbles quickly fade from view with all the while the white head fading to leave a decent level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell - The smell is big of a sweeter grapefruit hop aroma. A ruby red grapefruit and tangerine aroma combine producing a hoppy and sweeter citrus smell overall. These are not the only aromas however and are joined by some lighter pine and herbal hop smells as well as a nice tropical fruit smell of pineapple and papaya.

 Taste  The taste begins very big of malt and sweeter fruit flavors as well as a nice grapefruit hop taste. The fruit flavors are mainly of a tangerine and pineapple flavor initially, but as the taste advances some flavors of a slightly sour lemon come to the tongue mellowing out the fruit sweetness more toward the end of the taste. While the sweeter fruit lightens, the taste still remains relatively sweet as some caramel flavors come to the tongue in the middle of the flavor profile. Toward the end of the taste the grapefruit picks up in intensity and is joined by some pine hop flavors as well, with the combination of flavors leaving a nice moderately resinous and grapefruit bitter but still somewhat fruity and sweet flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is thick and smooth with a carbonation level that is on the slightly lower side. The thick and chewy body as well as lower carbonation are fantastic for the combination of sweet citrus fruit as well as citrus hop flavors, bringing them to the forefront on the tongue. 

 Overall  A very enjoyable and smooth tasting double IPA that hides the 9.5 % abv very well. It has a nice blend of citrus hop and sweet fruit flavors but also has enough balance via the pine, caramel and malt flavors to produce very easy drinking and robust tasting IPA.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. Nice clear golden-yellow with medium off-white head. Hoppy aroma, onion, grassy, malty. Heavy hoppy bitterness flavor, onion, grassy, malty, very alcoholic, notes of honey. Lively carbonation. Full body. Sticky bitter aftertaste.
sampled at a bottle share. low rating is due to not being a fan of IPAs. but if you love them, seek this one out.

12 oz bottle pours clear, bright orange with a small head. Powerful hop aroma of orange and citrus. Sweet hoppy taste. Oranges, pineapple, grapefruit, grass and pine. Medium to low carbonation with a semi sticky mouth feel. Aggressive? Yes, but very well balanced and pretty smooth for the abv. Great IIPA!

Poured with s small white head and a hazy light orange body. Pine, earthy aroma. Kind of like walking through the woods. Sweet caramel taste, with a big punch of bitter hops. Slightly sour on the side of the tongue. Its good, but I like regular Union Jack IPA more.

Pours a hazy orange, with a small white head. Lots of citrus, pine and honey on the nose, some hops. Taste is fairly balanced between hoppiness and maltiness. Very good, could have used some more bitterness though.

Look: pours a clear orange color. Bright white head. 
Smell: citrus and tropical fruit. Tangerine, grapefruit. Mango. Sweet sugar.
Taste: grapefruit. Ginger ale. Lemon. Sweet Oranges. Slight bitterness but not over whelming. Very little booze.
Feel: dry. Leaves a film on the mouth. Makes you want to go back for another drink each time.
Overall: great beer. Love the aroma. Great mouth feel. Love the taste. Not an over whelming IIPA. Love it all around.
First drank: home 9/3/14
This is actually the double jack proprietors reserve, with the green label. Really good double with the right amount of floral and bitterness. Excellent ??

Bottle while visiting Seattle. Pours gold with a white head. Sweet caramel aroma with over ripe fruit. Medium body, medium carbonation. Booze is very well integrated, barely there. Theres orange, caramel, toast, pine, wood and they are all where they should be. Not sticky sweet, nice and dry and bitter at the finish. A juicy, tasty drop.

Served on-tap at TJs into a snifter.


A - Pours amber orange with a small one finger tall white head leaving little to no lacing down the glass.


S - Smells of sweet caramel malt, HUGE citric fruit punch; most notably grapefruit and mango; Piney hops and a tiny bit of biscuit hiding in the shadows. The booze comes thru a bit once it warms but it is hidden well. This is nice and fresh with a big citric hop aroma that could last for days. Very nice nose.


T - Plenty of grassy hops up front quickly giving way to a mix of citric fruit and sweet caramel malt. The strong citric presence is not as strong here but it is still prominent. The finish is a mix of caramel sweetness and lingering citric hop bitterness. This was enjoyable but a bit of a letdown after that nose.


M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Sticky sweet feel with tons of pungent, grassy, hops lingering on the pallet long after consumption.


O - I really enjoyed this one. The taste was a bit of a letdown but the overall beer was very solid. It isnt Pliny but that is no problem. Thanks again to Matt for putting on another great event!

(bottle) clear golden amber colour with a small white head; strong aroma of grapefruit; honey; rich lightly bitter flavour with a long medium bitter finish; slightly thick palate, well hidden alcohol, very nice

12 ounce bottle. Bright amber gold color. Small tight white head with nice clinging lace. Subtle pine hop nose. Bittersweet toasted malt flavor has tropical notes, mango, grapefruit and orange. Complex citrus hops are aplenty. This is one tasty brew. Finish is resiny and spicy with bitter notes.

Bottle at Firestone Walker tasting at Beer & Beyond shop. Clear amber with a nice head. Strong and pungent hops driven aroma with mango, honey, grass, wood, pine,tangerine and caramel malts. 
Sweet with rich fruity (mango, grapefruit), piney and malty flavors, high bitterness, very well balanced. Medium-full bodied, dry-ish and sticky mouthfeel, despite high ABV dangerously drinkable . Great beer.

Picked up one of these up in Colorado, as it isnt distributed to my locale. About 2 months old when I opened it. Golden yellow appearance with a large head. Aroma is delicious citrus/pine hops. Taste is composed of juicy hop bitterness plus a nice sweet malt. Alcohol is very well hidden. Theres something a bit more complex and different in here than most other DIPAs Ive had. Great great beer. If you like DIPAs and you havent had this, you are missing out.

355ml bottle at home (bottled on 21.03.2014). Pours copper with a small head (pretty unusual for an IPA, on the other hand the small head can be explained by the 9,6% ABV). Aroma: a lot of herbs and pine tree, with some slight white fruit aromas in the background. Taste: very well balanced and elegant, at the same time bursting with hops (herbs and pine), with some delicate sweet aromas from malt in the background. The alcohol is very well hidden. A very solid and at the same time dangerous double IPA (due to its incredible drinkability).

Impressionou pelos aromas de grapefruit, tangerina e manga adocicados. Colar branco com tons beges, de bela formação e persistência. Muito saborosa, com amargor muito presente mas aveludado. Álcool presente e equilibrado. Excelente.

Aroma: grapefruit, tangerine, lime, juniper
Appearance: pale gold, minimal foamy head
Taste: medium bitterness, slight sweetness, slight sourness
Palate: bitter finish, medium body, slick texture, average carbonation

Great hop composition, well-hidden alcohol. The only disadvantage is the high import price... 12 Euro per 650 ml bottle...

Bottle. Clear dark yellow, lots of lacing. Big grapefruit and tangerine taste with herbal hops as well. Malt balance in the middle with a clean bitter finish. Big rich mouthfeel. Excellent big boy dipa! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2014 Pours an orangey shade of gold. Well retained orangey head. Taste is luscious and bitter, screams of a new world IPA. Creamy body, stays well on the palate - you dont want to swallow this beer. Perfect.

Very nice IIPA. Tounge numbing, boozy flavor with in your face hops. Purchased in Berlin for ~12 at Das Meisterstuck (great restaurant and beer bar!). Pours clear with orange color. Hard to find but delicious beer.
Bottle. Pours gold with thick head. Smells citrusy, tropical and piney. Taste bitter and sweet, dry dinish. Good mouthfeel and very smooth for 9.5%

Pours gold orange with a medium off white head. Aroma is of citrus pine hops, yeast and sweet caramel notes. Taste same as aroma with citrus, grapefruit notes up front followed by caramel malt, brown sugar, resin and yeast notes. Palate is a full body, mild carbonation, sweet and smooth mouth feel. Finishes with a sweet caramel malt, yeast flavor and some good moderate citrus grapefruit hops bitterness on the end for balance. A very good well made full flavored and tasty.
Pours a clear golden color. Aroma and taste are citrus, grapefruit, and tropical fruits.

Bottle at home. Medium high fluffy white lasting head. Clear good looking amber body. Powerful apple pear caramel aroma. Alcohol dominated sweet malt straw bread flavor with a good deal of hops bitterness. High carbonation, long bitter finish. A shame that the alcohol is not better hidden.

Bouteille 650ml. Couleur orangée translucide, mousse blanche crémeuse persistante laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de pamplemousse, fruits tropicaux, malt, alcool, ananas. Goût de pamplemousse, malt, alcool, houblon résineux, sucré léger, bonne amertume insistante. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.
Amber colour. Tropical fruit aromas. Malty, grapefruit hops, finishes bitter

Bomber. Surprisingly found at the REAL store at Spandau Arcaden, 15 months old. Pours light amber with a frothy head. Nose has loads of grapefruit and some cereal. Taste is bitter with grapefruit and some mangoes. Would love this fresher though!

355ml bottle. Pours a hazy deep golden amber, with a smallish off-white head, which lasts reasonably well and leaves a little lacing. Tangelo, grapefruit and tropical fruit hops mix with a little caramel malt to create an alluring aroma. An initial mango flavour is soon overcome by powerful grapefruit and kiwifruit hops, with a touch of resin lurking in there too. Quite smooth caramel malt reins things in a bit in the mid-palate, before succumbing to tangelo and resin hops in the finish. A big, bold and highly enjoyable IIPA.
Bottle from Archive Beer Boutique February 2014. Hazy orange colour with a melange of fruit flavours ranging from citrus to melon to pine. In the mouth the beer leaves a thick coating on the tongue.

Delicious IPA. Strong and smooth on the palate. Flavor is a strong hops and the aroma agrees. The color is a beautiful golden yellow with the standard broken white head that can be expected of a nice IPA. Amazing brew from Firestone.
Gold, thin white head. Sweet, floral nose...a bit of citrus, tangerine. Mild bitterness, mixed with pineapple. Bitterness lingers, but didnt overpower. Moderate carbonation.

This is perhaps the best double IPA I have ever tasted. Literally smells like fresh pineapple juice. Pineapples blasting you in the face the whole time. Beautiful color on this one. The taste is out of this world. Its just so fresh. Pineapple, orange, grapefruit just dominate it. Nice malt backbone thats not too sweet just right. Firestone Walker is an excellent brand, Im completely hooked.

Bottle. Very clear golden pour. Pure white head which just about lingers to the finish. Deep rich pine and grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit and hop bitterness taste very well balanced and smooth. 9.5%abv is really well hidden. Excellent specimen
Pours a clear golden orange colour with a white head. Aroma is malt citrus, fruit, caramel, woody notes and hops. Taste is medium to high sweet leading to a big hoppy finish. Really good.

Barwa: złocista, klarowna. Piana biała, drobno pęcherzykowa, średniej wielkości, ładnie oblepiająca szkło [5/5]

Aromat: słodowy (zbożowy, herbatnikowy i nieco karmelowy) z dominującym akcentem chmielowym (melon, cytrusy, zioła). Niestety trochę mniej przyjemnych naleciałości chmielu zielonego, łodygowego również obecnych, alkohol natomiast nieźle ukryty. [4,5/5]

Smak: słodowy, słodki i pełny, z wytrawną chmielową kontrą. Goryczka nieco powyżej średniej, ale przyjemna i niezalegająca. 

Następne piwo, na które zapolowałem w Żywcu i z tego co widziałem rozchodziło się, jak przysłowiowe "ciepłe bułeczki". Jest to legendarne piwo, wielokrotnie nagradzane na konkursach (m.in. złotymi medalami na trzech ostatnich edycjach European Beer Star). Z tego powodu miałem bardzo dużą ochotę na ten trunek i wiązałem z nim spore nadzieje. Barwa i piana są świetne, natomiast aromat i smak jedynie dobre. Wiąże się to zapewne z datą rozlewu tego piwa, bowiem ma ono już 9 miesięcy i choć data przydatności jeszcze długa to aromaty chmielowe zdążyły się już niestety częściowo ulotnić. Szkoda, bowiem jeśli tak smakuje w chwili obecnej można sobie jedynie wyobrazić jak dobre musi być świeże...
Bottle 50 cl. Orange, hazy With a minimal white head. Fresh fruity aroma, grapes and citrus. Medium bitter With a Nice long hoppy end. like

12fl oz bottle bottles 04/21/14. Consumed 07/11/14. Pours a clear, deep Orange with a one finger, Slightly off white head that leaves mild lacing. Aroma is big and juicy. Pine, resin, citrus, and tropical fruits. Really good! Taste is bitter but balanced well. Resiny pine and citrus with a bit of alcohol taste and warmth. Medium length bitter aftertaste. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Resiny in the mouth with a slightly dry finish. Overall a great IIPA. Big resin, citrus, pine, and tropical fruit flavours. Really nice.

Superb, and at 9.5% ABV it has real kick.

DWFIE; Bottle 0,65l. Pours clear golden with a lasting, creamy, lacings, white head. Nose is malt, caramel, citrus fruit, pine and catpee. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet, heavy bitter with a lasting finish. Body is medium, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Clear golden colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and pine needles with notes of caramel and citrus.
Sweet and fruity flavor of caramel, candies, hops, cardamom and pine needles.
Dry hoppy finish.

When a brewery is able to craft an Imperial IPA thats intensely hoppy and still extremely drinkable its a rare feat. The fact that Double Jack utilizes some extremely aggressive hop varieties (Warrior, Cascade, Amarillo, Simcoe, and Centennial) makes its balance even more impressive. The tremendous malt backbone on this beer allows it to reach a happy medium between malts and hops. (Regrettably, I almost used the unforgivably cheesy term "hoppy medium" to describe the balance. Ill go sit in a corner for a while.) You first notice the uniqueness of this beer when you see the surprisingly pale color. Hopheads who are thrown off by the appearance will be calmed by the big herbal, floral smell. People who are less excited about hops will be happy to note the smooth malt profile in the aroma. The taste is simply spectacular. Tropical, juicy, and savory flavors all the way through. Hop flavors come with peach, orange, grapefruit, and tangerine while the malt hints at sweet nectar. Finish is crisp, bright, and refreshing. Double Jack is one of those exceptional IPAs that has the potential to please hop heads and craft beer lovers who are less crazy about bittering agents.

Bottle.

A- Peaches, tangerines, citrus, juicy.

A- Vibrant orange color, slightly hazy liquid, white head.

T- Citrus, tangerines, fruity, juicy, bitter.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth juicy finish.

O- As damn good of an IPA as youll find. So juicy and filled with citrus. Almost like a stronger version of Fresh Squeezed IPA by Deschutes. Not a lot to say about this beer other than it is a fine one.
(bottle - 12 oz) Hazy gold pour with a white head. Piney hop aroma with lots of citrus sweetness. Flavor is piney at the start and bitter throughout and into the end.

Possibly the best beer I have ever drank. Wow. The aroma packed a punch of hoppiness and the taste delivered on it. (Had on tap)

Still a 5 on 2.5.14

Could not help but get a kick out of the previous raters comments. I rate this a bit higher. Aroma more on the herb side and very hoppy can sense the alcohol although somewhat masked. The appearance is he normal golden with a small white head that does not stay. Taste of citrus but the hops seem slightly out of line a heavy bitterness, but not all bad as it is an IPA. Full bodied with a soft carbonation and bitter aftertaste which I dont mind. All in all a good and perhaps great quality beer but balance is slightly off. Would not say I wouldnt enjoy again

4-pack of 12 FL oz. bottles, picked up by Michael in town - many thanks! To long-stemmed tulip, it pours a bright amber orange, with which an off-white head 1 pinkie-finger in length stood. Aromas of sea salt, sweat, wood chips, dog fur, pine needle tea, moss, and hop pellets. Tastes much the same with the addition of garlic, oniony hops, pickled pears, and wet cardboard. This was bitter and earthy as hell. Not too enjoyable on my part. Flavors lingered. Alcohol kicked me in the balls. Bitterness stabbed me in the eye. Double Jacks definitely got personality, it just needs to tone it down some. If I drank two of these one right after the other, then I could see how this might be okay. But alone, its this aggressive mummy who gives you cancer and swears a lot. I think Id rather drink this after getting nice and drunk on higher-gravity ales. Couldnt stomach it as a solo act, unfortunately.
En lättdrucken dubbelipa med sötma och en balanserad citrussmak avslutningen av beska är en god avrundning av en riktigt god öl!

An orange beer with a quite weak and blond head. The nose is sweet of fructose, lots of peaches, citrusfruits, also wet pine needles. The overally quite fresh even the sweetness, nice. Taste has sweet caramell, the slow bitterness dries the taste nicely. The bitterness is piney-herbal, not very aromatic but it attacks to strongly against the sweetness. Medium+ bodied, mild carbonation, not heavy. Quite sweet but still nice balance. This beer could be more aromatic, as like this the rough bitterness is dominating.

Bottle, shared by me... in my dining room... just now. 
Pours a pretty golden color with a very big head and decent lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is quite a bit of juicy hoppiness wafting from the glass, melon & orange being the biggest players here. Very pungent & inviting. 

The flavor is hoppy with lots of grass & grapefruit. The booziness is pretty forward & the bitterness is enjoyably high. 

cool.
Sparkling, clear amber orange appearance. Small head that retains well. Grapefruit and orange flavors. Bitter hop finish is balanced by a honey sweetness.

Bomber. Pours a nice deep gold with a decent head and aromas of oranges and tropical fruit with some sweetness and a hint of pine. Flavor is sweet with an appropriate blast of citrus and tropical fruit. Mostly oranges to my palate with a little papaya and a hint of resin but very nice.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle shared with friend from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear gold blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: floral nose with hoppy domination and some caramel notes and almond. Taste: a nice hoppy blast with floral and grassy taste. Good malt balance. Very tasty. Great beer. Aftertaste: nice wet bitterness and floral notes, great beer. Really amazing. I recommend it!!!

Basil malt hops and bread come from this orangeish hazy brew with a white head. Citrusy floraly hops with an earthy flavor jump over the maltieness then in the aftertaste maltieness takes over with a nice balance of hops. Its medium bodied and has good carb. Not a bad brew

shared with bartlebier, his girlfriend and Bierle; very sweet, complex nose of melon, honey, bubblegum, and a perfectly layered taste with a strong, complex hop bitterness trickling through the orange-, dried apricot-, melon-, honey-sweetness right from the start. Great DIPA!

65cl bottle courtesy of bastarda, post-Tristate tasting grill. Another Braufactum cooler import, complete with relabeling revisiting tasting notes ("Altgold"). Mellifluous honey palate transports aromas of wet bark, pineapple, bubblegum into a deeply embedded hop cocktail of same aromas, purified honey, marmeladed biscuit and mirabelle schnaps. Faints whiffs of alcohol and harsher simcoe wafts offset a perfectly lieblich composition to give it more of a street edge?
Bottle from VA Beach Whole Foods. Big, malty and fruity. This IIPA is well balanced with a big malt body and a spicy hop finish. Some citrus. Huge. Not for wimps.

Bottle. 
Huge leafy apricot aroma.
Orange golden, golden low head.
Full, light sticky mouthfeel. 
Flavor has a nice balance between honey, biscuit, dry berry notes and the peachy, piney, earthy and citric notes - great many dimensional hop bomb.

Color cobrizo limpio con espuma blanca algo ligera. Aromas de frutas tropicales, mandarina y miel. Cuerpo medio con inicio dulce, afrutado y meloso, sensacíon ésta muy breve, ya que pronto pasa a un amargor seco, resinoso e inteso con toques de alcohol y algo astringente.

Bottle thnx to Matthew ! Pours blonde . Good white head 
Smell is hoppy , but also very aromatic maltsweetness . Taste is bitter , floral and aromatic fruity hops , with a nice malty background . With even more in your face hops , this beer would be right up there with the whales ! 
Carbonation is perfect . Sweetbitter aftertaste

Tap @ CBC. Pours golden hazy with a small but froathy head. Would expect it to be thicker if poured into a bigger glass. Aroma of fresh hops, melon, grapefruit, yeast. Very fresh. Wellbalanced malt-notes. Taste is quite the same. Very nice and fresh hops. The malt is matching it perfectly. Alcohol is very well hidden.

Pours a clear amber gold with two fingers of fluffy white head diminishing gradually to a thin skim and limited spotty lacing. Nose is tropical fruits, piney hop resin, and sharp citrus. Taste is mango and papaya, pine and citrus, perfectly balanced with medium malt. Medium to heavy and chewy on the palate, with a lingering resiny bitterness.

Really, really good. Nose and taste are pretty much bang-on dead nuts perfect examples of the style, with neither hops nor malt overwhelming the palate or distracting from the other. My (very minor) objections are aesthetic: Idve liked better retention in the head, more lacing, and more sustained carbonation to lighten the mouth feel.
Smell of hop. Hazy golden colour, high white head. Aroma of alcohol, hops, citrus, herbs, cognac. Bitter. Soft but plentiful carbon. Sharp palate, slightly oily.

Good IIPA. Alcohol not hidden well which, for me, is a bit of a personal preference when it comes to IIPA's. First sip and it tastes boozy. Good thing it's still a helluva beer with a nice balance between the hops and the malt.

Old rating rerated 08.06.2014, 0,65l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, leafs, caramel malts, sap, pine needles, hops, citrus peel, lawn, citrus, dried fruits. Taste is slightly concentrated piney, leafs, pine needles, sap, bark, hops, alcohol, lawn, dried fruits, citrus peel, caramel malts, moss. Longlasting bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a nice clear dark gold with white head. Citrus hop aroma and also some earthy notes coming through. Taste is impeccably well balanced. Citrus bitter hops with a huge caramel malt background making the beer much less bitter than most imperial IPAs. Tropical fruits, molasses, caramel and earthy flavors. Hides the high ABV very well. Medium bodied. Excellent imperial IPA!

I have had on draft and bottle. Fresh from the draft the nose opens right up with malty hops. Very good beer with a long finish.

Pours golden orange into snifter. This is one of my favorite tasting DIPA. The nose and flavor is of tropical fruits, hop oil, lemon rind. Chewy on the palate and a lingering resiny bitterness. A highly concentrated use of hops and malts that are in harmony with each other. Great beer.

On the boozy side for mine. Thick, heavy malts generating heat amd length. Almost Belgian-like with heavy fruits. Not particulary hoppy.

Clear golden orange with malt in aroma as well as flavor. Nice lingering bitterness. More malt presence than what I really prefer.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2015 Tap @cbc14. Re-rate, bottle. Pours golden clean, slight copper, with big head. Aroma is sweet, mango, some simcoe, piney, slight jam, dank hops and slight liquorice. Taste is first really sweet and a lot of malt, some jam too, and then heavy bitter, piney, slight minty finish. Big mouthfeel. Finish is dry and bitter and the alcohol you cant tell.

Clear almost glowing golden color with a thick white head. Aroma is floral, grapefruit and tropical fruits. Flavor is grassy, sweet caramel, grapefruit again. Well balanced bitterness with floral finish. Not bad!

Sweet tangerine and tropical fruits up front, followed by bubble gum, pine, resin, and earthy/spicy hops. All of this on top of, and mingling with, a nice caramel malt backbone. Finish is super bitter grapefruit rind, pine, roasted malt, and spice. The aroma was layered beautifully, and the flavors were nicely balanced despite all the different things going on. It went from truly super sweet to truly super bitter. This one was a roller coaster ride.

Blind tasting with the S&G Tasting group. THX to Mathieu87!
Only wrote down some small words and the score.
Very nice, full of taste, still quite easy to drink. Amazing beer!

Taster on tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration, first session. Clear dark golden body. Medium sized white head. Fresh fruity aroma, grapefruit and mandarin. Similar refreshing fruits to the taste buds, pineapples, peach and a touch of pumpkin. Lingering juicy malts to the ending. Fine bodied. Rounded mouth feel. A well-made solid drink (02.05.2014).

Pours light orange-gold with a small white head. Aroma is over-ripe grapefruit and beautiful floral notes. Taste is mellow red grapefruit & marmalade going to malty mid and a candied grapefruit/mellow bitter finish. Over all, this is a well balanced DIPA with a beautiful aroma. Excellent!

Wow. Bottle from Total Wine. Clear amber with small white head. Aroma of grapefruit and piney hops. Taste is the same with a nice alcohol burn. Might be my favorite Double IPA.

S - 8 - same really malty smell, some grapefruit smell from the hops but mostly earthy and floral. 
T - 9 - grapefruit, mango, papaya, orange, lemon/lime zest, pine, very fruity still despite being 2 months old. 
M - 4 - bitter, alc covered still even at 9.5, aftertaste is bitter grapefruit, pine and a little bit of alcohol. 
O - 4 - its good. Little bit more robust than the union jack, but not by as much as expected, however I do suspect they use quite a bit more hops in this one. Whatever theyre using in each beer, they definitely shown a preference for a clean citrus flavor in their IPA, with less "dank" and garlic/ onion flavors than other brands

My favorite double IPA outside of Pliny the Elder. Great aroma, a lot of citrus in the taste. Nice and hoppy

On draught at Todd English P.U.B. Crystal clear full golden color with some clingy white head. Aroma is passionfruit, grapefruit, nectarine, and a touch of pine. Taste is tropical citrus, caramel malt, and some bitter pine resin. The bitter note lingers in the finish.
Big malts, even bigger hops, quite bitter but somewhat tropical fruit as well. Very well hidden alcohol, very very smooth beer thats easily drinkable.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle dated just under three months ago. Wonderful piney hop aroma and amazing clear golden color. Tastes of mild citrus with a bitter bite just right for the style. I'm very impressed!

12 oz. Clear burnt orange with a lasting creamy foam and nice legs. Nose is citrus zest, toffee and pineapple with light notes of catspray and herbal-mint liqueur. Tastes of minty green herb, tangerine zest, resin, flowery honey and booze. Medium body is smooth with medium carbonation and well balanced. Very good, but the minty-citrus zest hop accentuates the abv too much for my tastebuds and keeps this one from being an upper echelon DIPA.

Aroma of tooth-flossing citrus and oddly pleasant malt background. Crystal clear deep orange. Very tart citrus flavor, like tangerines or mandarin oranges. Consistently bitter with malty sweetness cruising just below. Slick body that refreshes for a second and dry up immediately. Typical in some ways of the big west coast IPAs, but very unique flavor.

12 oz. bottle. Pour is a vibrant golden orange, with lots of carbonation and a medium white head. Aroma is crazy with tangerine, pineapple, grapefruit, other citrus. Hoppy piney notes are a bit in the background. Taste follows suit. Big malty sweetness up front with caramel and pineapple notes, followed by a blast of grapefruit and sticky hops. Good bitterness to balance the malt and booze. Well crafted beer.

Pours a very translucent golden color with moderate lacing (22 oz). Very nice IPA aroma of citrus and apricot hops. Taste is initially sweet and hoppy and the transitions to good bitter ending. The beer has a rather thin mouthfeel, not surprising based on the clearness. There is a slight "cooling" sensation on the tongue at the end, made possible by your friends at 9.5%ABV. A very nice drink, all around.

Bottle from Mane Liquor Muscle Factory. Pours golden like the throne on which Mr Madegenza is currently perched swilling this fine potion. Upfront aroma of caramel malts, bubblegum sweetness, bit of booze, sweaty barbell and some resiny hops. Flavours are pretty malt driven, lots of caramel/honey malts, bubblegum booziness, old protein shaker, loads of resin. Bitter finish with a nice warmth from the booze. Great drop.

Lightish golden color with some foamy white head. Nose is lovely grapefruit, lemon blossom, pine, pineapple and a hint of passionfruit. Flavor is lots of citrus, grapefruit, a bit of pineapple. Really fresh and juicy. Finish is aggressively bitter with along finish, no biscuit.
Classic american IPA flavours, turned up to 11.
Freshly tapped into tulip glass..deep orange with white head..aroma of citrus,hops..resinous,floral..taste of all the above with great bitterness but not overwhelming..great DIPA.

An exceptional DIPA that is unusually mild in terms of both flavor and feel.
In part, this is due to the low hop level for style. Not sure of the age of this bottle, but that could contribute to the mellow nature.

Rich flavor that changes with warming.

ABV well hidden.

Large creamy head rich orange glow like pour strong carbonation aromas grapefruit floral spruce stone fruit caramel tropical fruit the flavours sweet caramel crisp a strong bitter excellent balance grapefruit sweet floral mango pineapple apricot pine goodness ripping tastes really top flavours the finish best tastes floral good balance rich hops and malt lasting bitter pine taste not many faults superb tasting DIPA sharp and crisp
UPDATED: APR 16, 2014 Great beer, great smell, great taste and full body. A very good beer, try it out. However I still feel there could be more to it.

Very tasty DIPA. You wont be disappointed. Alcohol flavor is not very apparent. Grapefruit flavor definitely comes through. Really easy to drink. Only negative I can come up with is that I have experienced better after-taste, but it is still pretty good. Without a doubt on my list of favorites and I definitely recommend. 

*Appearance I always give a 5 to, as I could really care less about the looks of a beer.

From a bottle. Big strong fruity hops flavours punch you in the face with the first sip and I liked it. It mellowed as it warmed and the malt came through, strong but not overpowering alcohol taste. Give it a go.

3/4" off white foamy head, short lasting with low lacing. Clear very pale amber liquid. Strong hops aroma, mostly floral. Picked up some phenolic aroma that dissipated quickly. Very bitter, hoppy taste and middle sweet caramel malt, finishes malty. Moderate to high body finishing bitter but on clean side and sticky feel, moderate warmth. Very enjoyable.

Aroma is supremely delicious. Popped the top of the first bottle of a 4-pack and immediately was hit with delicious hoppy citrus (almost kind bud aroma...miss that good stuff!). Amazingly smooth for a DIPA. Bitterness and alcohol is hardly noticeable. Definitely recommended.

text: Big. bold up front aroma and taste, but goes down easy. Amber color with nice creamy head, hoppy smell, and slick mouthfeel. This is how a double IPA should taste.
Exceptional DRIPA with a great grapefruit flavor without tons of bitterness. Highly recommended.
nice foam,very malty mouth feeling,grapefruit ,nice hop finish,warming perfect ipa
Med ölföreningen, smak och doft av tropisk frukt, citrus, humle, honung, grapefrukt och tallkåda. Torr, fruktig med en fin pepprig beska med smak av grapefrukt och tallkåda.

Flaska från Bier-deluxe, drucken med ölföreningen. Inte purfärsk, men ändå riktigt bra. Stora, rena välbalanserade smaker. Stor kropp, stor fruktighet, främst grape, mandarin, mango, citrusblommig, tjock, lite oljig, besk citrus marmelad. Riktigt, riktigt bra.
22oz bottle pours a pale amber color without much head. Mild hop flavors and a bit of alcohol harshness.
Amazing DIPA. plenty of flavor and surprisingly smooth for the high alcohol content. One of my new favorites.

Not the hoppiest double I've ever had and in a good way. Doesn't sacrifice taste and palette, thankfully all my taste buds are intact. Very good beer would buy again when I have enough money.

2014/03/15 - Pours a clear, orange-gold colour with a tight, one finger, foamy, off white head. Aroma is orange, grapefruit, pineapple, mango and herbal hops and pine. Taste is citrus, tropical fruits with a sweet honey malt backbone, pine and earthy undertones. Mouthfeel is somewhat sticky with biting carbonation and a bitter and juicy finish. ABV is very well hidden. One I the best IIPAs out there.

pours celar and golden, has a slight citrus aroma, has a nice blend of orange and grapfruit taste along with a earthy background. overall a very well balanced DIPA and has little to no hint of its high abv

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein orangegoldenes Bier mit geringer aber schönen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig herb, fruchtig, tropische Früchte. Geschmack stark malzig bitter, fruchtig herb, minimal würzig.

Appearance: clear honey gold, short and foamy white head, minimal lacing.  Aroma: pine, grapefruit, honey smacks.  Taste: grapefruit, marmalade, honey, graham cracker, blood orange, light herbs.  Finish: dry bitterness, mainly aromatic hops, hint of warm brown sugar.  Notes: Extremely well-balanced for a DIPA, which is admittedly not my favorite style. This one was quite enjoyable. Fragrant and bold, but with a good malt backbone.

Perfect golden color, 2 finger head. Nice pale / IPA smell, but strong like a double. Nice flavor, mix of hops, though none stand out. Medium palate. Good, but not spectacular.
Aroma is grapefruit and slight alcohol. Color is bright orange, and clear slight carbonation. Awesome balanced IPA. Slightly bitter.
A clear golden beer with a small white head. The aroma is tropical fruit and pine. The flavor is the same, but more piney.
Great beer. Cloudy orange color poured from a bottle with minimal head. Aroma of citrus and hops and strong taste of hops.
Pours a nice golden color. Decent lacing with hoppy, malty aroma. Sweet flavor with malty notes and just a background sour flavor. An outstanding beer.

Another perfect brew...late in the night at Wendys last night...bachelorette party...evennatvthe end this powered through as a standout....I cant believe the hop aroma on this...bitterness was way subdued but you still knew this was a XXIPA. If I keep drinking this Id have ten kids. The oils, grass tinge og grain the malts are unreal...hard to say this is balanced but GDamn it it is.bgood thong I dont live innPaso.
I am drinking this after a couple of days in a drink tank growler and it is still coming out with a great head. It has lost some aroma and mouth feel but the flavors are still great.

22 ounce bottle poured into a teku glass. Pours a clear copper with a white head of foam. The aroma is sweet pine and flowers. The taste is initially bitter but sweetens up and dries out in the finish. Medium carbonation.

Aroma - was definite big West Coast varieties of hops, some grapefruit, peach, and some lemon
Appearance - orange body, hazy liquid; 1/2" white head, that maintained great head retention, developed some really nice lacing.
Taste - very hoppy with grapefruit, peach, and lemon
Palate - body is medium; texture somewhat oily; carbonation is average; finish is long and bitter.

Bottle courtesy of the most wonderful and generous Mr Peter Fowler, The Shoulder of Mutton, Grove, Wantage, Oxon, consumed at home Sunday 23rd February 2014 Pours light amber actually more orange now I look at it again, its quite hazy with off-white head. Thick in mouth, it has that typical American big IPA flavour/taste. Soft, very soft mouthfeel citrussy, sweet mandarin perhaps a little sweet but the sweet orangey flavours come through, it even ends a tad dry. Nice, really nice.  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6

22oz Bottle BOD 01/18/14 A - Pours light amber with one finger white head that dissipates quickly. Good lacing. S - Cannabis, pine, and citrus. T - Strong citrus rind, pine, grapefruit, and tangerine. Alcohol hidden to well. M - Medium bodied. Lively carbonation. Slightly slick. Clean. Bitter finish. O - So strong, so delicious.

Golden color with white head. Big citrus aroma with herbal notes. Big malty flavor with caramel flavors followed by big hop flavor of citrus flavors of oranges and grapefruit. This is a really nice beer.

One of the best beers ever tasted . Doesn't taste like a 9 percent beer. Top notch.

Golden pour with a white head. Aromas of mango, pineapple, and lots of citrus peel. Flavor is huge hops throughout but not overkill. The malts bring just enough balance but the showcase is still the hoppy character. Crisp hoppy finish. Very good. Props to sloth for the bottle!
Tropical fruit and grapefruit aroma. Pours clear Amber with nice white head. Bitter citrus, mango, alcohol, biscuit, decarbonated water. Medium mouthfeel with correct carbonation. Dry finish.

Huge aroma rising up from a deep yellow pour with a thin off white head. Great flavor with a nice malty balance mixed in with the hops bitterness and an undertone of fruit. A new favorite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deuce to pint glass. Medium orange color with a frothy white head. Big hop scent, very fresh. Taste is also super fresh hops, tons of fresh citrus and grapefruit with a nice malt balance and clean bitter finish. Delicious.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2016 Clear, rich gold. Smells is strong citrus peels and pine, lots of caramel resin and pineapple. Taste is sweet citrus, grapefruit with plenty of spicy, piquant flavors (almost like a good blue cheese but not pungent). Mouthfeel is slick with a dry, bubbly finish.

Citrus as soon as the bottles opens followed quickly by pine. Gorgeous deep amber color. The taste is everything you expect in a DIPA. Sat back and enjoyed this one with a nicely aged Cohiba and John Lee Hooker. I only wish there were more on the shelf.

Bottle - BCA - Bottled May 2013, Drank Aug 2013 - Orangey Gold in colour. Very Very Hoppy; aggressive piney resinous oily hops. Very Fruity; grapefruit and tangerine citrus and tropical fruits. Malty backbone; quite earthy. Good hop bite; mouth puckering hop bitterness. Rather salty. Intense very bitter hoppy citrus fruity throughout. Terrific Imperial IPA!

12oz bottled 10/03/13
Clean pale copper body, dense white head and lace.
Intense aroma with hops dominant; pine, cedar, citrus rind and savoury spice. Some caramel malt underneath.
Moderate carbonation, quite dry, some alcohol warmth and slickness.
Plenty of hop on the body; bitter orange, pine sap, earthy spice with a backbone of light caramel malt. Firm bitterness lingers on a dry finish.
Nice ipa!
Bottle. Taste of citrus and pine. Nice tasting IPA. smell of citrus and pours a nice amber color. Overall good beer. Recommended.
Big beer all around. Great hop flavor, smooth without being overly bitter. Alcohol flavor fairly strong after warming up. Not much wrong with this one.
Bottle. Big tastes of booze, dough, citrus and pine. Damn near perfect in all respects. Excellent IPA.

Pours a deep, unbelievably clear amber with two fingers of fluffy white foam. Getting mostly citrus notes on the nose, definitely a bit of orange and some alcohol. Medium body with a lot of effervescence from the carbonation. Seems more carbonated than most IPAs, which seems to balance out the extreme hop bitterness and alcohol. Middle of the tongue, getting a lot of hop bitterness; hard to place the hop variety. Long after swallowing, the bitterness lingers on the middle of the tongue, but not in a bad way. Getting a definite warming sensation from the 9.5%, but you dont taste it as much as you feel it. Really enjoying this beer.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2015 Feb. 7, 2014. 12 oz btl. Wonderfully balanced. 9.5 ABV well hidden. Full bodied. First rate IIPA. 

Dec. 28, 2015 (re-rate). Single 12 oz. btl. dated Jan. 2, 2015, received as a Christmas gift. This is much drier than I recall. Wonder what effect, if any, the aging has had on this? Original scores unchanged.

Bright clear gold color with small white head and minimal lacing. Aroma is rich with citrus fruit notes and hops. Flavor is very good, with strong citrus, grapefruit bitterness and balanced amber earthy malts.

12oz bottle into a snifter.

Pours a slightly hazy deep gold with a very thin white head that quickly dissipates into a thin ring around the top of the beer. Just a few random spots of lacing.

The aroma is probably the best thing about this beer. Very piny and resiny with a bit of dank thrown in. Some orange notes in the form of overripe fruit.

The orange is more prominent in the taste with quite a bit of dankness and pine resin. A touch on the sweet side but bitterness is very high to help balance that out. There is a slight woody note that becomes more prominent as the beer warms and is quite nice.

Overall, a really good IIPA but I would stop short of saying it is amazing. My bottle is over three months old so I really would like to try this fresh. The hops have lost some of their luster.
Good. Mild aroma. Virtually no head. Deep amber color. Quite bitter but with a touch of sweetness. Seems to be widely available.

Pours a golden translucent orange with little head or legs. Aroma is grassy hops, resin, grapefruit. Taste is deep and bitter, dry, yeasty with some malt to balance. Body is very crisp. Like a crisper, slightly more bitter 8 Wired Hopwired.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2014 Clear light amber pour. Grapefruit and tangerine aroma. Sharp citrus hoppiness and then grassy flavor. Bitter hop finish. Similar to hopwired from 8wired in it&apos;s fresh grapefruit and grass flavor. This one is bigger though in every way. Good DIPA

22oz bottled 12/20 pours clear pale orange with small head. Nose is dank grapefruit, orane zest, lemon, pine. Taste is nicely balanced malt, grapefruit, lemon, tropical fruit, piney lemon, bitter. Finish is bitter lemony pine and citrus. Excellent.

Pours a clear golden amber color with a fluffy white head. Hop, citrus, caramel, floral, honey and malt aroma. Big hop, grapefruit, orange, honey, pine, malt and floral flavors. Medium body and carbonation. Well balanced bitterness and a crisp hoppy finish.

Fantastic. One of the best smelling Imperial IPAs Ive had. Strong piney and citrus aromas. Copper color with a nice white head. High carbonation to join the hop bitterness. Balanced malt backbone gives a full palate without being too heavy. Smooth and crisp. Blended well and the alcohol is hidden. Clean hops that finish mellow. Just the right amount of malt sweetness to even it out. A must try.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Bottle: Confirmed fresh; pours a bright copper color with exceptional clarity, topped with a light, khaki-colored layer of creamy, chunky foam. Aroma is full of spicy pines & big, earthy hop tones up front, followed by some lighter grapefruit rind, pear, & pineapple/tropical fruit in the back-end, slight pith-y but also quite sweet-ish. Bready & toasty caramel malts definitely make themselves known in the aroma. Taste has a big malt presence; caramel, toasted biscuit, & more than enough malt sugar sweetness to counter the hops. Bready, estery, earthy, musky, spicy, leafy, & lightly herbal. Dank finish with mild pineapple & grapefruit pith/peel. A small touch of onion-y, borderline garlic notes sneak in there, too (Summit, perhaps?). Very solid DIPA, though I think its slightly overrated. Definitely worth a try, though.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 Nice hoppy, citrus aroma you would expect in an IPA. light yellow with small head. Strong citrus and hops bitterness, roasty with a bit of malt. Good beer, strong and heavy beer. Taste higher than a 9.5 ABV.
Bomber shared by the nostalgic AndyReynolds - nose is grapefruit, lemon peel, and grass. Sip adds grapefruit, orange and a malty backbone. Balanced for sure. Bitterness creeps in in the finish.
Bottle. Tropical hops fo sho. Malts. Stuff. More stuffs in the aromas. Sprinkle in some army trucks just for fun. My type of beer.

Bottle into snifter glass, light coppery-golden color with off-white head. Aroma of very fruity hops (peaches, citrus), slightly floral with honeyish malt backing. Taste adds notes of herbal/pine hop bitterness. Heavy body, low carbonation, soft, slick with fruity hoppy finish. Very fruity DIPA, great balance. Wish I had bought another bottle, wont make that mistake in the future!

Firestone is a quality brewer an this beer, even though it was their first DIPA, did not disappoint... very hoppy and bitter but nicely balance by what must have been a large amount of malt... really good
Bottle. Wow. Amber with a thin white head. Big peachy pine aromas. A bit of fruit mixed with the big hop bitterness. Really good. Wish I could get it in Ohio.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2014 
Pours faintly cloudy golden to amber and sports a frothy off-white head with good retention. The all-hop nose is friggin bursting with peach notes, along with incredibly accentuated citrus and pine notes. It is dry, yet the aroma of caramelized malt appear on the palate up front, followed by pine notes, and the mid-palate is dominated by the citrus which has been turned to grapefruit notes by the bitterness; while the bitterness stays, bright fruity flavors like pineapple, peach, and apricot appear and stay well into the finish, which is dry, long, and sprinkled with a faint hint of anise. The medium carbonation speaks for the beers sophistication, as it accentuates the complex interactions of flavors without being in their way. Absolutely fantastic.
One of the best brews ever. Huge pine hop nose, fantastic hop taste slight alcohol that actually added to experience. Love it.

22 oz bottle - pours gold with frothy off white head . Huge citrus aromas with a bit of skunkiness . Delicious hop punch , mostly citrus rind . Smooth malt rounds out the bitterness . The 9.5 % abv is well hidden . Really F - ing good . ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a perfect Double IPA. Absolutely loved it! Had a citrus/grapefruit hop aroma/after taste

Elle est cuivrée-orangée et limpide, coiffée dune mousse mince qui laisse glisser une dentelle à gosses mailles. Le pamplemousse blanc et les épinettes et autres conifères, sur un fond dautomne, de fleurs et de sous-bois de forêt boréale sont les principales caractéristiques des odeurs. Très fruité dès lentrée en bouche; des fruits tropicaux dominés par les agrumes, mêlés à un malt bien dosé. Lamertume est douce et prolongée. Une acidité pas désagréable du tout nous engourdit un peu les mâchoires. Belle expérience gustative. Embouteillée le 3 octobre 2013 (933-221213)
In bottle. Huge citrus aroma. Big, sweet tangerine hop taste followed by a mild and progressive bitterness. Beautiful DIPA.

bottled: 1/7/11

A: pours a honey colored ale with excellent clarity and a single finger white soap-sud head to form and dissipate in a couple minutes, leaving a broken quilt of the same. Spotty-on-webbed lacing.

S: Sweet, cotton candy, pineapple, peaches, cintrus, grapefruit. Grapefruit, grapefruit. A bit sweet with lowly cloying malty backgrounds

T: Sweet, citrusy, sweet and more citrus. Very big (even after two months in the bottle). Not much bittering hops - or at least balanced in favor of the sweetened malts. ABV near invisible here. Well crafted. Wonder how nice it is fresh (within a couple weeks). Slightly soapy on the finish.

M: Medium-light body with moderate carbonation. The beer washes back easy and leaves a slick, resonous layer over the tongue and palate. Nice.

O: Very good beer. Well crafted, and I would argue this contends with the best IIPAs out there (Hopslam, Expo Hoppiness, etc).

Serving type: bottle

650ml bottle. Clear orangey golden colour with average, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Citrusy, piney hop aroma, hints of orange, tangerine, orange zest, biscuity caramel malty background. Taste is characterised by similar notes, dry, bitter, crisp; lasting finish. Clean, pure, precise, superbly crafted. Bitterness pushed to the limits.

March 23rd, 2012 - Firestone Walkers Double IPA blends in handily with other mediocre beers at my grocery store, where the selection is withered and scant. Looking across the wide swathe of cheap beers in brightly colored boxes, its hard to pick out the bottles worth plunking into the grocery basket, but Firestone Walkers Double IPA is one. In fact, I had no idea this gem existed. Firestone Walkers beers keep showing up to graduate student gatherings, and while its fine for a round of board games and taking down your opponent a peg, its never caused me to put the dice down and really enjoy the moment. But the Double IPA is different. Oranges, jasmine and just barely overripe peach flesh develop an incredibly fresh and powerful bouquet. Meanwhile, a medium palate and nice carbonation - visible through the glass in this orange marmalade brew - deliver a thick, balanced blend of jasmine flowers, floral hops, graham crackers, roasted and caramelized carrots, and all of it made more vivacious and 3-dimensional thanks to a boisterous carbonation. A long aftertaste helps me enjoy each sip to the fullest. Suddenly I can see why this hard-to-see brew is so well loved.

Awesome IPA. Sweet and fruity smell, grapefruit and orange, with a definite hoppy smell. Crisp and sweet taste followed by a perfect bitterness. One of the best IPAs out there.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2014 Bottle from bier-deluxe.de. Clear golden, slightly amber body with big creamy long-lasting white to beige head. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, citrus, mango, some grass, but also a pretty strong malt presence.
