S: Piney, Resin

T: Piney, Resin, Oily

M: Good Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Dry, Oily

Overall, a solid DIPA that punchs you in the mouth, strictly DIPA.
nice amber color, lacey white foam...clean citrusy aroma... complex beer, heavy on the malt and very alcoholic... I can see its appeal but too malty for me, not a fan.
Smooth complex double IPA. Very citrusy on the nose, with complex camely malt flavor. This was my first FireStone Walker beer, and I think its the beginning of a beautiful relationship between us.
For the sake of the social interaction just numeral ratings and/or some highlighted attributes. Huge IPA, resiny, alcohol warmth, citrus and complex caramelly malt.

My 27° birthday gift. The light amber color is decorated with an high co2 that keeps the glass alive. Thick and resistent white head. The aroma is the one of an IPA, with a citrus/resin more aggressive and deeper than usual. The taste is balanced, refreshing and then strong, with a good solid body. The palate is strongly alcoholic. Ive never drunk an IPA good like this one.
Top class DIPA. Very well balanced, lingering but not overpowering bitterness.

For something that came with a high IBU there wasnt a pucker up moment, Instead I got a dance of bitter and sweet which was clever. As it warmed the alcohol became apparent on the taste. This is my first Firestone beer, and a beer that many brewers would love to be able to brew, and to be fair there are a lot of new young turks giving this a run for the money. Im sitting here a bit happy having had such a rated beer, one for having it, and two for knowing that there are a heap of equally as good beers to come.

Tap at GABF 2013. Poured a clear light amber with a round white head. The aroma is malty rich hop with some lemon citrus fruit in the background. The flavour is strong bitter with a big malt liqourice palate and some lemon citrus fruit in the finish. Not your standard DIPA. This one dares to be different.

This may be my new favorite IIPA. Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a large tulip glass, its a clear, pale amber color with virtually no head.

The aroma is sweet fruit, like apricot or plum, with just a hint of citrus, and the flavor matches... Just the slightest bitterness, and a sweet after taste. Almost like drinking syrup, but in a delicious way!

Thus its one of the best IIPA I have had, if not the best
Thanks to tectactoe for the split on this. I thought it would be a little better. And hoping for a little more drinkable.

Bottled. Pours clear golden with a small, lacing white head. Aroma of citrus, floral hops and earthy notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and nice bitter. Medium bodied, oily text. and soft carb. A great 2x IPA.

Pours an almost orange color with white head. Head is small but lasts for a long time. Very nice herbal scent. Texture is very smooth. Excellent bitter finish after a pleasant creamy sweet start. I got this at a farirly new place in Wytheville, VA called Carters Beverages. Cool guy, thanks to him you can actually find a good brew in a plastic town.

Sample at SBWF 2013. Hoppy smell wth grapefruit, citrus and grass. Similar taste. Nice and strong bitterness that lasted a long time. Feels like it has lost allot of hop aroma, specielly in the taste. But still a very nice DIPA.

12oz picked up tonight at Brewers Haven for about $2.90ish.

Great foamy lacing atop a crystal clear golden brew...

Nose shows tropical fruit hoppiness.. melon and tangerine....slight bit of pale malt helps pull the hops up front...

Surprisingly restrained hand on the bitterness... hop flavors though are the big player... wonderful... vibrant...

Body is a solid medium... carbonation is about right... but could use a bit more bubble on the finish....

This is a huge winner... again, expensive for a DIPA, but I dig it... Very happy FW is making inroads into the Boise market.

Bottle: frothy white head. Light copper color. Massive hop lift. Fruit, citrus and spice. Very intense and clean. Fresh aromatic hops. No greens. Moderate sweetness and high bitterness. Not sour. Rich. Lots of intensity and length. Very pure California IPA. Over the top richness and hops.
Great aroma out of the bottle, sets the tone. Fruity and floral, amber pour. One of the best DIPAs I have ever had. The first sip was magical. Great price as well (7.99, bomber).

One of the best double IPAs ive had. Id say it is just a hair better than the Dogfish 90 Minute.

HOPs: floral, citrus. But there is a slight sweet taste there that i enjoy.

Great Carbonation. The aftertaste is enjoyable, not overly bitter.

On tap @ Blind Tiger, New York. Pours golden with a creamy finger thick head. Aroma has masses of nice tropical hops, with mango apricot and orange peel. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is bitter with orange peel and grapefruit, as well as apricot and lychee. Finishes off with a nice long bitterness.
Bottle @ brewdog bar. Amazing beer full body, with a nice maltiness which balances the beer very well. GREAT BEER!

12 oz bottle. The pour is a beautiful crystal clear deep ruby. White head, awesome lace. The aroma is a crisp citrusy hoppy scent, very very nice. The taste is just as citrusy. The finish is a tad different than I'd expect and the mouth feel dissipates pretty quickly. A very solid beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled at SBWF.  Clear amber, rich head. Minty grapefruit aroma. Sweet with medium-full body and rounded oily mouthfeel. Fruity with white pepper heat and grapefruit. Long bitter finish.

22oz bottle pours a clear light orange/amber. Small but sustaining light tan head, barely maintaining a skin. Great fresh citrusy aroma. Tangerine and grapefruit. Big bitter hop flavor. Malts are fairly light and sweet but tons of citrus here in the flavor. Slow building lingering bitterness but not overly so. Very pleasant, especially for a double. Terrific big hoppy beer.
Citrus and pine up front, mild honey in the finish. Smooth as silk! Medium mouthfeel. My favorite IIPA.
A good, fresh IPA. Bitter beer, but a little sweeter than I like. A reasonable IPA, but doesn't wow me.

Bottle from Total Wine Summerlin, Las Vegas. Clear orange pour, foamy white head. Aroma is very fruity, citrus, resin, pine and peach. Flavor is huge hops, thick body, very clean and refreshing. Slightly warming finish. Lovely.

7/12/2013 bottled date. Purchased at HEB here in Houston. One of the best DIPA you can purchase here in Houston. (The other being Founders Double Trouble, but that's a seasonal so hard to locate) just a ridiculous nose, great lacing and syrupy hoppy goodness here. Dank nugs abound but the abv never hits hard. Buy it often. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Coppery clear. Peachy and citrus hops, toffee-ish malts. Full body, without being cloying or hard to palate. Bitter, hiding the abv well. Malty sweetness. Probably one of the best dipas Ive had.
22 oz bottle shared with a friend. Orange with an off white head. Fresh citrus hop aroma and flavor. Smooth and dank.

One of the most multi double IPAs of ever had. Delicious though, and robust. Lots of depth of flavor and really Hoppy great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Orange in color with a bubbly off-white head. Sweet grassy aroma, some ripe exotic fruits and cats pee as well. Taste is quite similar here with some grassyness sticking through. Feels like your casual dipa. Harmless and easy to drink
Bottled, sbwf13. Golden, deep color, white head. Grapefruit, pine, hoppy aroma. Flavor has citrus, grape, mild caramel notes. Bitter finish that lasts. Solid dipa-- via beerbasher/winphone 7

Bottle. Pours clear golden yellow with a good white head. Aroma is pungent pine, citrus, grapefruit, pinnapple and malt. Taste is bitter hops, pine, fresh grapefruit, citrus notes and booze. Medium to full bodied , balance finish with a bitter aftertaste that is pleasant. My favorite IPA from Firestone Walker. Refreshing clean beer.
Poured from draft at the Bottleworks in Buellton. Absolutely amazing beer. I forget how great this DIPA is. The grapefruit aroma and taste is sensational!

Pours clear yellow with large white head. Nose is very fruity, full of mango, pinapple, citrus fruit. Taste is an intense melange of bitter piney hops and sweet candied fruit. Ends very dry. Perfectly balanced flavour profile. Excellent.
Excellent premium DIPA. Firestone continues a tradition of excellence. Aroma is not overwhelming, though the taste is quite strong. Try it if you can find it.

Smells sweet and almost woody. Do not get a ton of hops in the aroma. Woody like smell dominates. Sweet finish and bitter on the sides if the tongue. Doesn't taste strong but tastes very full flavored, maybe a bit thick even. Good overall, but malt dominates. Would like more citrus/floral hops to balance the malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good brew. Gold color. Citrusy. Malty. Smooth head. Laces glass with small waves. Bitter wash down. Certainly drinkable but not earth shaking. Adds nothing new to the already overflooded IPA market.
Excellent Imperial IPA. ! High alcohol content, intense aroma, and agressive hop bitterness taste makes this one of my favorites. A must try for all IPA connoisseurs!!!

Mmmmm, juicy, spicy and earthy nose with burnt orange peel, cardamom and papaya. Pours a rich honey gold. Flavour is intensely hopped with mango and lime zest at the front, pine needles and pepper at the back. A big alcohol kick underpins, albeit not in a bad way, and the finish is astringent, crisp, dry and moreish. Very nice.

Vigorous bottle pour into a snifter. Maybe a little past it's prime. Orange gold color with a finger of white head that lingers. Citrusy hop aroma and a bitter taste with subdued hops. Distinct citrus flavor. Good beer

Aroma: Pineapple and clean citrus. Maybe grapefruit. VERY reminiscent of Hopslam. Appearance: golden yellow. Two-finger white and foamy head that receded quite a bit after a few sips. Taste: pineapple, citrus, and a hot alcohol finish that, nonetheless, cleans up quickly with little aftertaste. Palate: Oily with lively carbonation.

REALLY solid double ipa. Doesnt hide its alcohol very well, but its initial flavors are so delicious and smooth that I dont mind that much. The punch from the alcohol at the end reminds me that I am drinking a mans beer, and thats always appreciated. I mean it. It is.

355ml bottle at home. Pours clear copper with a very nice pillowy white head, that stays around. Aromas of pine, resin, spearmint, and the pithy end of grapefruit. Faint toffee malt. Taste is a journey from lovely big bitterness, through to lemon tart, then biscuit sweetness. Full-bodied, oily texture, average carbonation, long bitter finish. Lovely stuff.

Hazy copper color, medium off-white head with a creamy texture. Grapefruit citrus hops with nicely balanced brown sugar malt. Overall the beer is solid but a little less than I expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What can you say? FW is one of the best all around breweries out there. They have such a large variety of beers and do a superb job in all the styles. Pours copper color with medium white head. Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, and bitterness. Flavors of well balanced sweetness and bitterness. This is another winner from FW!

1 Pint Bottle. Light hop aroma with a bit of fruit (tangerine) and prominent malty background. Pours clear medium dark golden amber with 1" off-white head that lingers and leaves lots of lacing. Very clean tasting. Lots of hop bitterness is balanced excellently with the caramel malt flavor. Because of its hop/malt balance and ability to hide its 9.5% ABV, this is a very drinkable DIPA. I really enjoyed this one.
Poured into a pint glass, orange/copper color. Smooth and crisp on the palate, was mostly sweet and slightly bitter. Nice balance overall and masks the almost 10% abv. Very nice
Copper with small head. Grassy hop aroma and taste. Bitter honey finish. Caramel, sirupy thick aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2013 Pours dark golden color with creamy white head. Intense aromas of sweet citrus. Sweet malt upfront followed by strong citrus, hops and finishes with bitterness of grapefruit. Well made beer but not sure if I like the imperial IPA style. Think I will stick with the Ipas

Crystal clear golden copper pour. Thick off white head. Massive grapefruit aroma. Accompanied by citrus and pine. Medium body. Big grapefruit flavor as well. No malt flavors are noticeable. Not overly bitter or dry but huge hop aroma and flavors. 

---Rated via iPhone

Draught at Falling Rock Tap House, Denver. Bright copper color and very well carbonated; tall white head. Bitter and dry, and full of hop flavor. Some pine and citrus. The malt sweetness is there but this beer is hops-forward.

35 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is caramel, grapefruit, peach, and pine. Flavour is much like the aroma  with a slightly bitter finish. ABV is well hidden.

Appearance: Pours copper color with great lacing.
Smell: A ton of citrus hops with grapefruit and tangerine being the most apparent. 
Taste: Piney grapefruit bitterness that is well balanced with caramel malts.
Mouthfeel: Very smooth for a double ipa. Not a ton of alcohol on the tongue for 9.5%. 
Overall: A great double ipa that allows the sweet malt side balance out the huge citrus flavor of hops.

12oz bottle at BD Newcastle. Amber orange pour, thin white head. Loads of grapefruit, orange and mango in the aroma - some light caramel too. Plenty of thick citrus and caramel in the taste; grapefruit, pine, light tropical stuff - really nice and juicy. Lingering juicy tropical fruits and citrus - good deal of residual piney bitterness too. Very good.

*On tap Maxs* Look: Nice shade of brass blonde, nice white lacing. Smell: Mellow tangerine with fresh grapefruit hanging in the background, faint alcohol, some grain sweetness. Taste: Citrus, nice herbal/ tobacco leaf, hint of resin, subtle malt sweetness, modest bitterness finishes clean. Feel: Medium-light body par carbonation. Overall: Hoppy goodness for sure. This brew sets juicy hop flavors to the front. Enough malt to entertain the hops on the palate. The alcohol is only present in the aroma, so this ale could get you in trouble. The modest bitterness is refreshing for a big beer like this. Is this an earthshattering DIPA? No, yet it holds its own in the West Coast Style. Recommended.
Smooth, smooth, smooth, smooth, crystal clear and great aroma for this strong double
Bottle nice orange body with Not very long lasting white head wonderful citrus and fruit aroma, taste is malt with some alcohol aftertaste is bitter with malt great beer
Bottle from Brewdog Birmingham; bright clear light copper pour with bubbly white head, big pine forest aroma, crisp bitterness the IBUs are high. Some grapefruit, mostly delightful.

Bomber. Pours a reddish orange with white head. Good lacing. Aroma is moderate to heavy citrus and malts. Taste is moderate to heavy bitter. Body is heavy, carbonation is soft to average. Long bitter finish. Great iipa.

Bottle from Conn Ave Beverage aged like a year and a half - pours murky with a creamy white head. Aroma is citrus, but not lemony. Taste has some nice bitterness, but its not obnoxious about it. Dry on the finish. Nice!

Wonderful grapefruit aroma. Clear amber with light lacing. Taste is a long, lightly bitter finish. The texture is creamy, almost milky. The 9.5% ABV is present but not overwhelming. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I like this beer. Good hop presence, but not too bitter. Definitely does not
Show its high alcohol level, which makes it easy to (over)indulge. Sweeter than many other imperial IPAs of the same caliber.

355ml bottle, had this straight after the Union Jack, pours golden brown with a small head, heavier malty presence of caramel & toffee, balanced with citrus, pine and resiny hop, more straightforward than the Union Jack but as good at least, with the extra alcohol. This drinks very smooth. Very good.

Bottled 06.06.13.
Golden, orange hue. 
Tropical fruit, strawberries, sturdy caramel malt. 
Big caramel malt sweetness, floral, grapefruit hops. Hardly no booze. 
Solid brew. Have had before, remember hops being more potent.

What a beautiful beer! Aroma over takes the room and floods you with smooth hoppy-ness. Light golden appearance with a slight white head. Very light and smooth palate that lends to a delicious taste. This was a gem of a DIPA, as it lived up to all of its hype. Highly recommend and looking forward to trying the Wookey Jack and Robust Porter.

BOTTLE.

Head: peachy, big, frothy, avg. retention. Colour: amber, clear.

Aroma: intense, citrus, pine.

Taste: intense, quite bitter, pine, a bit of maltiness, slightly salty.
Very nice beer. Lots of caramel and slightly sweet. Incredibly hoppy but not overbearing. A malty sweetish iipa.

On tap at Press 195.

Appearance is a bright clear amber color with a thin creamy head. Aroma is strong citrus: tangerine and grapefruit rind. Tastes much like one would expect from a double IPA. Definite citrusy notes in the flavor. Interesting palate. Hops attack right from the beginning with a strong bitter bite that fades quickly. No flavors stick out in particular. Somewhat of a boozy finish where you can very briefly taste the alcohol if youre paying attention. Good beer. I drank it while eating food which may have cheapened the experience (from some reason I cant drink double IPAS with food). Id like to try this beer again by itself and in my own tulip glass. Good beer, I liked it a lot, but it didnt blow me away.

Bottle. Pours bright gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma is resin and citrus fruit. Taste is heavy on tangerine on the back end, with resinous and other citrus notes. Carb is light and mouthfeel is creamy, making this a good bit different than many other DIPA's. Wonderful brew.

Pours with a fluffy foam head that is sticky and fades over time to hug my glass. The color is of a clear light orange. The scents are of floral hops, hints of pine, citrus, booze, sweet malts, and minor spice. In the flavor I caught a bitter bite, a slight dryness, booze, and semi sweet malts. The finish was of booze, bitterness, and malts. Overall its good but better fresh like all brews of this style.
On top at euclid hall. Pours beautiful clear pale amber. Piney aroma. Solid piney hoppy beer, could use some more malt but excellent nonetheless.
Great double IPA that I think needs more attention. Definitely one of the best on the market. Price for 22oz is very reasonable as well.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2016 Bottle from Belmont Station. Pours clear orange with a quarter-inch white head. Aroma has raisins, booze, and hops. Taste has sweet raisins, resin, citrus hops, with a bitter finish. Medium-full body, smooth mouthfeel. Very good.

Later: on tap at Italian Restaurant in Mountain View, CA. Brighter and fruitier than my recollection of the bottle version. Upping my score to reflect this.
Awesome double IPA on tap at the brewery outside santa barbara, super hoppy and strong.

Cold bottle.  This is only just over 2 months old, so it shouldnt have deteriorated that much.  Is a light orange colour, clear with a ring of white foam.  Smells softly of fruit salad sweets.  Body is medium and carbonation is high.  Taste - Some grapefruit and pine initially along with some pungent toffee malts.  Alcohol coming through quite strongly at the end.  Unbalanced and the alcohol is coming through too much, bringing a sharpness to the beer.  Its strongly hoppy but there are no defined flavours coming through.  Not good.

Ar: Tart orange and grapefruit rind - hints of pith, pine, and caramel.
Ap: Light amber-orange, crystal clear - medium off-white head with moderate retention - leaves a thin film cap and some suds on the edges.
T: Candied orange and lime up front - clean malt with a bready and toasty edge, but not too sweet - bitterness is very high, but extremely clean - pine, lemon, and grapefruit on the finish, which is very long and clear.
P: Medium body with high carbonation - finish is dry.
O: A stellar double IPA - big and bright hop flavor, and a clean malt and yeast profile - delicious!

Local brewery with a very nice double IPA. Delicious!!  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottled, from the fancy beer fridge of the tip supermarket in leipzig. rich shade of clear golden with a lasting head; aroma of pine, tinned stonefruit and caramel; more stonefruit comes through in the flavour, along with some zesty grapefruit and some warming alcohol, fair whack of bitterness. a clean and approachable double ipa

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2013 Bottle at a buddies house. Pour is beautiful bright orange with a white head. Although the bottle is 2+ months old, the citrus hops are still pungent and delicious. Floral, citrus(tangerine) hops but has a damp aftertaste that makes it seem flat. However I still feel like I?m drinking liquified hops. 

Re rate 4 month old but was kept refrigerated. Tasted fresher than the 2+ month beer. Dont know why

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2013 8/9/13 bottle bought from CBO. $4.50. Drank it at Mann before JEW concert. Huge hop notes. Great nose. Going to move into one of my top 10 IPAs ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flowery, citrus, spicy hops in the aroma. Bitter flavor with tangerine fruitiness. Big, bitter, spicy finish. Alcohols dries the finish but is otherwise well hidden. Very easy to drink for such a big beer.

Bottle @ home. Clear golden orange colour with a medium to full white head. Smells amazing.. Very fresh, strong hops, very fruity, apricot, pine, marihuana.. Tastes very bitter, crisp, hoppy, pine, fruity, grapefruit, fresh hops. This is just amazing. Full body without being to alcoholic (there is a slight burn though) and almost perfect carbo. The taste from a single sip just lasts and lasts.
Gedronken met dutchdrebus, goud bruine heldere kleur, witte schuimkraag, ruikt heerlijk, hoppig, fruitig, fris, beetje bomen, smaakt hoppig, fruitig, bitter, beetje alcohol, droog, goed in balans

Huge pine on the nose with some orange citrus. Taste is more citrus and malt than pine, but well balanced all around. Mouth feel is very vibrant yet smooth. Not too over the top, but still quite the mouthful. Awesome DIPA.

Bottle @ caesar, thanks much for sharing. Glowing hazy orange colour, medium foamy off-white head. Nose is pine hops, malty, creamy, fairly bitter, resin and caramel. Flavour has a good malty backbone, pine, lots of grapefruit. Medium bitterness. Very well balanced. Finish is fairly bitter, slightly sweet. Excellent!

Folks brought this back from Melbourne. Im sure it cant be fresh. My dad loves his double IPAs and he really couldnt find that great hoppy note that he digs. This was very banana focused with some heavy influence from dried fruits and toffee. It surely must be old because the big hop presence I was expecting just wasnt there
Cloudy golden pour little head. Aroma of grapefruit and orange. Taste of grapefruit and orange. Mostlt smooth with a kick at the end.

Pours a dark golden color minimal head with very light lacing. Aromas of grapefruit and hops. Excellent flavor with citrus and spice, a bit alcohol burn in the backside. Overall and excellent beer from a brewery I highly respect and appreciate. Wouldnt recommend as any type of session beer due to abv and almost overwhelming spiciness/flavor.

Very good. Easy drinking. Big malts, big hops and bitterness. But balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle poured into snifter. Pours a nice golden/orange with practically no head, only a tiny patch of foam with a tiny ring. Aromas are amazing! Very herbal AND floral, peaches are definitely there as some others mentioned, as well as a good amount of sweet malt. Alcohol is fairly well hidden but its presence increases quite a bit as the brew warms up. Taste is pretty sweet and bitter at the same time; a finely executed equilibrium. Body is medium-full with a slick-leaning-towards-oily-just-a-bit texture! Carbonation is pretty low, but that was to be expected. My first Firestone Walker; I?m blown away. This is a fantastic product from a fantastic brewery. I still can?t believe I?ll also have the Wookey Jack, Double DBA, and Parabola to drink! For me it?s an instant favorite in the DIPA realm. Bravo!
Bottle. Pours golden with an off white head. Aroma of orange , peach, mint , madly and pine. Flavor is sweet and somewhat bitter with some peach, malt and pine . Medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle, 22oz. A clear, golden beer topped by a dense, off-white head leaving lacings. Very peachy aroma, with grapefruit, some sweetish notes and a touch of general tropical fruityness. Full body, a tad too warming even for an DIPA. Sweet on the palate, with a touch of pale malts. Pine cones, peaches and some pineapple. And of course a nice bitterness lasting for a good while. Certainly a nice one, but a bit rough on the edges. 130803
Poured from bottle into glass. Pours a slightly hazy orange leaves a thin white head. Aroma is nice. Somewhat fruity but has a huge alcohol taste. (Almost to much) .

7/20/2011: Firestone Double Jack... Aroma: Grapefruit with a touch of pine/resin; malty sweetness evident. Appearance: Bright golden yellow color; ample carbonation; pillowy, off-white head. Flavor: Candied citrus; grapefruit, pine, basic herbiness; A LOT OF ALCOHOL; moderate bitterness. Palate: Medium-full and slightly creamy. Overall: DAMN good and packs a huge punch!
Draught at Piece in Chicago, IL. Rating #1071 for this beer.
Pours dark gold with a decent head. Huge grass, citrus and pineapple aromas. Really well balanced with serious malt contending with flavorful hops finishes slightly bitter, but hardly overwhelming.

Bottled, about 7 or 8 months old already I think, large sample. Slight hazy golden color, medium creamy white head. Aroma is still lovely hoppy, grapefruit, citrus, flowery, orange. Medium to high bitterness, but smoothly carried by bready and biscuity pale malt. Extremely refreshing, extremely tasteful. Wonderful balance. Just the way I love my DIPA.
From 22oz bomber with bottled on date of 3/15/13. Citrus and melon nose with a little bread. Good bitter/malt balance.

22oz bottle served in a snifter
Bottled on 1/4/13

A - Pours a clear brassy amber with a tight knit white head that retains well through the entirety of the glass. Pretty drops of lacing.

S - Sticky pine fills the nostrils, mandarin oranges, red grapefruit, dried stone fruit, pineapple, alcohol, has a bit of woody potpourri aroma as it warms up.

T - Sweet tropical and citrus fruit with mix of smooth green pine bitterness, mango and dried papaya stand out alot, candied lemon peels, the steely caramel malt has a cotton candy-like sweetness and rounds out very well. Finishes clean and semi dry with a green piney bitterness. The aftertaste consists of sweet citrus and thin caramel.

M - Very smooth feel, medium chewy body, micro carbonation, very nice mouthfeel.

A well crafted beer indeed. The aroma and feel are the beers strong points. A solid dose of hop flavor with just the right amount of bitterness. Citrus overtakes the pine as it warms, the malt is steely and sweet but has a lightness to it as well as a high quality character. I love every beer Ive had from this brewery so far.

Serving type: bottle

03-02-2013
Perfection. In the top 3 beers Ive ever tasted. Rich, full, smooth, subtle, balanced, and simply elegant..boy oh boy its delicious. Stunning. Wow. Love it.

Bottled June 21, 2013.
Appearance: The body is clear with an amber hue, the head is tall and dense with good retention, settling into a thin and sparse white coating.
Aroma: The aroma is bursting with pine, pineapple and mango with hints of grapefruit. Very nice.
Taste: Sweet malts of bread and caramel are balanced by a moderate pine bitterness with pineapple and mango with a slightly spicy and grapefruit finish. Very nice.
Palate: Huge full body with soft carbonation.
Overall: This is one of the best imperial IPAs Ive had, very nicely balanced with great hop flavor thats complex and intriguing. Well worth buying.

from bottle. pours a clear amber colour with a frothy white head. nice aroma of pine, herbs, grapefruit and toffee. average carbonation, medium to full body and kind of creamy texture. intense flavours of pine needles, grapefruit and toffee with a lot of herbs. decent, long lasting bitter and quite boozy aftertaste. great stuff!
Burly, as any DIPA should be. A great rounded tangerine body with hints of oaky vanilla contributed by the malt. Nice long complex finish.
Solid imperial. Theres an interesting banana note. Quite hoppy, quite rich, a bit boozy, which pulls out back for me. Delicious, though.

Pours a very clear orange amber with a nice sized white fluffy head that sticks around for a bit. Good lacing as it goes down. Smells is mostly resinous pine with some citrus and grapefruit peeking through very nice. Taste is more grapefruit... resin & pine dominate the end. Good bitterness, slightly oily mouth feel. Great double IPA.
Bottle. Thanks Ryan. Transparent gold, generous cap. Aroma is pine, caramel and citrus. Taste is very malt forward, with a hint of pine. Nice balance.
This is a perfect beer. Youve had it. I love it. Im guessing you do too. Wont go on and on. This is a great great brew.
Aroma is grapefruit but mild, appearance is golden taste is very balanced, overall gear ipa

This one did it for me. Complex flavor, great color with good head, strong dry smell and an amazing bite with a smooth finish. For sure made my top ten list of great beers to enjoy anytime. 

---Crozier
This beer has a lot of hop aroma with a citrus smell to it. The taste is very hoppy but has enough malt to mellow the 9.5 ABV. Overall i would recommend this beer. It is a very good Imperial IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2013 Bottle on 061513. Amber with a white head. Aroma has grapefruit, pine and light caramel sweet malt. Taste is piney bitterness all the way with some sweet malt backing up, finish is dry and bitter. Body is medium and very smooth, soft carbonation.

This is "port style" beer. Huge malty nose and palate - melted toffee, butterscotch and apricot compote. Reminds me of Australian desert wines. Beautifully balanced malt/hop profile that hides the 9.5% ABV. If IPA on steroids is to you taste, taste this one for sure.
Piney hops, some subtle peach and tropical fruit notes. Good balance of malt with the hops, both sweet and bitter with neither one overpowering the other. Very good.

Pours amber gold with a thick white head. Aroma of heavy malt and piney hops. Taste is very malty with slight citrus and piney hops. A bit too malty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Grassy; citrus aromas with roasty,malt, along with grapefruit and pear pallet. The perfect IPA to enjoy on any occasion

Muddy Orange Color, Rather Small Head Left Pretty Good Lacing. Pine Aroma. Grapefruit and slightly sweet up front while Pine and Bitter finish. Good Sticky and oily palate. Would not call it full body, but definitely above average. Nice high ABV, which you do not feel while drinking it. Real Nice. Got it as a trade from my neighbor, who wanted to try it and found that it was too bitter and too intense. Lucky for me. Enjoyed it and wishing I had more. Recommended.

Pours a crystal clear golden orange, with a small bubbly white head. Huge floral hop notes up front on the nose, a kind of warm spicy fruity smell, definite citrus, grapefruit and some nice caramely malt notes. Wow huge tasting beer, citrus hops explode in the front with a nice floraly and herbal taste, bitter grapefruit, and a nice bready malt character. Very well balanced, and lots of malt to cut through the bitterness.

Amber pour with a thick dense white hear with great lacing and visible carbonation. Sweet hoppy aroma tropical fruits strawberry a good sweet citrus and a big caramel sniff. Palate is well coated a bit aggressive in the carbonation. Flavor follows the aroma sweet tropical fruits mango is the leader. Lightly bitter finish a hint of grass. Delicious with a building alcohol in the finish.

This was tasted at a shared tasting, but the bottle had been cellared for a year or so. Appearance was a very clear amber, little head, decent lace. Aroma is loads of fruit, but Im getting more raisin and such than the big grapefruit. Maybe more apple and pear as well. Taste is great big hop, good bitterness, but balanced with good maltiness. Great beer!

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Intensive geur. Scherp in de neus. Bitter.

hay, herbs, leaves, citrus,leaves, floral, resin.
Pours a great peach color. Nice sweet honey and sweet citrus aromas. Flavour is nice caramel malts with a great citrus hoppy finish. Great dipa

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured clear, Orange/copper in color small white head and decent lacing on glass. Aroma is Malty, caramel and mixed in with some hops. Taste in the other hand is quite bitter and hoppy, malts are there an it is well balanced to the point the high ABV is no that noticeable but it is definitely all hops, sticky nice bitterness at the end. very nice beer.

not a big aroma--deep golden with nearly white head and decent lacing--light resin with floral/citrus hop--well balanced malt middle and pleasant bitter finish--just about what everyone else mentioned including well hidden 95% ABV--deliciously not too heavy but very flavorful

A shiny copper pour with a white head that fades into a pretty nice circle of lacing. The aroma is a fabulous concoction of sweet fruit and a hop undertone. The taste is on par as it deliciously sweet but never lets you forget that its a big and bad IPA. This is awesome stuff! Highly drinkable at nearly 10%.

Bottle from a USA friend! Thanks Nathan and Big Bear! Great DIPA which carries its abv very well indeed and has a great light (!) fresh finish, despite the usual hoppy oiliness on the front. Pretty good indeed but not quite 100% for me!

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 Super clear from draft. 14oz. Smooth and crisp...refreshing like a much lighter beer. No taste of alcohol, and it?s 9.5%. Clean like a West Coast IPA with slight piney-ness. UPDATE: Smells of so much pineapple.

draft pour at aces and ales in Vegas. deeper amber color, solid one finger off white head that recedes slowly. aroma is excellent...lots of citrus malt...grapefruit, citrus, lemon notes...not overly bold, but also not subtle. flavor is similarly great...lots of deep, clean citrus hop notes...getting both the grapefruit and the tangerine...other fruits in there as well...great malt backbone to keep this one balanced! palate rounds this beer out well..resinous, thick and coats the mouth perfectly...and drinks very easily for the abv. hope to have the pleasure of enjoying this beer again in the future!
Poured clear golden with a frothy white head. Aroma of bitter citrus over soft malt. Medium body, flavour of grainy malt, sweet mandarin hops with a swift sweet end.
great beer. excited to have firestone walker beer available in texas. great double ipa.

Pours clear, deep golden, slight off white head, nice lacing. Aroma is big sweet malt, caramel, toffee, fresh dough, big dank citrus, tropical hop. Taste is amazing, following the nose completely, never bitter, or overly sweet most balanced beer I?ve ever had, no alcohol taste. Mouthfeel is on the fuller side of medium, nice carbonation, slight alcohol heat, bit of spice. Overall tremendous one of the finest crafted beers I?ve ever had, up there with Pliny and Hop Slam, if I could get this in Ohio I would be broke.
Bottle. Aroma is pine and citrus. God solid body. Very malty but very hoppy aswell. Great balance. Bitter palate. Awesome.

Bottle, 12C. Clear pale amber with an inch of dense white head, low bead. Head fades a bit but laces quite well. Aroma of flowering citrus trees - grapefruit, oranges, limes - some peach, herbs, sweet wholemeal buns. Slightly syrupy, very low carbonation. Quite sweet with citrus oil and apricots, glossy sweet bread crusts. The malt side of things is notably (for a US pale ale) worthwhile here. Bitterness oozes in with citrus notes again, pine creeping in. A breath of alcohol and some sweetness with the citrus and pine at the pretty bitter end. Majestic.

Big malty grapefruit aroma. Dark golden amber with thin lacy head. Lively mouthfeel, medium body, with a slightly bitter warm finish. Big citrus and malt flavors make it somewhat sweet. Alcohol well hidden.
On tap at HOTB. Pours an orangey yellow. White lacing down the glass. Citrusy hop aroma. Oily feel and a slight bitter taste.

Bomber: herbal nose. Grand head on an orange brew. Dry but full bodied. Light on malt big on bitters. Smooth transitions from start to piney finish. ~m

0,65 l bottle BB 18. Feb 2015 
spruce, citrus, caramel, bread, dark golden color, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Nice hop aroma, which continues with the initial taste. Good level of bitterness that doesnt overwhelm the hop flavor. Hint of sweetness at the end, with a well blended kick of alcohol. Basically, the blend (hop flavor, malt flavor, bitterness, alcohol) is awesome.

12 oz bottle - pours hazy orange-gold, decent white head with good lacing. Pungent hops, pine, and oranges on the nose. Great bitterness and citrus fruit, resin on the taste. Medium-full bodied, long finish. Excellent brew. Yum.

Draft at Moriartys. Rich clear amber with an off-white fizzy/foamy head. Nice complex hop notes off the top. Great complicated hop flavors! Notes of: Blonde leather. Tangelos. Wildflower honey. Portobello mushrooms. Caramel. Sparkly orange. Great stuff!

Bomber. Golden, clear, big foamy white head with short duration. Nice lacing. Citrus aroma. Grapefruit bitterness. Didnt notice much malt. Pleasant citrus aftertaste. Very smooth for a DIPA. Maybe a bit too drinkable. Excellent D/IPA.
Deep golden in color, white head. Strong hops on the nose with light grapefruit and floral aromas. Moderate bitterness with a great hop taste, dry, excellent.

I absolutely love it when I crack open a bottle and the hops billow out with such loveliness. This is a big, juicy, fruity, sticky IPA. The aroma is one of the best Ive ever smelled and the flavor follows through.

Definitely one of the best double IPAs I have ever tasted. On tap, this beer was a nice amber color with a light, carbonated head. Smells of floral and citrus. Tasted really hoppy right of the bat, but finished ver, very smooth! Great beer!

Tried this in Todd English Pub at the Aria in Las Vegas. One of the, if not the best DIPA i've ever had. Very well balanced. I wish they sold it where I live.

Bottle at Rasmus, 10 / 6 2013. Orange, small white head, dissappear fast. Aroma, hops piney, sweet malty (toffee?), slight note of alcohol. Taste, piney, hoppy, malty. Maybe a bit to much carbonation, if I have to pick at something. Great beer.

Bottle.  Pours an orange-straw color with a nice head.  A lot of alcohol on the aroma, along with caramel malts and citrusy hops. Not super complex, but well-balanced and tasty.  Reminds me a bit of the Three Floyds Dreadnaught, which is never a bad thing.

Pours a golden amber with white soapy head. Has a strong malt background that helps balance the amount of hops used in this great double. Hits every part of the tongue.

From 12oz bottle dated 1/30/13 so loosing the hoppiness but ive drank this before from fresher 22s. Pours a medium gold tint with and small white head very quick to dissipate, water like pour. Tasted from a 22oz. bottle. It poured a clear amber with a white head. Aroma is mostly hop with a bit of malt. Heavy hop with bitterness.

Bottle to flute 
Tangerine, grapefruit, tropical fruit aromas with whisky notes. Clear light amber with a nice creamy long lasting white head with nice lacing. This beer us s reaming, 'drink me'. So I did, and its great...it's not often that the fruit aromas of an IIPA come through in the taste, but here is one. There's a nice malt character too and the requisite hoppiness. The mouthfeel is good too...creamy and oily with a late, but light alcohol burn. Great beer.

Bottle - Intense pine and grapefruit with some sweet malts in the background.  Clear copper with a thick white head.  Oily texture with a bit of alcohol burn at the end.  Orange citrus and resin, nice malts to mellow and a silky smooth finish.  Fruit begins to appear as it sits.  Great IIPA.

Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a tulip.

Double Jack is golden in color, with a little bit of a tangerine orange tint.  A sizable off-white head rolls up the side of the glass with the initial pour and leaves a nice web of sticky lace as the glass is consumed.

What I notice about the aroma is how well the different components come together.  Grapefruit citrus, resin, spicy pine, a bit of tropical fruit, and some light sweet malt notes come through.  The emphasis is clearly on the hops, as it should be.

The flavor is hop-forward as well with a subtle transition between the flavors.  At first some honey and pale malt come through, but that is quickly washed away by the wave of hop flavors.  Bitter grapefruit pith, orange rind, herbal notes, and spicy pine come through, with a bit of grassy bitterness and caramel sweetness right at the end.

How this beer feels on my palate is one of its strengths.  Not an overly full body, Double Jack is comfortable with a slightly fuller than medium body that lets the alcohol come through.  A gentle yet firm creamy carbonation mostly cleanses the tongue between each sip but leaves some hop residue as a reminder of the bitterness.  There is some residual hop oil and malt stickiness as well.

It took only one sip to be able to tell this was a high quality DIPA, and I expect nothing less from Firestone Walker.  Although I appreciate the nuanced bitterness and well-crafted nature of this beer, my true favorites are recklessly bold and do not impart much subtlety.

Bottle.  Pours golden and clear with a full white head.  The aroma is pure hop goodness, resinous and floral.  Flavor with moderate to heavy bitterness and dominated by hop with a faint maltiness.  Dry with no little to no sweetness.  A fantastic DIPA.
22oz bottled 2/2013. Pours a pale orange. Big citrus hop aroma, with a big citrus taste. Yummy!
Great amber color, strong floral note.  I prefer more malt/hop balance.  Little alcohol taste but lingering bitterness turns me off a bit.  Good beer but I prefer others in this imperial IPA class.

This is four months old but still excellent. Pours clear golden with pillowy head of foam and good lacing. Drinks with excellent balance overall - fruity head on the top with apple, tangerine and some perfumy florals. Malt has some presence as well. Finishes bitter with a little sourness. Great slick and creamy texture. Soft carbonation. Bottle.

Drank from tulip poured from bomber. Aroma - very nice citrus aroma from hops. Appearance - beautiful golden orange with nice carbonation and froth. Taste - very nice. Buttery and caramel with citrus hops. Palate - some sulfure/burnt mouthfeel. Not my ideal. Overall - good ipa. Still not my favorite besides the hype but tasty overall
Citrus (grapefruit) & pine aroma. Medium bitterness for the style. Medium body. Very drinkable for the ABV.

This is great. It has a strong hop aroma of citrus, stone fruit, piney, and faint scallion. Taste is a good malt backbone with lots of hop character and only a smidgen of booze. Finish is dry, crisp, and complex. Certainly a double worth trying.

Bottle Poured into ipa glass. Orange golden pour with a thick white head. Smells huge on grapefruit with orange rind and pine. Malty finish in the nose. Tastes citrus and grapefruit with a sweet malty middle and a bitter hop finish.
Bottle @CBC13. Hazy dark orange with big white head. Aroma of pine, oak, grass, citrus, malt and caramel. Taste is crispy and sweet; grapefruit, grass and lots of citrus. Very nice beer

The aroma of this beer is quite hoppy (floral, resin, and citrus hops to be specific), and the appearance combines a clear orange color with a large white head. The taste was very well balanced between a medium bitterness and a mild sweetness, and the mouthfeel combines a bitter finish, medium body, slick texture, and a soft carbonation.

A great imperial IPA, arguably one of the best there is. I will take this beer over a Hopslam, Hopwallop, Nugget Nectar, or anything similar, but I think that the style is overrated. The nose on this beer is one of the most recognizable Ive experienced (with regards to the Imperial IPA style, anyhow) because the drinker gets less citrus and grapefruit peel notes but a bit more pine and malt, which (thank God) differs from most imperials (which this rater contends pretty much all taste the same with little variation). As a server, if someone wants something hoppy, this is my go-to beer because it is damn good.

Bottle. Clear yellow with a thick good lacing white head. Smells juicy and crisp with pine, bread and biscuit. Same notes in the aroma with some mango and peach. Taste is medium sweet and bitter. Medium to full body, oily/creamy texture, soft carbonation. Crisp, smooth, balanced and hides the alcohol really well.

1 Pint 6 oz. Bottle. Pours golden/bronze, thick frothy head, which last relatively long. Aroma is hoppy with light citrus flavors, which is surprising for this beer. Thought it would have a more complex aroma. Taste is however on the spot. IBU are very high, seems higher than 100 and the alcohol content is noticeable but welcoming. The Palate is a blaze with life, carbonation is lively. Overall: Excellent Beer, a true craft beer champion.
Flaske: Gul klar øl med et flot kridhvidt skumhoved. Duften er velhumlet med vægt på citrus og let kattepis. Smagen sidder i skabet. I det hele taget en yderst velkomponeret øl.

Nicely balanced hoppy overtones with a citrusy hints with just the right hints of bitterness on the backend.

Pours golden with medium white head. Intense lacing. Aroma is of citrus, tropical fruits, malt, pine. Taste is of citrus, tropical fruits, pine, sweetness. Alcohol well hidden. Bitter. Palate: Medium body. A tad sticky. Overall: Very good.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2013 Good choice.  Big citrus flavor.  (Grapefruit)  I enjoy how the heat from the high abv is masked by the malt.  The hops is the most prominent flavor, though. (To my enjoyment)  Really liked this one.  A potential favorite.
Pours gold with large white head and lots of lacing.  Aroma of grapefruit and citrus hops.  Taste is the same with a large malty backbone.  Very nice.

Botled on 1/30-13. Pours golden with little head. Aroma is packed with fresh hops - melon, grapefruit, orange zest, even at more than three months it still smells really fresh. A very balanced malt note, straw and cereal-like, matching the pungent hop profile perfectly. The taste is amazing as well. Pungent hops all the way through, resting on a perfect and very simple malt foundation that has just enough body and crispiness to stand up to the assertive hop profile. The 9,5% dont show at all, and it is dangerously drinkable for the abv. This is an ideal double ipa for me - crisp and clean, although still pronounced malt profile, and a bright and citrusy hop profile. Excellent!

12oz bottle to tulip.  Pours a golden amber color.  Nose is pine, citrus, hops.  Flavor is hops, resin, citrus/grapefruit/orange with malt.  Reminds me a lot of Pliny the Elder - balanced and delicious.

Great double IPA. Very crisp. Decent lacing. Not overpoweringly hoppy. Seems like a nice change of pace from the knock you over with a blast of hops beers so prevalent today. Big taste. Great with pizza!

ery clear darkish gold pour with a very nice fat white head and real good lacing. Great hop aroma, a little sweet and citrusy. Flavor was a little sweet as well, more citrus and a slight fruitiness as well, not to mention a nice lingering dose of hops that lasted for awhile, very well done

3-20-13 bottling date. From Belmont Station

A: Pure copper color with a firm 1/4" head. Carbonation is drawn throughout the body. Slick off the glass.

N: Hops and malt in concert. Pineapple, spruce, and hints of mango. Theres an earthiness here, along with some honey melon, some sugar, and some grass. Not very strong or altogether alluring, though. 

T: Quite bitter with only a hint of sweetness. Theres a lot of the dry pine floor with a heavy leaf quality. Can be rather sharp around the edges. 

M: Some alcohol. Dry with a medium-heavy body. 

O: A good beer, but its missing a second gear to get it to the next level. Might be a lesser batch, too, as I recall having some that were a lot better. Would prefer a Union Jack to this one, though.

Nose is tantalizing.  Tropical fruits, tangerine, melon, doughy malt, nutty, grass and floral with a tad bit of spice in back.  Alcohol doesnt come to the nose at all.  Smells clean and vibrant.  You could describe the nose as glowing its so animated.  Taste follows the nose.  You are greeted with oily hop resins and bitter, those delicious fruits all juicy and some nutty flavor from the strong caramel malt that has more bread than you think.  Finishes dry with good bitter, earth and dank.  This was one of the most artful west coast DIPAs Ive had.  Everything in balance and playing off one another.  Bitter like crazy but not offensive.  Fruits were so juicy up against the alcohol dryness and hop bitter.  Alcohol is  a little bit on the palate but it belongs there.  You are left with the sweet taste of pine like a gracious afterthought.  Smooth, really smooth.  Original, strapping, unconfined.

Bottle:  Pours a glowing copper/orange color with a large creamy sand colored head.  Intense aroma permeates the room; citrus, pine, and caramel.  Potent.  The flavor highlights the quality of the indgrediants, but without being an abrasive hop bomb.  Huge citrus and tropical fruit notes, caramel, and lingering pine resin... all things good in a DIPA.  In my eyes, this really hits the mark for the style.
Amber in color with a good sized off-white head. Aroma is of citrus, oranges, pine, caramel. Taste is ripe oranges, pineapple, pine, resin, cypress needles.

Bottle. The look is clear, nice creamy off white head, and copper colored. The smell is pine, hops, orange, fruit, jumping, and great. The taste is hoppy, bitter, fruit, biting but not too much, pine, grass, and good. Pretty much exactly what I want in a DIPA. Well rounded and just really good.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2013 Perfect tangerine aroma thick mouthfeel balance that gets muttled through a bottle.  Nice brew good flavor not to bitter but your tongue will be tired by the end of a bottle.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a tangerine orange pour with a nice cream colored head. Nose is a deep citrus with sweet hoppiness and pine. Taste is sweet with good bitterness and full of myriad of citrus. Finish is sweet and bitter, with nice lingering. Quaff Score 9 / 10

Pours a golden with an off white head and sweet aroma of hops and citrus. Taste is bittersweet, lots of citrus, hops, pine, and pineapple with a warning bitter, long finish. Lots of hoppy flavor, and a very enjoyable DIPA

Clear dark golden with a medium white bubbly head. Intense fruity, grapefruit aroma with some piney resinous notes. Flavor is intense hopyness, orange/ grapefruit, strong hop flavor but balanced and not astringent bitterness, great. Medium to full palate, coating flavor, some alcohol warm but just enough to remind its there. Very solid.
clear amber, frothy white head. spruce, floral, pepper, citrus, caramel, mango, apricot, alcohol. medium-heavy bitter, medium sweet. medium body, oily feel. excellent
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2014 Draught at HOTB. Light head amber color good lace. Super pine aromatics. Ligg carb med bod mouthfeel with lighter then avg flavor for a double IPA. Very pleasant.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2014 Serving: from bottle--purchased at The Beer Junction.

Aroma: moderate pine hops and heavy citrus.

Appearance: small, frothy, off-white, initial head with fair lacing and fully diminishing longevity.  Clear, dark-yellow body.

Taste: lightly sour, grapefruit initial flavor and moderately bitter, grapefruit finish with average duration.

Palate: light-to-medium body with watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: very hoppy aroma without excessively bitter flavor. Interesting taste.  An outstanding IPA.

Smells very citrus with a nice hop aroma. Golden pour with a thick white head. Nice malt body, followed with a clean citrus taste. Very hopy, but perfect in my opinion. As the hops hit you a taste of pine develops. After a few sips your palate adjusts and you will understand the high ratings this beer gets.

Une bière dorée qui montre une tête respectable et une dentelle éparse.  Un bouquet imposant dagrumes.  Une salade dananas et de pêches.  Des biscuits au miel et des conifères.  Une superbe composition de parfums.  Des saveurs juteuses.  Un alcool introuvable dans cette explosion houblonnée.  Des fruits qui dégoulinent et des malts qui répondent avec intelligence.  Un profil amérisant qui respecte mes papilles.  Un corps qui répond au concept de la buvabilité.  Il est imposant mais jamais lourd, très facilement acceptable et bien aéré.  Étonnant.  Un tour de force pour ce type de monstre.  Une finale très étendue et très parfumée.  Une amertume inattaquable.  Une bière qui tire près de 10% et qui est si facile à boire?  Tout simplement incroyable.  (Merci Ben)

Great double IPA. Not bitter. Drank a bottle while having a pizza, it's also currently on tap at my local pub. Pours a nice head. Beautiful golden colour. You would never know it's ABV was so high when drinking it. A winner.

- pixels sent via Beer Buddy on iPhone

Un liquide de couleur doré avec un anneau de mousse.Au nez cest tellement frais,les agrumes,les fleurs sauvages.Au goût,une belle amertume qui assèche la bouche et le palais avec une fraîcheur remarquable et des saveurs florales en fin de bouche.Un mot DÉLICIEUSE !

Pours a very clear orange amber with a nice sized white fluffy head that sticks around for a bit. Good lacing as it goes down. Smells is mostly resinous pine with some citrus and grapefruit peeking through very nice. Taste is more grapefruit... resin & pine dominate the end. Good bitterness, slightly oily mouth feel. Great double IPA.

Pours a crystal clear, medium golden color with a short, off-white head. The head lingers no more than average time. Big pine resin bouquet with intermittently emerging citrus notes. The beer has an oily moutfhfeel. Pine flavor comes through immediately, but light-roasted barley malt breaks through to create a not-so-well balanced, but very well-engineered DIPA.

Clear golden orange pour with a nice white head. Great lacing. Aroma has grapefruit, pine, caramel, and mango. Bitterness up front that goes into pine and a blend of pine and tropical fruits. Subtle malt sweetness with a strong bitter finish that lasts quite a while. Pretty full body. Really good beer, but definitely not for someone who doesnt like IPAs.

Crystal clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is freshly squeezed grapefruit, jasmine, lychee, tangerine. Slightly creamy mouthfeel, well balanced with some sweetness and citrusy bitter finish. Taste is passionfruit, honey, grapefruit, bitter orange peel.

Pours a golden color. The nose is lemon, citrus, floral tropical fruit. Papaya, and star fruit. The pallet is bitterness followed a quick floral fruit burst the melts into a sweet maltiness that is finished with a growing bitterness that makes you want to drink more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of grapefruit, pine, with hints of tropical fruit. Pours a orange-amber with a rapidly dissipated white head and clingy lacing. The taste is similar to the nose. Pine, grapefruit, with a notes of tropical fruit in the finish. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. Moderately bitter. Overall, an extremely refreshing example of a double IPA. WOULD DRINK AGAIN.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2013 This is one of the best Double IPAs Ive tasted. Massive grapefruit flavors and extremely well balanced. Mouthfeel is THICK ASS STOUT. Just moved to California and this beer knocked me on my ass. Impressive. RIP Skankin Pickle.
This beer has it all full body, crisp clean flavor, great after taste and leaves you wanting more!! Man up and enjoy!!
toast, roasty, earthy, golden, clear, medium sweetness, medium body, long finish,

22oz bomber. Pours a light copper color with very little head. Aroma is very citrusy. Orange, pineapple, mango, apricot, and grapefruit. Taste mimics the nose. Just an abundance of citrus hops and tropical fruit.
Good, strong, bitter DIPA. Floral and citrus aroma. Very malty. The grapefruit and basil in the description definitely come through.

Brown bottle, 650 ml, purchased at Beer World (Catskill), savoured on January 11 2012; eye: coppery, clear, minuscule ring of tan head, no lacing; nose: resinous hops, pine, tangerine, grapefruit, malt, light toffee; mouth: resinous hops, pine, tangerine, grapefruit, malt, light toffee, dry finale in hops with presence of malt, full body, below-average carbonation, quite bitter, lightly sweet, harsh texture; overall: quite fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Bouteille brune, 650 ml, achetée à Beer World (Catskill), savourée le 11 janvier 2013; il : cuivrée, limpide, minuscule anneau de mousse fauve, pas de dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, pin, tangerine, pamplemousse, malt, léger toffee; bouche : houblon résineux, pin, tangerine, pamplemousse, malt, léger toffee, finale sèche en houblon avec présence de malt, corsée, carbonatation sous la moyenne, pas mal amère, légèrement sucrée, texture rugueuse; en résumé : bien bon
Poured very similar to the Union Jack with decent lacing. Strong hop nose followed through the mouth with heavy, heavy hops.

Unintentionally aged for about six months. What bitterness what's there is now almost completely gone. Still a huge citrusy nose and flavor. Light body. Time has done this well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I was expecting a much different IPA than their Union Jack (blind tasting), but only slightly more alcohol, hops, and citrus taste than the latter. Still, another winner from Firestone/Walker.

Pours a very clear golden with a touch of amber and average head.  Aroma is citrus and pine.  Very nice.  Taste follows the nose and is very clean and crisp.  There is a hint of sweetness which goes well with the strong hop profile.  Medium bodied with a bitter finish.  For the high abv this beer is surprisingly light.  A well done DIPA.

Draft at Capones. Pours a clear dark yellow, not quite amber. slight head. Aroma is pine resin and slight citrus. Taste is sweet, heavy on the pine, with some citrus pushing through. a little sweeter than i like a DIPA, but still good.

Stellar  floral aroma, switching off between hopslams and it was definitely not a let down. Great sweet taste a little less sweet than hopslam but overall a great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Wes. Aroma is sweet grapefruit juice. Flavor was not as complex as the nose, nor as satisfying. Nick described this as too sweet and not as much hop as Hopslam. I tend to agree with the exception of it being too sweet (I tend to like that). Anyway, pretty good beer. Above a 4 rating? No way. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark orange with a nice pillowy white head.  Aroma- a mix of pine resin and acidic citrus.  Taste- a bitter pine resin bite that turns into acidic citrus, and a little bit of malt sweetness. Finishes bitter.  This is one of my favirite double ipas
Bottle; sparse notes. Hazy orange body, thin cream head. Caramely nose and body with toast, pine, and strong alcohol notes. Robust, rich, and warming. Very good.
Golden with small white head.  Floral aroma, not very intense.  Taste is sweet and floral/citrus. Very nice and smooth IPA.  Palate is good, crisp and refreshing.  Very nice beer.

Bottle: A bit unclear and orangey coloured, mid-sized loose off-white head, moderate to complex grapefruity nose with a touch of toasted malt; solid bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied and pretty soft; pineapples and - again - grapefruits in the lingering bitter-toasty finish. A very pleasnt and well rounded brew

Bottle from 16 Tons, Eugene. Pours a deep golden orange, slight head, very lacy. Aroma is sweet and rich, pungent with grapefruit and lemon. Body is very complex, rich, creamy and then dissolving into biscuity malt, with finish becoming grassy and then sweet; so long! Loved Union Jack, the complexity here takes it to another level.
wow almost perfect. Is pliny better than this aw wow .  not boozy at all.well balanced . hopped to hell , nice. palate is a 10.

Appearance is clear with Amber color. Aroma is very rich in hop notes with clear citrus notes upfront along with lingering caramel, vanilla, musty, leather notes. Heavy bitterness with moderate sweetness. Full and smooth with long finish. One of the best imperial ipas ive had.
Anteckning från provningen: grape doft. Sjuhelvetes bra, men inte världens bästa
Big hop front in the nose with some underlying pine, spice, and a slight sweet mango. A delcious balance between the sweet mango and bitter hops. Just terrific.
Perfect golden colour, firm film of a head. Massive cascade aroma, some spices. Bitter finish with loads of exotic fruits and bitterness. Very solid DIPA.

Bottle from House of 1000 Beers.  Pours clear amber, egghell white head, fizzy and pillowy all at once.  Flowery nose, with pine and citrus, sugary candy bubble gum, the cheap Double Bubble kind.  Caramel backbone with flowery and earthy hop notes, same cheap bubble gum reference.  Not very bitter at all for a DIPA.  No lingering bitterness or astringency. Really scary at 9.5%.  Only a touch of vaporous alcohol.  Pretty solid.
Bottle. Pours gold with thin white head and good retention. Aroma is powerful citrus and a little pine and floral. Flavor is grapefruit and a little pine. Delicious.
On tap at Oskar Blues in Longmont CO.  Good DIPA - but Ill take my doubles from the east - like Abrasive and Hopslam...

From a three part tasting at Churchkey (Peeper, Corruption, Double Jack). Clearly the most complex of the three. Grapfruit, apricot, floral notes. Full bodied. Medium brown, slightly cloudy. Rich and tactile mouthfeel. Nice balance of hops and malt. Concentrated and complex.

On draft, pours light orange with a huge hop nose.  Large hop profile with notes of orange and grapefruit.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2013 A superb beer that made a brief appearance on tap in the Antipodes.  All aspects of the brew were in perfect balance and Id be nit-picking to find anything to fault.

Bottle from trade with skycracksopen, thanks!
Amber with an off-white head leaving lacing.
Aroma: peach, grass, clementine, light spices.
Taste: tropical nectar, caramel, quite bitter, vanilla, berries, a bit grainy, floral.
Medium bodied+.
Great stuff, would love to get it fresh on tap some time.
Light amber our with just a ring of head. Lots of fresh grapefruit and caramel on the nose. Lots and lots of fruit on the palate.

Bouteille 12oz, courtoisie de Fred. De couleur dorée foncée et claire. Nez de houblon résineux, moyennement herbeux et citrique avec des petites notes terreuses, fruité (agrumes, petites notes de fruits tropicaux), léger de malt sucré avec des notes de caramel. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture moyennement résineuse et légèrement huileuse. Goût amer de houblon moyennement citrique, légèrement herbeux, résineux et terreux (une amertume présente toute la gorgée) et accompagné dun goût fruité (agrumes, léger de fruits tropicaux) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de malt sucré, léger de pain et de carmael puis en finale lamertume prend une tournure plus résineuse et plus herbeuse avec la présence de notes dalcool. Post-goût long et aux notes sèches, amer de houblon résineux, moyennement herbeux, moyen-léger citrique et aux notes terreuses avec un goût fruité (zeste dagrumes) ainsi que de faibles traces dalcool.

Bottle from my Secret Santa, many thanks. Cloudy orange golden color with thick off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, piney hops, mango, tangerines. Taste, sweet malt, tropical fruits, grapefruit zest,  honey, lot of resin, floral hops. Dry resiny hoppy finish. Alcohol is dangerously hidden. Extremely tasty beer.

Bottled 12/26/12 so 8 weeks old. Pour has a bright clear golden color with a one finger white head that fell to a ring on the glass. Aroma has resins, perfume, and citrus. Mouth feel is medium and the carbonation average. Flavor brings in some bitterness, citrus, caramel malt, and a lingering finish.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2014 Deep golden peach colour. Piney bright smells. My sort of thing. Taste is grapefruit bitterness and big sweetness.Great DIPA, only criticism is the sweetness is perhaps too much for this palate.

Three weeks since bottling, 50°

Pours up a crystal clear golden amber body with 2" bone white head leaving decent lace. Nose and taste are exceptionally integrated and balanced juicy citrus, floral, and grassy notes. The medium mouth is so smooth. As usual with Firestone brews, full of flavor, yet balanced and smooth.

A lustruous golden color with a WHITe head! Looks clear and filtered. The aroma is floral hoppy resin and danky! The.palate is.mellow and therere no hint of the strength. Finishes like fresh-squeezed organic orange juice. Huzzah!

On tap, Pours a light golden color with a medium white head with great lacing. Smells of pine, resin, grapefruit, and citrus. Tastes of all the same things in the smell abv is well masked.  Mouthfeel is smooth and chewy with great carbonation and a dry finish. Overall this is in my top 5 favorite double ipas, perfectly balanced.

650 ml bottle kindly shared by Sigmund. Clear deep golden body with an inch thick off-white flyffy head. Fruity, piny pollen and berry hops notes on the nose. Most inviting. Complex hops aromas in the mouth too. Tropical fruits, salty hoppy bitterness that lingers. Theres a malty base there too. Medium to full body.

650 ml bottle, from CITTI-Markt Flensburg, Germany. ABV is 9.5%. Golden colour, moderate white head, Strong aroma of piney and resinous American hops, some fruity notes too. Sweet and distinctly hoppy flavour throughout, with floral, fruity and piney notes. Aggressive bitter finish.

On tap at The Compass Bar and Grill in Carlsbad, CA.

Clear, medium dark amber with off-white head and very good lacing.

Aroma of pine, caramel, tropical fruit, citrus, pineapple and hay.

Taste of pine, caramel, orange, tropical fruit, grapefruit, pineapple and grass with a sweet malty finish followed by a bitter aftertaste.

Medium body and medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2013 Draft from Livermore Saloon/Beer Baron during SF Beer Week.  Color is orange with a nice light head.  Taste has the usual Cali DIPA pine, citrus, carmel, with cascade & simcoe hops.  Very good DIPA, big big hops but enough malt to hide the 9.5% ABV, great finish.  One of my two favorite Firestone Walker brews and top 10 DIPA.

10.21.13 update: 4 pack from Safeway.  Great, balanced DIPA.  I still love this one.
Tap at church key.  Pine herb tangerine hops.  Taste is a straw slightly vegetal dough.  Too big.  Lacks finesse.   Didnt particularly care for the hop character.  Malt backing came across as messy.
Floral nose starts off with a bold body....perfectly balanced malts and hops . This beer is perfection for style.
#600. Hazy orange colour. Huge beer with hoppy aroma and backed by a big malted presence. complex. Similar flavours, viscous brew and a hint of caramlization. big hoppy brew and very very tasty.

Bottle poured a light amber with golden hues, thin white head that dissapated quickly and minimal lacing.  Aroma includes huge citrus notes and hints of pine and caramel malt.  Taste is very well balanced blend of citrus and palatable floral/resin hop bitterness.  Incredibly drinkable with ABV completely unnoticeable and flavors lingering after each sip.

Appearance: Cloudy orange golden color with a off white head. Nice lacing.Aroma: Caramel malt, fruity and grape hoppy.Palate: Full body. A bit sweet and a nice balanced bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Fruity and a balanced grape hoppy juice, on a solid balanced sweet malty background. Well hidden alcohol.Overall impression: Complex and lovely dipa. Personal stats: Bottle  from a trade with rlgk.
Bottle. My first Firestone Walker. Definitely a decent double IPA, but nothing that really sets it apart from other great IPAs for me.
Available year round, this is a go to for me. Citrus flavors with not too much bitterness.

10oz pour from tap into tulip, Pine and resin bouquet, pours with good white head which completely fades within minutes. Strong malt presence on the tongue. Hop resin aftertaste. Balanced well. Very strong.

Pours a clear amber with a large, sticky white-corn head. Smell is of herbal hops and enriched pasta, with notes of alcohol, and barley. Taste starts with sweet barley and, which segues into mealy whole-grain, and garden herbs. The taste is all tied together with a peppery hop bitterness, that lingers long after the sweet musk fades. Mouthfeel is crisp and slightly sappy. This beer hides the alcohol very well (other than a slight buzz half way through the review), and is less fruity than the commercial description would suggest. While fairly bitter, it is not all that citric.

Bottle (hate the switch to 12 oz).  Pours a clean orange with thin white head.  Aroma is juicy grapefruit, pineapple, nectarine.  Very fruity, citrus hops, solid bitterness.  This is exactly what I look for in an IPA.  When fresh this is easily one of my favorite IPAs.

2012 bomber to goblet. Pours between and honey and copper color with decent foamy white head.  Aroma is pine with some grapefruit and tangerine thrown in.  Some malt underneath.  Taste is sweet up front and quickly gives way to a piney, somewhat soapy bitterness.  The fruit sweetness intensifies as it warms up and the malt taste is there, but barely noticeable.  Decent mouthfeel with good carbonation.  Overall,  okay but nothing to write home about.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light amber color with foamy white head and good lacing.  Juicy fruit and grape fruit aroma.  Taste has malt sweetness at first with some caramel then transitions to a citrus rind bitterness and finishes somewhat soapy.  Moderate and somewhat sweet mouthfeel with semi high carbonation that helps scrub away some of the bitterness.  A good IPA but not my favorite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is an incredible ipa out of Firestone.   Little fruity to the smell and nicely bitter.   Goes down smooth and little aftertaste 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Into a tulip glass. Two and half fingers of head with great retention. The body is a clear, medium straw color.
The aroma is grapefruit with a touch of orange. Nice.
The taste is a bold bitterness beginning to end with a touch of honey at the end. Its a great DIPA profile with just enough sweetness.
A crisp texture with moderate carbonation and medium body.
A really nice DIPA.

Fresh citrus and earthy hop aroma with a slight toffee backing. Pours a light brown with a very large foamy white head. Chrystal clarity. Taste of grapefruit, tangerine, and herbal hops with a lovely toffee hop backing. Delicious.

Firestone Walker continues to impress me.  Double Jack is a great Imperial IPA.  It pours a deep orange color with a big head, and the aroma is pungent, grassy/floral hops and some citrus.  The hops are big in the flavor, too.  This is a true double.  But the malt is big, too.  Buttery and smooth, an slightly sweet.  I think of this as a slightly twangier Bells Two Hearted, which is a compliment.

Bottled on 08/30/12.  Huge hoppy nose, big pine and resin, big citrus.  Pours yellow-golden with a frothy off-white head.  Taste is very sweeet to the point of crushing the bitterness, theres a little lingering astringency and resinous quality but most of that bitterness is squashed out.  Some nice yeasty-bready notes, big citrus and juice, faintly herbal.  Crisp full body, alcohol is there but very well masked, more of a heft thing, certainly no burn (a little warming later on).  In small doses, this is a nice sipper, with pleasant fruitiness and uncommon intensity.

Great DIPA. Smooth. Hides the alcohol well. Tastes of pine and grapefruit balanced by the sweet malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Big bottle.  Solid double IPA. Lots of citrus aroma, nice bitterness.  Will be on my list when next in the USA.

12oz bottled on 11/2/12. Pours a clear golden amber with a fluffy white 2 finger head. Great aroma, tropical fruit, mostly pineapple with some grapefruit and a little pine. Taste is a good balance of sweet malt, citrus and pine. The 9.5 ABV is hidden well in the flavors. Medium bodied, pretty smooth with a medium to light carbonation. Picked this up as it was recommended to me by a guy working at the beer store and Im glad I did. Overall a great DIPA, nice and refreshing with plenty of balanced flavor.
22oz pour with a clear gold pour. Citrus aroma. Strong citrus grapefruit and orange taste.

Aroma is big spruce, citrus, grass, some caramel, bread.  Clear amber orange with white head that dissipates to a ring.  Irregular lacing.  Strong hop bitterness through and through.  Almost harsh.  It figures that now that Im finally getting to rate this Im not picking up as much on the malty sweetness that usually holds it together from the bitter start to bitter end.  I suppose thats the nature of this game, though -- snapshots in time.  Medium body, average carbonation, long bitter finish.  Overall:  this is one of my go-to favorites, but it probably wouldnt be if this rating was my first time with the beer.  I wonder how many other potential favorites I miss because of the circumstances under which we meet for the first time?

Bottle from Freebridge in Phillipsburg, NJ. Elegant aroma with flowery umbrella and citrus. Flavor a mix of orange and apple fruits with spicy herbal quality underneath. Aggressive malt tone in aftertaste with slight alcohol burn. I like how they mix the sweetness of the malts with sweet citrus hop tones. Very dry mouthfeel.
Decent double IPA, hoppy, sweet, stays on the palate. The hop flavor at the end is a little off putting
Great beer, would love to try it on tap. Will be looking into putting this one in the kegerator

Pours a nice amber orange color with an off white foamy head that lasts a decent while. Aroma is complex of citrus, pine, grapefruit, hops and mild orange. Flavor is initially bittersweet and bold malt and hop flavors with some pine as well. The finish is dry but hard to pick out if its bitter or sweet. Mouthfeel is full and carbonation is decent. Overall this is a solid beer.
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 Very sweet and syrupy going down. It quickly is replaced by extremely bitter hops and a citrus bite. Not bad but not the best imperial IPA Ive had.

Das Aroma ist tropisch-fruchtig nach Ananas, Grapefruit, Passionsfrucht, nur etwas Citrus-Hopfen. Im Antrunk erstaunlich trocken. Der Hopfen übernimmt gleich das Kommando. Der ist fast überdimensioniert, aber neben der Herbe auch ausgleichend aromatisch. Der relativ hohe Alkoholgehalt ist zwar nicht zu leugnen, aber keinesfalls spritig. Soweit so gut. Zu kritisieren bleibt die mangelnde Süffigkeit, denn das Double IPA lässt sich nur nippend konsumieren. Der Malzkörper ist für diese Hopfenstopfung einfach zu schmächtig geraten, sonst wäre eine bessere Wertung zustande gekommen. "Normale" IPA haben für mich daher ganz klar mehr zu bieten.

Bomber shared at GRMs. Clear deep golden with a thin white head. Strong pine, dust, dank, tropical fruit hops, strong grapefruit, a bit perfumed, black tea, lovely. Medium+body with reasonable effervescence. Strong fruitiness, decent pine/resin, strong, almost cloying honeyed malts, a fair bit of alcohol, perfumed, quite big, not entirely successful for me; sweet with strong bitterness and a long, perfumed, resinous, citrus finish.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2013 Aromas of juicy grapefruit, apricot, pine, and light caramel.  Clear bronze, off-white head, low retention.  Bitter, strong with boozy tones, lightly sweet, very balanced.  Full bodied and chewy, moderate carbonation, flavors fade quickly but leave a long, bitter but clean finish.

Ar: Burst of tropical fruits, pineapple, citric, resinous, grapefruit, mango, passionfruit, some perfume and maltiness under all the lovely hop notes, 
Ap: Amber colour, extremely creamy beige head, lots of lacing. 
T: big bite but also lots and lots of malts to balance it, lovely retro nasal action of tropical fruits, Behind the grapefruity resinous first onslaught. Long lingering bitterness, paired with a warming finish.
P: soft carbonation, full body. 
T: very nice indeed, Only downside is That for My particular taste the thick maltbase somewhat subdues the hops.

Beautiful double IPA. Hits all the right notes. Nice bouquet. Deep orange color. Hoppy, citrus flavor while not being crazy bitter. Perhaps a standard bearer for the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer is amazing.  Tried it with several other Firestone Walker beers one night and damn is it awesome!

The beer pours a deep copper color with an strong white head. The citrus aroma of grapefruit is noticeable as soon as the cap comes off the bottle. The flavor is full-bodied and rich in citrus fruit mixed with pine resin. The sweet malt comes through at the end. The mouthfeel is thick with a clean finish. An excellent and flavorful libation.

Golden pour with a white head. Complex blend of grapefruit, mango, peach, and orange fruits. Bread malt, pine resin, and grass are also present. Spicy, sweet, and crisp, though a bit too highly carbonated. Bitterness of the hops mixes with the alcohol and dominates the finish.
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2013 Spicy aroma with a hint of citrus. Perfect mouth feel; harsh, almost abrupt finish.

The best imperial IPA I have had to date. The color is a little misleading, due to the pale amber hue. One might expect a darker more ominous shade. The taste is surprisingly complex and yet subtle. One taste and I was singing it's praises. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A nice double ipa amber color light head its a nice ipa after my 2nd one its better warm. Dry after taste

Bottle, shared with BBGTC, Foffern and Gunnar. Pours a clear orange body with a medium white head. Nose is intense hoppy grass, fruit and syrup, cat pee, herbs, dry leaves and hints of caramel. Nice. Taste is fruity peachy tones, grapefruit, grass, cat pee, hints of apricot and parsley. Full body, soft carbonation. A straightforward, yet very solid and DIPA in all respects.

22 oz bomber. Medium copper color. Nice two finger head. Aromas of pine and citrus but mostly sweet malt. Hop flavored are masked by the malt but bottle may have been aged.  Pine and malt dominate. Not bad but I wont go out of my way to find again.
Very citrusy aroma with a hint of floral. Orange in color and very clear. Very citrusy in flavor.
bottle. amber with two finger head. kick ass west coast ipa. hops are wonderful. huge citrus. delicious.
